items.name: Weapon Proficiency:
items.entry: One martial or unique weapon of your choice.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A {@item traveler's clothes|PHB}, a {@item bedroll|PHB}, a {@item mess kit}, a {@item pouch|PHB} containing 1 gp and a memento from home.

entries.name: Feature: Mercenary Patron
entries: You gain the {@feat Eldritch Adept|TCE} feat, ignoring its prerequisite. When selected from this background you must choose one of the follow Invocations: Armor of Shadows, Beast Speech, Beguiling Influence, Eldritch Sight, Eyes of the Rune Keeper, Fiendish Vigor, Umbral Armour, or Gaze of Two Minds.

entries.name: Otherworldly Influence Table
entries: There are many kinds of criminals, and within a thieves' guild or similar criminal organization, individual members have particular specialties. Even criminals who operate outside of such organizations have strong preferences for certain kinds of crimes over others. Choose the role you played in your criminal life, or roll on the table below.

rows: When using your new ability, your eye flare with red light.
When your ability manifests, small red crystals grow from your body or an affected object.
Otherworldly whispers fill your mind when using your ability, urging you towards violent acts.
You occasionally have dreams of violence and fire, dominated by visions of a towering crystalline structure.
Sometimes, shortly after using your abilities, things appear different. Allies seem alien and violent and the landscapes twist into hellish vistas.
Use of your abilities is physically painful and leaves scars on your body that fade after a few minutes.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Use the tables for the soldier background in the Player's Handbook as the basis for your traits and motivations, modifying the entries when appropriate to suit your identity as a mercenary. Your bond could be associated with the company you traveled with previously, or with some of the comrades you served with. The ideal you embrace largely depends on your worldview and your motivation for fighting.

tools: one artisan tool or instrument of your choice

default: a tier 1 firearm with 20 bullets and 1 clip if applicable
an explorer's or a dungeoneer's pack

tools: one from Navigator's Tools, Vehicles (land), or Vehicles (water)

default: chainmail or leather armor and 3 javelins
a martial weapon and a shield or two martial weapons
a light crossbow and 20 bolts or 3 daggers

classFeature.name: Firearm Crafter
entries: At 1st level, you learn how to craft firearms. You can determine what firearm you can craft by its Tier. You gain access to new firearms as you level up in this class, and gain access to special firearms based on your Subclass. You can craft additional firearms on this table so long as you meet its Tier. A firearm takes a number of hours to craft equal to its Tier x 2. Its cost is shown in the Firearms table.

classFeature.name: MacGyver’d
entries: At 1st level, you become skilled at putting together ramshackle tools to get the job done.

As an action, you can use a set of artisan tools to create a one time use object for a specific ability check, choosing either Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma when it is created. When this object is used as part of an ability check, the user of the tool gets advantage on the check and adds a bonus to the roll equal to half your proficiency bonus.
After this object is used as part of a check or 1 hour passes, it falls apart. You can create objects in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all charges on a rest.

classFeature.name: Shoot to Thrill
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you gain the ability to make sure your shots count. As a Bonus Action, your next ranged attack with a firearm has advantage. If that attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all spent uses of this ability after you complete a short rest. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you regain a spent use of this ability.

classFeature.name: Gunner Archetype
entries: At 2nd level, you select a style of shooting in which to excel. Select either the Quickdraw, Sniper, Demolitionist, Buckshot or Hexlock. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level. Your Archetype is unique to you, and only you or another character with the same Archetype can utilize a special Firearm detailed in your Subclass.

classFeature.name: Gun Modifications
entries: At 3rd level, you learn how to craft modifications for your guns. Firearms may be able to have modifications applied to them, which is detailed in the Firearms list. It takes 1 minute to apply or remove a Modification from a Firearm. You learn 4 modifications, and learn more as you progress in the class.
If you apply modifications to a Firearm, only you (or another player that knows how to craft those modifications) can benefit from them. Below are your possible modifications.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Life Trajectory
entries: At 5th level, your relationship with the world is further defined by the weapons you carry. Choose one of the paths below and gain that feature, you gain a second feature at level 11 based on your selection.

Desperado. Your recklessness is your greatest asset. When you make an intimidation or stealth check, you gain advantage on the roll as long as there are no allies within 30ft of you. Succeeding on the check grants you temp hit points equal to your levels in Gunner.

Wanderer. You are at home on the road. You have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of hot or cold environments, you confer this bonus to your steed. In addition, you suffer no penalties for firing firearms due to being on vehicles or mounts.

Soldier. You serve to protect the innocent. You have advantage on persuasion or intimidation checks to protect others. In addition, if an ally within 60ft of you is hit by a weapon attack, you can use your reaction and expend a use of your Shoot to Thrill to make an attack roll against the attacker.

classFeature.name: Gunner Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your Gunner Archetype.

classFeature.name: Gunsmithing Adept
entries: At 7th level, your gunsmithing skills are enhanced. You can now repair a jammed firearm as a Bonus Action. Additionally, you have advantage on checks to learn or know information about firearms.

classFeature.name: Reloading
entries: At 7th level, you become extremely quick at reloading your firearms. You now gain these benefits:

entries.name: Clip
entries: You can now load an entire Clip as an Action.

entries.name: Barrel
entries: You can now load a number of shots into your barrel up to your Dexterity Modifier as a Bonus Action.

entries.name: Belt
entries: You can now reload a belt weapon with a loaded belt as a Bonus Action.

entries.name: Drum
entries: You can now load an entire drum in 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Dodge and Roll
entries: At 9th level, your reflexes can save you from harm. As a Reaction, when you would be hit by a ranged weapon attack (and can see the attacker), you can move up to half of your movement. As a part of this reaction, you can expend a use of Shoot to Thrill to make an attack with a ranged weapon attack.
At 13th level, you additionally gain the benefits of Shoot to Thrill if you decide to attack.
At 17th level, you can now move your full movement with this reaction.

classFeature.name: Gunner Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature from your Gunner Archetype.

classFeature.name: Defense Piercing
entries: At 11th level, your shots can hurt even the most resilient of foes. Ranged attacks you make with Firearms ignore resistance to piercing damage, as well as they are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

classFeature.name: Life Trajectory Improvement
entries: At 11th level, you gain additional features based on your earlier selection.
Desperado. When you make an Insight or Perception check and fail, you can expend a use of MacGyver’d to reroll the attempt.
Wanderer. You ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain, and you gain a swim and climb speed equal to your walking speed.
Soldier. Allies within 15ft of you have advantage on save to resist being frightened.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Dodge and Roll Improvement
entries: At 13th level, you additionally gain the benefits of Shoot to Thrill if you decide to attack.

classFeature.name: Gunner Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your Gunner Archetype.

classFeature.name: Deadeye
entries: At 15th level, your accuracy becomes pinpoint accurate. When you have advantage on a ranged weapon attack, your ranged weapon attacks now increases your critical hit range by 1.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Dodge and Roll Improvement
entries: At 17th level, you can now move your full movement with this reaction.

classFeature.name: Gritty Instincts
entries: At 17th level, you can no longer be surprised, and you have advantage on saving throws against the frightened condition.

classFeature.name: Merciless Shot
entries: At 18th level, your attacks injure your targets for more damage. Once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a ranged attack with a firearm, you deal additional damage equal to the difference between your attack roll and the target's Armor Class.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Second Nature
entries: At 20th level, you are so adept with firearms that they are second nature to you. You cannot misfire with a firearm, and you can ignore half cover, and treat 3/4 cover as half cover when making a ranged attack with a firearm.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level, you adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Battle Herald
entries: You’ve learned to fight by leading the charge and inspiring your allies. When you succeed on a saving throw or score a critical hit, you use your reaction to grant a number of allies equal to your proficiency bonus within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your proficiency modifier + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Blessed Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. They count as paladin spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the cleric spell list.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in total darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and on other weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Interception
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by 1d10 + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

entries.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

entries.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one maneuver of your choice from among those available to the Battle Master archetype. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain one superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Heat of Battle
entries: At 1st level, you are able to keep a calm mind even in the direst of circumstance. When you fail a saving throw, are hit by a critical hit, or use a technique on your turn, you can use your reaction to do one of the following things:

items: Move up to half your movement without provoking attacks of opportunity, or allow one creature within 30ft of you to move half their movement.
Make one attack or let one creature within 30ft of you make one attack.

entries: You resolve your effect after the effect that provoked it. You must be able to take your type of action after the effect that prompted it, meaning that if you are subjected to a condition that prevents you from moving or attacking, you cannot select those options.
You can use this ability once per short or long rest. At 6th level you can use it twice, and at 18th level you can use it three times before needing a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Martial Techniques
entries: At 2nd level, you learn techniques that allow you to maneuver yourself and allies on the battlefield. Techniques. You learn two techniques of your choice, which are detailed under “Techniques” below. Techniques can replace attacks gained through the attack action and allow you and your allies to gain advantages against your opponents.
You learn an additional technique of your choice at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

You can use your techniques a number of times equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier (minimum 1). You regain all your Techniques on a short or long rest. The number of techniques you can use before resting increases to 1 + your STR or DEX mod at 10th level, and 2 + your STR or DEX mod at 17th level.
If you use a Technique, you cannot use the same Technique again on the same turn.
Saving Throws. Some of your techniques require your target to make a saving throw to resist the techniques effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Technique save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

classFeature.name: Inspiring Aura
entries: At 3rd level, you become an inspiring figure on the battlefield. As a bonus action, you can activate your aura. At the start of your turn while the aura is active, you can grant one ally within 10ft of you one of the following effects:

items: You grant them advantage on one skill check they make before the end of their next turn.
You grant them temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. These disappear at the end of their next turn.
You grant them a bonus on one saving throw equal to your Constitution modifier that they make before the end of their next turn.

entries: Your Inspiring Aura lasts for one minute or until you fall unconscious. You can use this aura a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

A creature can only benefit from one Inspiring Aura at a time, even if they grant different effects. At 11th level, the range of your aura increases to 30 feet, and you can affect two creatures instead of one.

classFeature.name: Warrior Tracts
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a tract to follow while you stride through the battlefield. Choose Commander, Conduit, Juggernaut, or Protector, all detailed at the end of the class description. The Archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 15th, and 20th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can do one of the following, as you shift the focus of your martial practice:

items: Replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to wardens.
You can replace one technique you know with a different technique.

classFeature.name: Art of War
entries: At 5th level you gain proficiency in one artisan's tool, language, instrument, or vehicle of your choice.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Heat of Battle Improvement
entries: At 6th level, you can use Heat of Battle twice times instead of once per short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Tactical Might
entries: At 6th level, you’ve learned to leverage your techniques to deal even deadlier blows. When you hit with an attack as part of a Technique or hit with a weapon attack on the same turn in which you’ve used a technique, you deal additional weapon damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Additionally, when you use a Technique on your turn, you can use your reaction to use Heat of Battle.

classFeature.name: Warrior Tract Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Tract.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Warding Presence
entries: At 9th level, you become a bulwark of defense on the battlefield, shielding your allies from harm. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to choose to fail the save before you roll to protect your allies from the danger. If you choose to fail the save, choose a number of creatures within 15 feet up to your Constitution modifier that also have to make a Dexterity saving throw against the same effect. If they succeed, they instead take no damage, and only half if they fail.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Martial Technique Improvement
entries: At 10th level, the number of techniques you can use before resting increases to 1 + Strength or Dexterity modifier.

classFeature.name: Inspiring Aura Improvement
entries: At 11th level, size of your inspiring aura increase to 30ft and you can effect two creature instead of one.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Undying Resolve
entries: At 13th level, even death is unable to shake your resolve on the battlefield. When you drop to zero hit points you do not immediately fall unconscious, instead you remain conscious until you fail one death saving throw. Additionally, you gain advantage on death saving throws and regain one hit point on a 19 or 20 on a death save.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Warrior Tract Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Tract.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Martial Technique Improvement
entries: At 17th level, the number of techniques you can use before resting increases to 2 + Strength or Dexterity modifier.

classFeature.name: Advanced Preparedness
entries: When you reach 18th level in this class, you gain the ability to always be prepared for conflict no matter the cause. When you finish a long rest, roll 1d8. You can add the result of that roll to any initiative check before your next long rest. You can add the bonus after you make the roll but before you know the result. Once you add this bonus you cannot do it again until you finish a long rest.
In addition, if you ever start initiative without any uses of your Techniques remaining you regain one use.

classFeature.name: Heat of Battle Improvement
entries: At 18th level, you can use Heat of Battle three times instead of twice per short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Using the optional feats rule, you can forgo taking this feature to take a feat of your choice instead.

classFeature.name: Warrior Tract Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Tract.

feat.name: Bounce Master
entries: You've become an expert at making your thrown weapon hit no matter the situation. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can make attack rolls with thrown weapons against creatures who have full cover from you provided they are still within range and there is at least one clear path. When you do so you treat the creature as having 1/4 cover instead of full.

When you miss an attack roll with a thrown weapon you can make another attack roll against a different creature within the weapon's close range from the first target with disadvantage or have the weapon return to your hand.
You ignore half or 3/4 cover attacking a creature with ranged weapon attacks within 30ft
Being within 5 feet or otherwise too close to a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attacks
Gain proficiency in one artisan tool of your choice and any other tool of your choice.
You gain expertise in one tool of your choice that you are currently proficient in.

Choose one Artificer infusion. Once per long rest, you can place that infusion on an object. You can only have one Infusion from this feature placed on an object at once. You may only pick infusions that require a level requirement if you have the artificer levels required.
Whenever you gain a level, you may replace the Infusion known with a different one.

feat.name: Druid Initiate
entries: You have learned the magics of the beastial wilds and have gained a portion of of a druids ability to change shape, or heightened your already existing connection.

items: You gain a use of Druid's Wildshape ability, or an additional use if you already have the Wildshape ability. When you transform, you may choose a beast as if you were a 1st level Druid and Wildshape into any beast that is of a CR 1/6th your druid level that does not have a flying or swim speed, if you already have levels in Druid you can Wildshape into any beast CR 1/6th your druid level + 1, following the regular restrictions on Wildshaping. You can stay in this form for up to an hours and you cannot chose a form with an innate fly speed. This ability recharges upon long rest.

You learn one cantrip from the druid spell list, Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell. In addition, you learn one 1st level spell from the Druid list. You can cast this spell once per day without expending a spell slot, but can cast it additional times by expending a use of your Wildshape. Both the cantrip and 1st level spell granted from this feat can be cast while Wildshaped.
You learn 3 Tier 1 or 2 Gun Modifications, or 1 Tier 1 Gun Modification from a Gunner Subclass
You gain expertise in Gunsmith's Tools
You learn how to craft a Tier 1 weapon from a Gunner Subclass, and gain proficiency with that type of weapon
You gain proficiency in Firearms
You gain proficiency in Gunsmith's Tools
You learn 3 Tier 1 Gun Modifications
You gain proficiency with Firearms
Once per short rest, when you would misfire with a firearm, you may remake the d20 roll. If you roll higher than the misfire score, the weapon does not misfire
When using the Attack action with a one-handed weapon, you can use your bonus action to attack with a loaded firearm with the light property.

feat.name: Meditation Adept
entries: You have learned through quiet meditation or study how to still your mind and sharpen your focus. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency to one artisans tool or language.

You gain 2 Ki. If you already have Ki these are added to your total. You can spend one Ki and use a bonus action to still your mind, you can remove disadvantage on one attack roll or ability check you make in the next minute. You regain all spend Ki when you finish a short rest.

feat.name: Phalanx Fighter
entries: Your ability to fight cooperatively with other while protecting your allies grants you the following benefits:

items: While within 5 feet of an ally wielding a shield you and the ally gain a +1 to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A creature can only benefit from this feature once.
While within 5ft of a least two allies the first attack roll you make on your turn has advantage.

feat.name: Pit Fighter
entries: You know the ins and outs of unconventional and exotic weaponry. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with a weapon of your choice.
You don't suffer disadvantage when using thrown weapons when within 5ft of a hostile creature and both ranges of all thrown weapons increases by 10.
When you take the attack action you can use a bonus action to throw a net, bola, or make a Shove attack.
You gain a +1 to your Dexterity Score, up to a maximum of 20
Once per turn, any Bonus Action detailing reloading a Firearm for you is now ignored

item.name: Alchemic Claret
entries: This vial of blood-like substance emits a otherworldly power like nothing seen before. You can choose to imbibe this substance or apply it to a weapon.

If ingested, you gain the following benefits: For one hour, as a bonus action you can roll a hit dice + your level to gain that much HP. You then lose that Hit Dice until the end of a Long Rest. Once this feature is used the potion’s effect is gone.

If applied to a weapon you gain the following benefits: For one hour your weapon becomes magical. Additionally, you can choose to expend a Hit Dice to add the number rolled to the damage of any attack. Once you do so, you take Psychic damage equal to the number on the Hit Dice rolled. Once this feature is used the potion’s effect is gone.
This substance can also be used to Runesmith Blood Steel into Sanguine Steel instantly.
When a creature uses this consumable, they must make a DC:10 Wisdom save, on a fail you are Blood Starved.

item.name: Amulet of Average
entries: This golden amulet is adorned with the likeness of two different feminine visages on either side of its coin-like form.
While attuned to this item, the wearer gains a +1 bonus to all ability checks and saving throws made without proficiency.

Cursed. This amulet is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the amulet, insisting on wearing it at all times. You cannot unattune to the amulet while cursed in this way. A {@spell remove curse|PHB} or similar magic immediately unattunes the wearer, ending the curse.

Curse of the Average. While attuned to the amulet, the wearer suffers a -1 penalty to all ability checks and saving throws made with proficiency. Additionally, the wearer staunchly believes the amulet brings them good luck, and becomes hostile towards those who would attempt to remove them of the amulet.

item.name: Amulet of the Elemental Adept
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting that uses their Charisma
entries: This amulet is inset with four gems, ruby, sapphire, diamond, and opal. One gem always softly glows in an inner light. While illuminated each gem confers power to the user. While the ruby is illuminated your fire damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell burning hands|PHB}. While the sapphire is illuminated your cold damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell ice knife|XGE}. While the diamond is illuminated your force damage ignores resistance and you can cast {@spell zephyr strike|XGE}. While the opal is illuminated your bludgeoning damage ignores resistances and you can cast {@spell earth tremor|XGE}.

Each time you cast a spell from the amulet the illuminated gem changes, following this order Opal->Ruby->Sapphire->Diamond. Once a gems power has been used it cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

When all 4 gems are exhausted the amulet itself begins to glow. While in this state you have resistance to fire, cold, force, and bludgeoning damage. This state lasts for one minute before the amulet becomes unusable until the gems are recharged. When this state is activated, the wearing must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become possessed by the spirit of Vestkarl Thunderlance, a chaotic evil druid.
Each night, roll {@dice 1d4}, this determines the starting gem for that day:

items: Ruby
Sapphire
Diamond
Opal

item.name: Amulet of the Elemental Knights
entries: Once per month, as an action you can summon a {@creature Air Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM|Myrmidon}. The {@creature Earth Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM|Myrmidon} is friendly to you and will give its life to fight for you and protect you. The {@creature Fire Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM|Myrmidon} vanishes after its hit points reach 0, or a week passes.

The following Myrmidon can be summoned: {@creature Air Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM} {@creature Earth Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM} {@creature Fire Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM} {@creature Water Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM}

item.name: Anchor of the Deep
entries: The Anchor of the Deep appears to be an old, rusted anchor covered in intricate, weathered runes. When this anchor is used, it triggers a powerful magical effect that causes the entire ship to sink rapidly to the bottom of the sea. However, rather than resulting in tragedy, the occupants of the ship find themselves under the effect of the water breathing spell.

Breath of the Depths. Once per long rest, as an action, you can embed the Anchor of the Deep into the deck of a ship or a similar structure. When activated, the anchor triggers a powerful enchantment that causes the ship to sink quickly to the ocean floor, also everyone currently on the ship will gain the effects of the {@spell water breathing|PHB} spell as if the spell was casted on them. This lasts for 24 hours or until the anchor is retrieved and the ship resurfaces. To resurface the ship, as an action the user attuned to it must retrieve the anchor. Once the anchor is lifted, the ship ascends back to the surface, breaking the water's surface and returning to its normal state. It takes 1 minute to sink to the bottom or to float back up. The ship is unharmed from when it sinks.

item.name: Armor Piercing Rounds
entries: Effect. The firearm gains a +2 to-hit against creatures wearing armor, wielding a shield or using cover.
Restrictions. Cannot be used on an Explosive or Gas firearm.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Assault Shotgun
entries: Tier 5.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 8. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Automatic Rifle
entries: Tier 5.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.

Clip 30. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Bag of Shiny Bait
entries: A small pouch containing Morenstar Lake's special Shiny Bait, a glimmering gem-like item that has little value by itself, but is easily confused as valuable to the casual observer.
As a bonus action, a creature can remove one piece of bait and throw it up to 30 feet away.

If it lands within 30 feet of another creature, that creature must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn. On a fail, they must move up to their speed towards the bait and pick it up. The creature is not compelled to move in a way that obviously endangers them; for instance, over a cliff or through a known hazard. If the creature picks it up, succeeds on their saving throw, or if the bait is unreachable, they immediately discern it as a worthless item and are immune to this effect until the next dawn.
The bag contains up to 3 pieces of bait. 1 piece of bait reappears in the bag each day at dawn.

item.name: Banner of Lathander
entries: Crafted from a thick, red fabric, this banner measures 5 feet high and 3 feet wide. The bears the holy symbol of Lathander. It can be attached to a 10-foot pole to serve as a standard. Furling or unfurling the banner requires an action. The banner has the following properties.

items: Mark of Courage. As a bonus action, you can touch the unfurled banner and cause it to emanate courage. You and your allies are immune to the frightened condition while within 20 feet of it. This benefit lasts for 10 minutes or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Sentinel Standard. Undead of CR 5 or lower have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws when within 20 feet of the unfurled banner.

Standard's Shield. As a bonus action, you can touch the unfurled banner and invoke this power. Any ranged attack roll that targets you or an ally of yours has disadvantage if the target is within 20 feet of the unfurled banner. This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until the banner is furled. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Gift of Battle. You can transfer the banner's magic to a place by tracing the rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 500-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the banner to be within 5 feet of you and during which you choose creatures, creature types, or both that will benefit from the magic. At the end, the banner is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:
While in the 500-foot-radius sphere, the creatures you chose during the transfer process are immune to the frightened condition and gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and AC.

item.name: Bardiche
entries: Special. The special hooked head of the Bardiche allows one to bypass an opponent's shield. As a bonus action when you make an attack roll with the Bardiche against a creature with a shield you can have them make an opposed Athletic check. If you win then the creature does not benefit from the AC bonus from their shield until the end of your turn.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Bassinet Claws
entries: Special. As a bonus action you can extended or retract the claws from these knuckles switching your unarmed damage from Bludgeoning to Slashing while the claws are extended.
Hidden. A creature gains advantage on Sleight of Hand checks to hide a hidden weapon on their person. In addition, spotting a Hidden weapon on a person requires a DC 15 Perception check.

Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: Effect. You attach a blade at the end of the weapon, which can be used as a martial melee weapon that deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit. The Bayonet is not considered a firearm.
Restrictions. Requires the Two Handed property.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Beast's Bane
entries: +2 magic weapon.
Damage dealt to beasts and monstrosities (including lycanthropes in their hybrid or beast forms) cannot be resisted or reduced in any way.
While within 60 feet of a monstrosity or lycanthrope in their humanoid form, the blade glows a sickly green. The intensity of the glow increases as your proximity to the target does.

item.name: Big Dipper
entries: This heavy-duty fishing rod is a magic weapon only suited for the most enthusiastic of fishermen. While you are attuned to this weapon, you have the following benefits.
You can cast the following spells without providing material components:

items: {@spell druidcraft|PHB} (at will)
{@spell locate animals or plants|PHB} within an aquatic environment (3/day)
{@spell dominate beast|PHB} (save DC 15) on a beast with an innate swim speed (1/day)

entries: When you take the Attack action and attack with this weapon on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a cast of the Big Dipper's hook. The hook targets another creature of your choice, your size or smaller, within 40 feet. An unwilling creature must make a DC 15 strength saving throw to resist being moved; otherwise, hooked creatures can be moved up to 10 feet in any direction. The hook detaches from a creature at the end of your turn.
Proficiency with a quarterstaff allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

item.name: Blackened Ice Plate
entries: You gain a +1 to your AC, and you gain resistance to Cold Damage. You take no negative repercussions from Cold Weather.

Once per Long Rest, as an Action you can invoke the powers of an unrelenting storm. All Creatures around you must make a DC 17 Constitution Saving Throw and take {@dice 6d10} Cold Damage, or half as much on a Fail.

item.name: Blackpowder Bottoms
entries: Simple Invention.
Requires Light + Clip

Effect. This shoe can have a firearm attached directly to it, and with a trigger in the toe of the shoe, can be fired from the heel of the shoe without using your hands. Can only store 1/2 its normal clip capacity.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Blade of Darkinix
entries: This weapon provides a +3 to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
In all forms, it has the thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. Immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back to your hand.
You gain Immunity to Fire Damage.
Your Charisma Score becomes 20 if it is lower than that.
This weapon deals an additional {@dice 3d6} damage against Dragons.

This weapon is also considered a {@item Vorpal Sword|DMG} against Dragons, so long as they are at 100 hit points or fewer. If they are above this value, they instead take an additional {@dice 6d8} damage.

item.name: Blade of Hoaxaria
entries: This weapon provides a +3 to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
This weapon can only be attuned by a child of Hoaxaria/Cedaris.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
After making an attack with this weapon, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30ft of you.
You gain Immunity to Poison Damage.
Your Wisdom Score becomes 20 if it is lower than that.
This weapon deals an additional {@dice 3d8} damage against Dragons.
This weapon is also considered a {@item Vorpal Sword|DMG} against Dragons, so long as they are at 100 hit points or fewer. If they are above this value, they instead take an additional 6d8 damage.

item.name: Blade of Larsinix
entries: This weapon provides a +3 to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls.
This weapon can only be attuned by a child of Larsinix/Xanamil.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
In all forms, it has the cleave property, allowing the wielder to make their weapon attacks in a 5ft cone in front of them (can hit a maximum of 3 creatures at a time).
You gain Immunity to Acid Damage.
Your Constitution Score becomes 20 if it is lower than that.
This weapon deals an additional {@dice 3d8} damage against Dragons.
This weapon is also considered a {@item Vorpal Sword|DMG} against Dragons, so long as they are at 100 hit points or fewer. If they are above this value, they instead take an additional 6d8 damage.

item.name: Blade of the Golden One
entries: This ancient blade once belonged to the Golden Empress of Mere’su’ra, given as a betrothal gift from the Emperor of Kimatt. The blade appears as an opulently sheathed longsword but when draw can take on one of the following shapes.
Golden Strength. Your Strength score increases by 2 and your Strength score maximum increases by 2.

Astarte. This magical {@item longsword} hums with arcane energy. If you hit a target with this weapon on the same turn that you cast a spell, it deals additional damage equal to half your Arcana bonus.

Lunari. These magical {@item scimitar||scimitars} glow with intertwined golden vines. At the start of your turn while you have Lunari drawn, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your Nature bonus.

Piety. This magical {@item greatsword} carries with it sanctified light. When drawn it sheds bright light in a 15ft radius, this light is considered sunlight. Each creature hostile to you that ends its turn inside that light suffers radiant damage equal to half your History bonus.

Omega. This magical {@item warhammer} is rusted and aged yet holds ancient wisdom. While you have this weapon drawn, you can cast one cleric spell of a level equal to or lower than half your religion bonus. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.
Regardless of its form, the blade is a +1 weapon if the wielders Intelligence is 12 or higher, +2 weapon if the wielders Intelligence is 16 or higher, and +3 if it is 20 or higher.

Cursed. Upon touching this blade a creature becomes cursed. While cursed, they hold the blade in high regard and refuse to part with it. In addition, the creature is infected with the lust for conquest that Thilask once held. You desire to own land, things, and knowledge, only wishing to share these things if people pay you tribute in the form of gold, fealty, or faith.

You cannot become immune to the charmed condition, and you have disadvantage on saving throws to resist being charmed. Charmed effects on you last until the creature who charmed you is killed (or object is destroyed), regardless of their regular duration. Regular ways of dispelling charms still work. If the blade ever leaves your person, your Strength becomes 1, this lasts until you have the blade again or a 9th level Remove Curse removes the curse.

item.name: Bladed Net
entries: Special. A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is Restrained until it is freed. A net has no Effect on Creatures that are formless or Creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its Action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. On a failure, the creature takes 1d4 slashing damage. Dealing 10 slashing damage to the net (AC 13) also frees the creature without harming it, Ending the Effect and destroying the net. When you use an Action,bonus Action, or Reaction to Attack with a net, you can make only one Attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Blast Cannon
entries: Tier 3.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Blast Gun
entries: Tier 1.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Bolas
entries: Special. A Large or smaller creature hit by a bola must make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check verse the attack roll. If they failed, they are knocked prone. A bola has no effect on creatures that are form lessor that don't have legs. Creatures with more than four legs have advantage on the check.

item.name: Bonetooth Necklace
entries: This Necklace magically collects trophies from your hunts. You can spend an hour performing a Ritual to prepare a Hunt. A creature can only be hunted if;

items: You know their name, you have seen them in person and have spoken with them
They are a level or CR higher than your level
Wish you dead

entries: If a creature meets these conditions, you can Hunt them. Upon killing the target of your Hunt, a piece of them is magically added to the necklace.
You gain a +1 to attack rolls per trophy collected. At 5 Trophies, the item changes.

item.name: Boomerang
entries: Simple Invention.
If the Boomerang Misses, make a DC 15 Sleight of Hand Check, and on a success, it returns back to your hand successfully. Otherwise it lands in a random area within 15ft of the original target.

item.name: Boots of the Free Gales
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain a fly speed equal to your speed.

Stride of the Free. You can use a bonus action on your turn to disengage. When you are suffering from the Grapple, Restrained, or Prone condition you can spend 10 feet of movement to end the condition. When you do this each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you must make a DC 15 Str save or be knocked back 5 feet.

Curse. If you do not move your full movement on your turn you suffer {@dice 4d4} slashing damage as the agitated wind attacks you. Additionally, you feel uncomfortable in confined places, and you suffer disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws while indoors or underground.

Shackles of Carreshal. This item contains the spirit of a destructive elemental tempest known as Elitanith. While this cloak is not being worn by someone the enchantment magic holding Elitanith at bay begins to wane. After {@dice 1d6+2} days the boots vanish and transform into a portal into the Elemental Plane of Air. After {@dice 2d4+2} days the magic fails entirely and Elitanith is freed.

item.name: Bracers of the Mountain Cliffs
entries: You gain proficiency in Athletics, if you already have proficiency you gain expertise. Whenever you make an athletics check to push, pull, or otherwise move a creature you do so with advantage.

When you force a creature to move through an attack or spell they move an additional 10ft and take {@dice 2d6} Bludgeoning damage. In addition, if the creature has a fly speed that speed is reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn.
Curse. The heavy gauntlets weigh you down, your speed decreases by 15ft.

Shackles of Jurajuru. This item contains the spirit of a destructive elemental zaratan known as Cavalkal. While these bracers are not being worn by someone the enchantment magic binding Cavalkal to them begins to wane. After {@dice 1d6+2} days the bracers vanish and transform into a portal into the Elemental Plane of Earth. After {@dice 2d4+2} days the magic fails entirely and Cavalkal is freed. The bracers currently feel empty, it does not appear that Cavalkal is binded within them.

item.name: Breath Stone
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type
The following breath stones exist:

items: {@item Breath Stone (uncommon)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (rare)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (very rare)|TftJC}
{@item Breath Stone (legendary)|TftJC}

item.name: Breath Stone (legendary)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d12} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

item.name: Breath Stone (rare)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d8} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

item.name: Breath Stone (uncommon)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

item.name: Breath Stone (very rare)
entries: As an action, you can pop the stone into your mouth consuming it, unleashing a breath weapon effect. The breath weapon takes the form of a 15-foot cone of elemental damage. Each creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d10} elemental damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once consumed the breath stone is used.
Based on the color of the stone it determines the elemental damage type

item.name: Bren
entries: Tier 5.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.
Reliable Reliable firearms have their misfire score lowered by 1.

Clip 20. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Broomhandle Pistol
entries: Tier 2.

Clip 8. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Bulwark
entries: This magical shield projects an additional shield of force around itself when activated. As a bonus action, you can activate the shield to increase its AC value by +3. While in this state you also have resistance to force damage and immunity to the magic missile spell.

While the shield is activated and you succeed on a Dexterity saving throw that effects more than one creature you can choose to extend its protection to all allies within 30 feet. Each creature within 30 feet automatically succeeds on the Dexterity saving throw and suffers no damage or negative effects. You suffer the full effect of the saving throw as if you had failed the save. Once you use this ability the shield becomes inactive, and cannot be activated again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Candle of Brilliant Arcana
entries: These candles hold a powerful magical charge. When a magic item within 30ft of a candle uses a charge, you can have the candles restore its power. It regains an expended charge or use. After it has done so, the candle loses its magical ability.

item.name: Cape of Monologuing
entries: “And now, I shall reveal my master pla–”
“–CUT HER FACE OFF! AAAAAA!”

Time out! How often has this happened to you? A party of vagabonds arrives and just before you reveal the intricacies of your master plan, they start attacking. So uncultured! Thanks to the Cape of Monologuing, you’ll never have to worry about this again.

Yes, this is a very real item, and not something I just created out of thin air! As a...reaction...yeah a reaction, you conjure this cape out of thin air and time stops all around you for what seems like a minute. During this time, you cannot take actions, bonus actions, other reactions, or any movement...however you can monologue about your master plans. Also you can pace or whatever for dramatic effect, but you need to end up in the same spot, m’kay? After this, the cape explodes and is gone forever.
This is a real item. Obviously not something I made up on the spot because I’ve built this moment up in my head for two damn years, Todd.

item.name: Ceatus
entries: Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Chakram
entries: Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Claws of the Blue Dragon
entries: This magic claw can be attached to a melee weapon you are proficient in.
Once attached, it cannot be removed without the use of a {@spell Remove Curse|PHB} spell or similar magic.
If you unattune to it, the attachment remains however you no longer gain the benefits of this magic item.
While attached to a weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls made with that weapon.
Draconic Fury. When you hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, you can add an additional {@dice 1d8} lightning damage to the attack.

Draconic Venom. On a successful hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, the target must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become vulnerable to a lightning damage until the start of their next turn. If a creature is immune to lightning damage they become resistant instead.

item.name: Claws of the Green Wyrmling
entries: This magic claw can be attached to a melee weapon you are proficient in.
Once attached, it cannot be removed without the use of a {@spell Remove Curse|PHB} spell or similar magic.
If you unattune to it, the attachment remains however you no longer gain the benefits of this magic item.
While attached to a weapon, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls made with that weapon.
Draconic Fury. When you hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, you can add an additional {@dice 1d4} poison damage to the attack.

Draconic Venom. On a successful hit with a melee weapon attack using the weapon with the attachment, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

item.name: Compass of Seeking
entries: While holding this golden compass, you can speak the name of any location of which you have been before, and the compass will point to the location. If the location is not on the plane you are on, it will point to the nearest portal to that plane, including possibly leading through multiple unrelated planes to get to your target if no immediate portal exists.

The compass always points to the most efficient route, ignoring things such as human limitations, bodies of water, or gravity. If the compass can’t find a proper route, its needle will spin until a new name is spoken or a pathway opens.

item.name: Compass of the Guiding Arrow
entries: The Compass of the Guiding Arrow is a finely crafted magical compass that aids adventurers in locating specific items of significance. This compass is currently linked. This compass is treated as +1 {@item navigator's tools|PHB}.

Linking. To link or unlink to a specific item, the attuned user must be within 5 ft of the item and spend 1 minute concentrating on severing/connecting the connection. As if they were concentrating on a spell. You cannot link a new item if it is already linked.

Guiding Arrow. the compass's arrow constantly points in the direction of the chosen item. It provides a reliable guide, even if the item is hidden, obscured, but must be on the same plane of existence. The arrow adjusts its direction as the user moves, always pointing towards the desired object.

Protection from Interference. The Compass of the Guiding Arrow possesses a magical shielding that prevents external forces from manipulating or disrupting its guidance. It cannot be affected by spells or abilities that alter the accuracy of directional devices.

item.name: Creed
entries: You gain a bonus +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical firearm.
On hit, the weapon deals {@dice 1d4} extra necrotic.
If this weapon kills a target, that target returns as a {@creature zombie|MM} under your control. You can only have one zombie under your control from this weapon at a time.
Tier 1.

Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Cross-Shield
entries: Simple Invention.
If you do not move on your turn you benefit from the AC of the shield until the start of your next turn.

item.name: Crown of Crimson
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting that uses their Charisma
entries: You gain a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. When you would cast a spell that requires Gemstones as an expended material component, the cost of the gemstones is lowered by 100 for you.

item.name: Crown of Sun Peak
entries: This golden amulet bears an ancient Mere’su’ra symbol of the sun and is inlaid with precious stones. While you wear this amulet, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.

While you wear this amulet, your spells that create light have their radius or range increased by 10ft. In addition, any spell you cast that creates light is treated as being two levels higher when they are contested by a spell or effect that would try and extinguish it.

Effected Spells: control flame, dancing lights, light, produce flame, faerie fire, branding smite, continual flame, flame blade, flaming sphere, moonbeam, daylight, fire shield, dawn, hallow, holy weapon, immolation, wall of light, sickening radiance, investiture of flame, sunbeam, crown of stars, symbol, temple of the gods, holy aura, sunburst, prismatic wall.

item.name: Crown of the Everknowing
entries: This crown once belonged to the Golden Empress of Mere’su’ra who hungered to know everything in the world. This crown is inset with nine sapphires that glow with a soft blue light. A creature wearing this crown gains +2 to their Intelligence and increases their maximum Intelligence to 22.
While wearing this crown, you gain +1 max Hit Points for each tool or language proficiency you have.

Cursed. This crown is imbued with the Thilask’s lust for knowledge, which infects the wearer. You will go to great lengths to learn and hoard secrets. Gaps in your knowledge irritate you and you will try to fill them whenever possible.

Whenever you fail a History, Nature, Arcana, or Religion check, one of the seven sapphires on the crown will light up. When all seven gems light up, you suffer 20d10 psychic damage and have disadvantage on any Intelligence saving throws, attack rolls, and ability checks for one week. If this damage reduces a creature to zero hit points they turn into a Nothic. If the crown ever leaves your person, your Intelligence becomes 1, this lasts until you have the Crown again or a 9th level Remove Curse removes the curse.

item.name: Cursed Catalyst
entries: Once per week, you can invoke the Catalyst's power to attempt to alter a Cursed object, and can perform one of the two effects. Both effects take an hour to complete the ritual.

Extraction - Touch a Cursed Object, and based on its rarity, make an Arcana Check (DC 11 for Common, DC 13 for Uncommon, DC 15 for Rare, DC 17 for Very Rare, DC 19 for Legendary, DC 30 for Artifact). On a success, you can remove a Curse from that object. The Curse is then placed into the Catalyst, and now affects the Catalyst.

Malediction - You can place Curses on Magic Items. Make an Arcana check based on the items rarity (Same scaling as before, must be done on an already magical item), and on a success, you may either place a Curse you have absorbed into the Catalyst onto that object, or place a Curse from this list onto the object. If you remove a Curse from a Magic Item that was created by the Catalyst, it is destroyed.
Curse of Loyalty - You are unwilling to part with this item, and grow hostile to anyone that would try to take it from you.
Curse of Withering - Each time you finish a Long Rest attuned to this item, your Maximum HP is reduced by 3.
Curse of Burning Soul - If you were to die, your soul is sent to the Nine Hells.
Curse of Ill-Luck - You gain a -1 to all ability checks.
Curse of Vulnerability - You are Vulnerable to either Fire, Cold, Lightning, Acid or Poison damage (you decide what type when applying this curse).
Curse of Undead Attraction - Undead Creatures with an intelligence of 8 or lower will instinctively attack you if they are within 60ft of you.

item.name: Damascene
entries: Effect. When using the firearm for a performance check, you have advantage.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Dark Storm's Voice
entries: This magical hammer grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
The hammer constantly hums with the power of the storm and is cloaked in a dark shadow and when called upon can unleash the fury of the storm.
As an action, you can make one melee weapon attack which increases your reach by 30 feet and deals thunder damage instead of bludgeoning damage.
While in darkness or dim light, the maul becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this maul's bludgeoning damage ignores damage resistances.
Additionally, you can use the hammer to cast {@spell thunderwave|PHB} with a DC of 14.

item.name: Deneith Cave Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: expend one hit die and regain that much hp.
Use a maneuver. The maneuver stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 and your superior die is 1d6 for the maneuvers.

item.name: Deneith Oasis Gemstone Fragment
entries: To use the fragment you must have it on your person. Once per dawn the fragment can be used to do one of the following things.

entries.name: As a bonus action
items: regain a first level spell slot.
Cast a first level spell. The spell stored in the fragment is listed below based on the color of the shard. The DC is 13 for the spell casted through the fragment.

item.name: Docent (Combat Morph)
entries: To attune to a docent, you must embed the item somewhere on your body, such as your chest or your eye socket.
This docent can be merged onto a second docent, allowing the owner to switch between any possible morphs with an action.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: A docent is a sentient item of any alignment with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. It perceives the world through your senses. It communicates telepathically with you and can speak, read, and understand any language it knows (see "Random Properties" below).

entries.name: Combat Support
entries: Whenever you end your turn without making use of the docent’s abilities your AC is increased by 1 until the start of your next turn, in addition it has several random abilities.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: A docent has the following properties:

{@b Damage Types}. Damage Types. As a bonus action, the docent can fire a beam of energy of either fire or radiant, as well as {@dice 1d4} additional damage types: (1) cold, (2) acid, (3) thunder, (4) force. This beam uses your spell casting bonus (if you have one) or your Intelligence + proficiency. On hit it deals {@dice 1d10}+1 of your chosen damage type.

{@b Skills}. As a bonus action, the docent can Help you with one of the skills it knows. It knows up two skills (roll a {@dice d4}): (1) {@skill Athletics}, (2) {@skill Acrobatics}, (3) {@skill Stealth}, or (4) {@skill Perception}.

{@b Spells}. The docent knows up two of the following spells and can cast each once per long rest, requiring no components (roll a {@dice 2d6}): (1–2) {@spell hellish rebuke}, (3–4) {@spell shield} or (5–6) {@spell absorb elements}. The docent can cast the spell without requiring your reaction.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A docent is designed to advise and assist the warforged it's attached to. One of the simple functions of a docent is to serve as a translator. The docent's properties are under its control, and if you have a bad relationship with your docent, it might refuse to assist you.

item.name: Double Barrel
entries: Tier 2.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 2. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Double-Barrel
entries: Effect. When using your bonus action to make an attack with a light firearm, you can make two attacks as a part of the same bonus action.
Restrictions. Requires the Light property.
Archetype. Only Quickdraws can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: Effect. The firearm deals an additional 1d8 fire damage. If the firearm activates pump, this damage is doubled.
Archetype. Only Buckshots can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Drilling
entries: Effect. Can declare attacks as Drilling, ignoring the shotgun feature. The range is doubled and the cone is removed.
Restrictions. Requires the Shotgun property.
Archetype. Only Buckshots can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Drum Upgrade
entries: Effect. All of this firearm's clips are converted into drums, which each triple their ammunition capacity.
Restrictions. Requires the Clip property.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Dual Doors of Knox
entries: These dual doors where wielded by a fire giant dread naught who *hated* doors. he hated them so much that he ripped the seal off a cloud giant hoard room and used them are his shields.

+2 magic weapon AND +2 shield. You must be wielding both items to gain their benefits. {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning, cast {@spell knock|PHB} once per LR, can target up to 9th level magics that are considered "locking" or "sealing".
Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.

item.name: Dusty Falcon
entries: Tier 5.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.

Clip 8. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Eclipse Sol
entries: This simple blackened sword hilt is covered with delicate Celestial runes.

As a bonus action, the wielder can bring the blade to life, if it is currently day a vibrant golden blade of light springs to life from the hilt, if it is currently night a dark blade of shadow appears instead. The light blade deals {@dice 1d10} Radiant damage and the shadow blade deals {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage. If the blade is summoned during an eclipse, or on a plane that does not have a day or night cycle it instead summons a twilight blade of light and shadow. This blade deals {@dice 1d8} necrotic and {@dice 1d8} radiant.
The blades summoned gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

When a creature is reduced to zero hit points with this blade a small mote of light breaks off from the blade and orbits the wielders head. This mote can be grasped as a bonus action, allowing the wielder to make a ranged spell attack (+9 to hit) against one creature within 120 feet. The beam deals {@dice 3d12} radiant damage on hit. Up to 4 motes can orbit the wielder at once. If the blade is deactivated or dropped all motes vanish.
While the blade is active the wielder can teleport at will. Teleporting requires two feet of movement for every foot traveled.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Egg of Seeking
entries: "What an eggscellent and eggsquisite artifact, we can’t eggnore or eggscuse its ability to eggsecute. Indeed we must eggspress that we are eggstatic at its eggsplosive eggspertise, though we are egghausted. How eggciting to see something so eggstravagant, it’s eggceptional…"
"Captain...wha...what was that? Did you plan that? Is this why you were an hour late to the crime scene?! People were murdered!"
\...Eggsactly."

When you break an Egg of Seeking, it reveals the location of any purposefully hidden objects, entrances, containers, persons, and the like within 100 feet for one minute. When this happens, that which is purposefully hidden is enveloped in the illusion of a brightly-colored egg. The hunter of such should then easily be able to poach the location(s) of what is hidden as long as it resides on the same plane of existence.

item.name: Electrolysis Orb
item.reqAttune: Spellcaster that can cast 5th level spells or higher
entries: This metal orb hovers around the user and requires no hands to wield. The Orb retains its magical properties while within 120ft of its owner, and leaving this radius causes it to slowly hover back to its owner at 30ft per round. Upon casting a 1st level spell or higher, the attuned can move the Orb up to 30ft (before or after the spell is cast).

It grants a +2 to your Spell Save DC and Spell attack rolls. The orb can be fitted with 4 plates of a Rare Metal (requiring 1 hour of work and smiths tools in hand, no downtime required), granting the effects of their Weapon Bonus to your Spell attack rolls if it can be properly applied. The plates can also be removed by spending an hour.
The owner of the Orb can give the Orb Commands as a Bonus Action. Below are its possible commands.

items: Static Wave - The Orb pulses with electricity. All creatures within 15ft of it must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your DC or take 3d8 lightning damage (half as much on a success).
Reflector - The Orb pulses with a protective field. All creatures within 15ft of the orb gain 1d8 + your casting modifier Temporary Hit points.

Positioner - The Orb channels your magic through it. Until the start of your next turn, spells you cast originate from the Orb instead of you. Alternatively, you can use the Orb to reposition Line spells with the orb acting as a point of rotation.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.

items: {@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +2 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Weaver Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +3 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Weaver Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +4 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Weaver Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Enchanting Catalogue Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets to enchanting magical objects.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the recipe for one magical item of the books rarity or lower, determined randomly, or gain a +5 bonus to an Arcana check in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Arcanist, Appraisal Shop, Jeweler, or Weaver Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Art, Music and Literature
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Musical Instruments and Artisan Supplies.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Combat and War
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Weapon Attack Rolls.

item.name: Encyclopedia of Inventions and Technology
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Tools Checks

item.name: Encyclopedia of Social Culture
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to Persuasion and Deception
