item.name: Encyclopedia of the Lands and History
entries: While on your possession you gain a +1 to History and Nature Checks

item.name: Energy Driver
entries: This metal disc can be affixed to a belt, bandolier, armor, or other things. It contains the power for rapid change. After completing a Long Rest, one of your spell slots becomes 1 slot higher (must select a slot equal to or lower than your proficiency bonus, even if you are not of the level for that spell slot, must remained attuned to retain this benefit), or if you don't have spell slots, you gain a 1st level spell slot. Additionally, you learn to cast 2 spells based on your alignment.
Good - Heroism
Neutral - Absorb Elements
Evil - Last Light
Lawful - Compelled Duel
Neutral - Sanctuary
Chaotic - Chaos Bolt
The Energy Driver has room for up to 2 additional parts to be added to it.

item.name: Etched Pentagram
entries: Effect. As a bonus action, you can summon this firearm into your hand. As a bonus action, you can dismiss the firearm into a pocket dimension.
Archetype. Only Hexlock can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Evercure Potion
entries: This Golden potion swirls with small strands of light seemingly flowing within it. As an action, a creature can drink or administer the potion to another creature. Their body is refreshed, as they are affected by the Greater Restoration Spell.

item.name: Explosive Lobber
entries: Tier 2.

Explosive 5. Upon a hit, everything within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + the firearm's tier x2) or take an additional damage equal to the damage roll. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Extended Barrel
entries: Effect. The firearm's normal range increases by 10, and its long range increases by 40.
Restrictions. Requires the Two Handed property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Extended Clip
entries: Effect. The firearm's clips can now store twice the normal amount of rounds.
Restrictions. Requires the Clip property.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Eye of the Tempest
entries: This sapphire eye houses the remaining spiritual energies of Laradrin, the Ascendant Tempest. Any creature with the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature that touches the eye must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to replace one of their eyes with this one. While within an eye socket this eye functions as a regular eye. However, it can also perceive magic, while you have the eye with the Eye of the Tempest in it open you are under the effects of the Detect Magic spell. Due to the confusing nature of only perceiving this through one eye, if you have both eyes open you have disadvantage on Perception and Investigation checks.

While within an eye socket the host creature can draw on its energies. They learn the Empower and Transmute Metamagics, adding these to their known Metamagics if they have them. Once per long rest they can use the Empower Metamagic on a spell dealing Lightning damage without expending any Sorcery Points. Once per long rest they may use the Transmute Metamagic to transmute any spell into Lightning damage without expending any Sorcery Points.

The Eye of the Tempest is cursed and cannot be willing removed. A remove curse allows it to be removed for 1 minute, during which time a creature must succeed a DC 15 Medicine(Dexterity) check to successfully remove the eye. On a failure, the host takes {@dice 2d4} slashing damage and {@dice 4d10} psychic damage.

item.name: Fate Coin
entries: As a reaction you can flip this coin into the air and place your fate in its hands. Roll {@dice 1d2}.
On a 1, your next roll becomes a natural 20 and you have advantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
On a 2, your next roll becomes a natural 1 and you have disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.
After the coin has been flipped it bursts into sparkles.

item.name: Fiendish Syringe
entries: Innovative Invention.
As an Action, you can administer the Syringe into a dead creature instantly taking the creature's blood. The Blood is the correct amount to act as a Magic Item reagent.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Knowledge (Onyxphire Crow)
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.

entries.name: {@creature crow|WDMM|Silver Raven}
entries: This onyx statuette of a crow is embedded with sapphire tears. While within darkness it can be activated, becoming the Wereraven Lavore. This transformation lasts for up to 6 hours, once used it cannot be used again for 7 days.

Lavore is a lawful Neutral military historian who studied under the Sapphire dragon Traz'zyn, the Supreme Tactician. He has an intelligence of 18, wisdom of 10, and charisma of 9; Speak read and write in Common, Draconic, Deep speech, and Gnomish; He has extensive and narrow knowledge on the history of Illusion magic, extraplanar travel, Lolth's arachnid decedents, and aberrations with innate psionic abilities. He has a +9 bonus to intelligence checks to recall lore from any of these areas of expertise (including his intelligence mod).

item.name: Flail of Disruption
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a fiend or an undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra {@dice 2d6} radiant damage. If the target has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature becomes frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
While you hold this weapon, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Flamethrower
entries: Tier 2.

Gas 5. Gas weapons do not require to be loaded, rather attached to them is a tank of fuel. A gas weapon uses one unit of gas per attack, and can attack until the tank is depleted. A Gas tank can be refilled by spending 1 minute per unit refilled. You cannot store additional units of Gas, except within the weapon itself.
Cone 10. Cone weapons attack in a cone with a length equal to their value, using the attack roll rolled on all creatures within its cone area.

item.name: Flaming Blades
entries: Innovative Invention.
This weapon has channels where oil can freely flow between to keep the blades alight.
As an Action, you can ignite the Blade with fire. While lit, they deal an additional {@dice 1d6} Fire Damage.

They stay lit per a number of successful attacks landed equal to how many doses of lantern's oil they have inside, which is stored in the pommel. They can store 5 doses worth. It takes 1 minute to fully refill the pommels with oil.
These weapons also make for great tools for performers looking to spice up their act.

item.name: Flayer Slayer (Very Rare)
entries: Carvings of decapitated mind flayers adorn this greataxe’s metal blade. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greataxe.

An Aberration hit with this greataxe takes an extra 1d12 slashing damage. If the Aberration is currently grappling a creature, the Aberration must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or release each creature it is grappling.

If a flying creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to hold the greataxe aloft and cause it to flare with light. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll, and it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the start of its next turn.

item.name: Friction Holster
entries: Effect. When drawing this light firearm, you can draw another one as a part of the same action.
Restrictions. Requires the Light property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Frostwail
entries: This maul of ice and ivory bears a never melting heavy head.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magical weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon you deal {@dice 2d6} cold damage.

When you land a critical hit the maul head explodes dealing {@dice 3d12} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 10ft of you. The maul head then takes {@dice 1d4} rounds to reform, during this time the maul cannot deal damage.

item.name: Future of Chromaticism Dragon Masks
entries: These masks bear the visage of oneself realized as a Chromatic Dragon. regardless if attuned or not, the magic of the mask remains bonded to the being that is bound by infernal contract to Tiamat. Some features persist even without being attuned, and can not be undone except by being removed from the Infernal Contract.
The Dragon masks are no longer cursed, and lose their Cursed effects. Instead, the wearers gains the following Madness effects:
{@item Blue Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is an art, and should be seen as such. There is elegance in outwitting foes, and your battles should herald acclaim.
{@item Black Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat and victory is more than about winning, its about instilling fear in those who are beneath you.
{@item Red Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is a necessary tool that none wield better. The world is rightfully mine.
{@item Green Dragon Mask|RoTOS} - Combat is a new opportunity to proves one's intellect. Fighting fair would be holding back.

If you are to die, and not revived within 1 day, you are reborn as an Adult Dragon of your associated colour. You can choose to transform early into your Dragon, but cannot undo this form afterwards. Alternatively, after 100 years pass (dead or alive), you transform into an adult dragon.
As an Action, the wielder can change this into any melee weapon they are proficient with.
While attuned you gain all other benefits of the masks and,

You gain an associated Breath Weapon of a Young Dragon of your colour, recharging on a 6. Your creature type is considered Humanoid/Dragon. As a part of a 1 minute ritual, you and all of your equipment (except for the associated Blade) can transform into a Young Dragon of your colour. You retain your mental statistics, but not class/racial features. Dropping to 0 hit points or after 1 hour passes transforms you back. Each time you do so 1d4 years is removed from your timer.

item.name: Gauntlets of the Frigid North
entries: While you wear both of these steel gauntlets, any non-magical weapon you grasp with either gauntlet is treated as a magic weapon.

As a bonus action, you can use the gauntlets to cause ice to envelop one or two melee weapons in your grasp. Each icy weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. The ice last until you sheath or let go of either weapon. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
In addition, you can touch one 5-foot cube of water and cause it to freeze for 1 hour.

item.name: Githyanki Warbrace (Astral Dragon)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: This combination Armbrace and belt depicts the visage of a grand astral dragon with amethyst inlays. This brace was once made for elite warriors of Vlaakith, but have since been lost or are not in production, although it is still possible to create new ones with materials from various planes of existence.
This item was blessed through Vlaakith, and she would not want this to be muddled in any other way. You cannot combine this item.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to AC equal to your (Intelligence/Wisdom/Charisma) modifier
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on Acrobatics Checks
You gain a bonus equal to your Constitution saving throw for maintaining concentration on spells equal to your (Intelligence/Wisdom/Charisma) Ability modifier

entries: When you activate this brace, roll 1d3, on a 1 you use your Intelligence modifier, on a 2 you use your Wisdom Modifier, and on a 3 you use your Charisma modifier
This effect lasts for 1 minute. At the end of its activation, you gain 1 level of exhaustion and are stunned for a 1 turn.
The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Githyanki Warbrace (Unawakened)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma greater than or equal to 15
entries: The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
As an action, you can activate this brace and gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet
You gain advantage on Acrobatics Checks

entries: The brace can be activated in this way 3 times and you regain 1 use per long rest. You cannot end this effect early.
If the attuning creature has access to Psionic Energy Dice, the Telekinetic Feat, or the Telepathic Feat, they gain access to the following ability:
Astral Blade: When you attack with a weapon while the Warbrace is active, your attacks are considered magical and can add 1d8 Force damage once per turn.

item.name: Glider
entries: Complex Invention.

This folding device contains a flexible cloth that is able to take on the weight of 1 Medium or smaller creature. This device is stored on the wearer's back, and metal rods connect to the apparatus that run down the wearer's arms. As an Action, the wearer can Prime the Glider. While Primed the wearer's range of motion is slightly more limited, causing disadvantage on making melee attacks, sleight of hand checks, and preventing the use of a Shield.

While primed, the wearer can use a reaction when falling more than 10ft to begin to glide. The Glider allows the wielder to fall harmlessly down, gliding a number of feet forwards equal to the distance they would have fallen. A creature using the Glider can only fall a maximum of 60ft in a round, as it slows descent.
If you take 5 or more fire damage while using the glider, the cloth burns up causing the wielder to begin falling. A new cloth can be replaced onto the glider for 25gp.

item.name: Gloom
entries: This blood-soaked rapier has taken countless lives and is suffused with its previous wielder's malice. Attacks with this magical rapier gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While in darkness or dim light, the blade becomes shrouded in shadow becoming nearly unperceivable. While shrouded in shadow this blade's damage ignores damage resistances.

item.name: Gold Standard
entries: Tier 5.
Semi Auto. As a Bonus Action, you can activate or deactivate your Semi Auto. Semi Auto overrides the Sniper's restriction to Extra Attack and Multiattack.
Standard. Standard weapons gain two additional damage die per Extra Attack or Multiattack the wielder can make, and cannot make the Extra Attack or Multiattack action.

Sniper When you make an attack action with this weapon, each attack you could have made with that action is instead consolidated into one attack, where each attack you could have made instead increases the weapon's damage die per attack. Snipers also have disadvantage to hit a creature within 15ft of them.

Clip 12. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Grand Intelligence Mutagen
entries: A creature can use an action to inject this mutagen into their brain stem. The creature doing the injection must make a DC 30 Medicine check on a failure the injected creature suffers one level of exhaustion and an additional level for every 5 below the DC.

Once injected the creatures Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores all increase by 1 up to 20. The creature also has disadvantage on Strength saving throws. The effect lasts until removed by a wish or magic that remakes a creature's body such as Reincarnate or Wish.

item.name: Guileless’ Guide Vol.
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.

items: {@item Guileless’ Guide Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Guileless’ Guide Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Guileless’ Guide Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Guileless’ Guide Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Guileless’ Guide Vol. I
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Store, Stablehand, or Taxi/Landlord Wage Progression by 1.
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless’ Guide Vol. II
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Store, Stablehand, or Taxi/Landlord Wage Progression by 2.
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless’ Guide Vol. III
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Store, Stablehand, or Taxi/Landlord Wage Progression by 3.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Guileless’ Guide Vol. IV
entries: This guide contains self-help tricks on improving your charisma and social standing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a 10% discount to one purchase in downtime, provided it is an object of the same or lower rarity as this tome.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Store, Stablehand, or Taxi/Landlord Wage Progression by 4.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Hand-Bomb
entries: Simple Invention.

On a successful hit, the Hand-Bomb explodes. All creatures within a 15ft cube of the point of detonation must make a DC 13 DEX Save, taking {@dice 3d4} Force damage on a fail or half on a save (If the bomb detonated while being thrown at a creature, they have disadvantage on the save).

On a miss, the bomb lands at the feet of the targeted creature. The bomb will then detonate after the end of your next turn, or if the bomb would take radiant/force/fire/thunder damage before that point.
The bomb can be picked up and thrown again in this time period, or diffused by making a DC 13 Tinkers Tools (INT/DEX) check. Failing this check immediately detonates the bomb.

item.name: Handcannon
entries: This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.
There are the following versions:

items: {@item Handcannon MK I|TftJC}
{@item Handcannon MK II|TftJC}
{@item Handcannon MK III|TftJC}

item.name: Handcannon MK I
entries: Innovative Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

As an Action, the wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.
It requires 3 Actions to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 2.

item.name: Handcannon MK II
entries: Complex Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

The wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.
It requires forgoing 3 Attacks to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 2.

item.name: Handcannon MK III
entries: Complex Invention.
This miniature cannon can be wielded effectively with two hands, like a heavy crossbow.
Proficiency in the Heavy Crossbow allows you to add your proficiency bonus with this weapon.
It uses small cannonballs as ammunition, 10 of which can be bought for 5gp.

The wielder can ignite the fuse on the end of the cannon and fire it. Make a ranged attack roll (range 120ft, with no long range). It travels in that line until it hits a creature's AC, or it reaches the end of its range. A Creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 4d10} + DEX Bludgeoning Damage.

It requires forgoing 2 Attacks by the wielder to Reload. If the wielder has the Crossbow Master Feat, this is lowered to 1. Additionally, the wielder can use a Bonus Action to progress the reload of this weapon by 1. Minimum 1 attacks required to reload the cannon.

item.name: Harvester
entries: Complex Invention.

Using 4 hours of time, you can carefully extract sap from plant matter. To extract things, one must place the correct amount of a crop's harvest into the machine and monitor its extraction. Below are the current crops that it can use and their production rates. Additionally, for all plants and those without unique options, they are granted an option based on their rarity.
4 Rusty Spriggs -> 1 Random Uncommon Seed
1 Dead Kelpglider -> 1 Aquatic Companion Seed
10 3-leaf False Clovers -> 1 Reroll with advantage
10 Rock Gum Roots -> 1 Weakened Sovereign Glue (must be used within 1 week, loses stick after 1 day)
1 Gem Root Seed -> 50 gp diamond
10 3-leaf Golden Clovers -> 1 Reroll with advantage
40 Ironoak Berries -> 1 Ironoak Seed
16 Noble Willow Leaves -> 1 Noble Willow Sap
8 Common plants product -> {@dice 1d4} enriching fertilizer
8 Uncommon plants product -> {@dice 1d4} robust fertilizer
8 rare plants product -> {@dice 1d4} fortifying fertilizer
8 very rare plants product -> 1 Permanent Robust fertilizer
8 legendary plants product -> 1 Permanent Fortifying fertilizer

item.name: Heart of Ice
entries: You gain resistance to Cold Damage. If you already have resistance from another source, this either becomes resistance to Necrotic Damage, or immunity to Cold (your choice).
Your Charisma Score and its maximum increase by 2, up to 30.
Whenever you succeed on a Saving Throw, the Amulet bursts with Ice. Your next weapon or spell attack in the next minute deals additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

item.name: Heart of the Empire
entries: This golden amulet is in the shape of the monumental pyramids of Mere’su’ra, a favored piece of jewelry of its tragic empress. When in direct sunlight it glows a soft golden.
Golden Heart. Your Constitution score increases by 2 and your maximum increases by 2 as well.

Heart of the Mind. When you fail a Death Save instead of marking a failure, you reduce your Intelligence by 1, this intelligence drop cannot be mitigated through any means. If this drops your Intelligence to 0, you die instantly. Intelligence lost in this way is regained on the last day of the month.
Greater Diviner. While on your person, Divination spells of 5th level or lower do not require spell slots to cast.

Cursed. Cursed. Upon touching this amulet a creature becomes cursed. While cursed, they gain boundless compassion similar to Thilask the Empress of Mere’su’ra. You instinctively trust people and cannot think about lying, answering openly and honestly to those you encounter. You automatically fail Deception and Insight checks and the saving throws of any effects that would force you to tell the truth.

You are unable to benefit from any illusions that would obscure your appearance or effects that would shape change you, such as polymorph or wild shape and similarly magic items or spells that prevent creatures from reading your thoughts or learning your creature type don’t work on you. Should you ever take off the amulet or lose it your Constitution becomes 1, this lasts until you have the amulet again or a 9th level Remove Curse removes the curse.

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.

items: {@item Herbalist Helper Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the use for one plant, potion, or poison of a rarity lower than this book, determined randomly.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner, or Alchemist Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time and does not require the use of downtime.

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the use for one plant, potion, or poison of a rarity lower than this book, determined randomly.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner, or Alchemist Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time and does not require the use of downtime.

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the use for one plant, potion, or poison of a rarity lower than this book, determined randomly.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner, or Alchemist Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time and does not require the use of downtime.

item.name: Herbalist Helper Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets of medical knowledge, plants, and poultices.
It can be read over 1 week to learn the use for one plant, potion, or poison of a rarity lower than this book, determined randomly.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Gardening, Doctor, Poisoner, or Alchemist Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time and does not require the use of downtime.

item.name: Hidden Track
entries: Effect. The firearm gains the hidden property.
Restrictions. Requires the Light property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Hollow Point Rounds
entries: Effect. When you critically hit with the firearm, you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit.
Restrictions. Cannot be used on an Explosive or Gas firearm.
Archetype. Only Quickdraws can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Hookblade
entries: This bracer contains a retractable two-pronged climbing tool.
There are the following versions:

items: {@item Hookblade MK I|TftJC}
{@item Hookblade MK II|TftJC}

item.name: Hookblade MK I
entries: Simple Invention.
This bracer contains a retractable two-pronged climbing tool.

As an action, the wearer can deploy (or retract) the climbing tool by pressing a button (this is considered using an item). While deployed, the wearer had advantage on ability checks made to climb surfaces. Additionally, the wearer can hang from a wall they are climbing with only the hookblade secured into the wall, freeing up a hand.

item.name: Hookblade MK II
entries: Innovative Invention.
This bracer contains a retractable three-pronged climbing tool.

As a bonus action, the wearer can deploy (or retract) the climbing tool by pressing a button (this is considered using an item). While deployed, the wearer gains a climb speed equal to their walking speed. Additionally, the wearer can hang from a wall they are climbing with only the hookblade secured into the wall, freeing up a hand.

item.name: Hunter's Pistol
entries: Tier 1.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

While in the off-hand, the wielder can use a reaction when targeted by a melee attack to fire the pistol at the attacker, granting a bonus to their AC equal to a roll of the pistol's damage die. (this deals no damage and expends the ammunition)

item.name: Icebreaker
entries: You gain a +2 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
When you cast a spell that deals Cold Damage, you can apply this sword's bonus to the Spell Attack Roll, or increase its saving throw by 2 (whichever applies).
If you make an attack with this weapon after dealing Cold Damage in the past minute, this weapon’s Critical Hit Range is increased by 1.

item.name: Impossible Gloves
entries: Simple Invention.
This set of gloves is coated with Boggle Oil. They are flame resistant and hydrophobic.
They must be kept in water for 8 hours per hour of use to maintain their potency. Touching a creature with the gloves gives you advantage on Strength based Grapple checks.

item.name: Improved Belt Feed
entries: Effect. The firearm's misfire score is reduced by 1.
Restrictions. Requires the Belt property.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Indara’s Fall
entries: This magical golden lance is adorned with etching of horses dashing through a rising dawn. Attacks made with this lace gain a +3 to attack and damage rolls.

In addition, they deal an extra {@dice 1d10} fire damage on hit. When this lance is used against a Dragon it deals an addition weapon die of damage, and on a critical it adds {@dice 3d6} additional damage.

Once per day, the wielder can hold aloft the lance and use an action to cast {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE}. When cast in this way, it specifically summons the spirit bonded to the weapon, Rasharam. Rasharam has the statistics of a {@creature nightmare|MM}, but is of type celestial and only the ability to convoy its summoner. When he appears, he is equipped with a saddle and set of plate barding, which vanish with him when he is dismissed or slain. Rasharam remains until dismissed or slain.

Indara’s Fall can only be attuned, identified, and wielded by one who has slain a Dragon of CR 11 or higher. A creature can perform a bonding ritual with the blade by anointing it with CR 11 or high Dragon’s blood. Once this ritual is performed, that creature can always attune to Indara’s Fall.
Special. You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Iron Ceatus
entries: Special. These heavy gauntlets require immense strength to use effectively. A creature must have 15 Strength or they make all attacks with this weapon with disadvantage.

Unarmed. Unarmed weapons replace your unarmed damage with the weapon damage listed. If you have other options for unarmed damage, such as a Fighting Style or Martial Arts monk feature you can choose which damage die applies. A value written as +X as opposed to X adds to unarmed damage rather than replacing it.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Ironsight
entries: Effect. The firearm gains a +1 to-hit.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Katana
entries: Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Katana of Astral Speed
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
In addition, you can make one attack with it as a bonus action on each of your turns.
You gain a fly speed of 60ft while in the Astral Sea.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Lance of the Steadfast Prince
item.reqAttune: by a creature with at least 15 CHA
entries: You gain a +3 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.
If you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you deal an additional 2d8 necrotic damage and regain a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, your walking speed is increased by 10, and if you are mounted this walking speed is bonus is instead applied to your mount.
Special. You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Larger Barrel
entries: Effect. The barrel can hold an additional 2 rounds.
Restrictions. Requires the Barrel property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Laser Sight
entries: Effect. Before you roll, you can gain a +3 to hit, unless your target is in direct sunlight. If you use the bonus from this and hit a creature, you are revealed to that creature.
Archetype. Only Snipers can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Locket of Warding
entries: This magical Locket contains space for a piece of a Creature to be placed within.
As an Action, you can place a reagent of a Creature within the locket and grant yourself the following benefit based on its CR and Type.

You gain advantage on one saving throw of your choice (which can be changed at dawn) against creatures of that Type. You also gain advantage on saving throws against one condition from the below list against creatures with the same Creature Type as it, based on the CR of the reagent placed within the locket (which can also be changed at dawn).
You only gain these benefits based on the CR of the Reagent placed within the locket for creatures within its CR range or lower, and can only select Conditions based on the Reagents CR.
The Reagent inside the Locket can be replaced by a different reagent, but this consumes the first reagent.

item.name: Long-Barrel Revolver
entries: Tier 2.
Barrel 6. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Magic Capacitor
entries: This magical modification can be slotted into a gun to grant it the magical effects placed on it. Any enchantment that can be placed on a weapon can be placed on a magic capacitor. Once installed on a gun, it grants that gun the enchantment. A magic capacitor can only be placed on a non-magical gun, otherwise it has no effect.
An unenchanted magical capacitor can be crafting using Arcstone based on the rarity and requires two plates, requiring Gunsmithing tools check.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Malkin's Fluxbinder
entries: This magical crossbow is fitted with six gemstone lenses at the end of it. Attacks made with this magical weapon have a +2 to their to hit and damage rolls. When fired it deals an additional 1d8 damage depending on the focused gemstone, fire for ruby, acid for emerald, lightning for sapphire, cold for diamond, thunder for quartz, and acid for topaz. Changing the focused lens takes a bonus action.
In addition this crossbow can be used as an arcane focus. When used as an arcane focus you can change the damage of any spell cast through it to the damage type of the currently focused lens.

item.name: Man Catcher
entries: Special. A creature can make a grapple check with the reach of the Man Catcher. On a success the grappler can move and maintain the grapple as long as they remain with the weapon’s reach. If a second creature attempts to grapple a creature you are grappling you can grant them advantage. If three or more Man Catchers are all grappling the same creature, that creature is restrained instead, as long as all three maintain the restraint.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Maxim
entries: Tier 3.

Belt 40. Upon crafting a Belt fed firearm, you additionally gain 1 Belt. Belt fed firearms use a number of rounds equal to how many damage die they roll with their attack. Once a belt is out of ammunition, you can replace and reload the firearm with another loaded belt as an Action. To reload the ammunition in a belt, it requires 1 minute per 10 rounds you are reloading. Belt weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

item.name: Medal of Muscle (Uncommon)
entries: You can squeeze this medal tightly in the palm of your hand as an action. Doing so gives you advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws for 1 hour. Once this property has been used 3 times, it can't be used again, and the medal becomes nonmagical.

item.name: MEGA!!!gun
entries: Tier 4.

Belt 90. Upon crafting a Belt fed firearm, you additionally gain 1 Belt. Belt fed firearms use a number of rounds equal to how many damage die they roll with their attack. Once a belt is out of ammunition, you can replace and reload the firearm with another loaded belt as an Action. To reload the ammunition in a belt, it requires 1 minute per 10 rounds you are reloading. Belt weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.

item.name: Meteor Cannon
entries: Tier 5.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Meteor Hammer
entries: <b><i>Reach.(10ft)<b><i> This weapon adds 10 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Minigun
entries: Tier 2.

Belt 90. Upon crafting a Belt fed firearm, you additionally gain 1 Belt. Belt fed firearms use a number of rounds equal to how many damage die they roll with their attack. Once a belt is out of ammunition, you can replace and reload the firearm with another loaded belt as an Action. To reload the ammunition in a belt, it requires 1 minute per 10 rounds you are reloading. Belt weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.

item.name: Mirror of Makora
entries: This magical mirror is three feet in diameter and decorated with carvings of monkeys holding the mirror aloft. The mirror is unbreakable and can be used as a shield, granting the wearing +3 AC and advantage on saving throws against spells that deal fire, lightning, radiant, or force damage.

As a bonus action the wielder can throw the shield up to 30 feet at which point it stops, hanging in the air. The wielder can then target the mirror with ranged weapon or spell attacks. When hit, the mirror reflects the attack at a perfect 90 degrees from itself, increasing the damage and the hit of the attack by +1 when it does so and resetting the attack's range. If the attack hit, another mirror is created from the first, also hovering in place. For each subsequent mirror your attack hits, it gains an additional +1 to attack and damage, up to a maximum of +3. You can never have more than three total mirrors at once.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move any number of your active mirrors up to 30 feet. Your main mirror is immune to all damage however the magically created ones are not, having 16 AC and 5 HP with immunity to fire, lightning, radiant, and force damage. When you return the main mirror to yourself, all remaining mirrors shatter and vanish.

item.name: Modular Sniper
entries: Tier 3.

Sniper When you make an attack action with this weapon, each attack you could have made with that action is instead consolidated into one attack, where each attack you could have made instead increases the weapon's damage die per attack. Snipers also have disadvantage to hit a creature within 15ft of them.

Clip 10. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Moonlight Pendant
entries: This pendant can store moonlight. If left out in the moonlight for 1 hour, it gains a charge. It can hold up to 10 charges at a time. You can expend a charge to be treated as in moonlight for your Lycanthropy.
Additionally, during a full moon, you can now make a DC 17 WIS save to control your cravings.

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol.
entries: This magazine contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.

items: {@item Muscle Magazine Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol. I
entries: This tome contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature an extra {@dice 2d4}’s to an Athletics or Acrobatics check made during downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Laborer, Guard/Bouncer, Barkeep, or Dock Worker Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol. II
entries: This tome contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature an extra {@dice 4d4}’s to an Athletics or Acrobatics check made during downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Laborer, Guard/Bouncer, Barkeep, or Dock Worker Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol. III
entries: This tome contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature an extra {@dice 7d4}’s to an Athletics or Acrobatics check made during downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Laborer, Guard/Bouncer, Barkeep, or Dock Worker Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Muscle Magazine Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains tips, tricks, and hacks for improving ones body and physical form.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature an extra {@dice 10d4}’s to an Athletics or Acrobatics check made during downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their General Laborer, Guard/Bouncer, Barkeep, or Dock Worker Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Musket
entries: Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.
Loud. Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

item.name: Muzzlebreaker
entries: Innovative Invention.
Requires a Firearm with a Long Range
The Firearm's range is reduced to half of its short range (before any other range modifiers), and cannot use its long range. It deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage on a hit.
Its misfire score is increased by 1.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Naginata
entries: Special. This weapon only has the reach property when it is being wielded in both hands.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Night Scope
entries: Effect. The firearm can be used in darkness without disadvantage.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Oiled Ballbearings
entries: Simple Invention.
These ballbearings have been coated in slippery oil. As an Action, you can apply 3 Flasks of Oil to Ball Bearings.

As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn’t need to make the save.

item.name: Overpressure
entries: Effect. The firearm's attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage, but its misfire score is increased by 1.
Restrictions. Cannot be used on an Explosive or Gas firearm.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Paint Job
entries: Effect. When the firearm is used for intimidation, you have advantage on the check.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Penman's Encyclopedia
entries: This book contains space for one to jot down their own notes. The book can be used to record ones thoughts for a total of 40 hours, after which the user can choose 1 skill or tool that they are proficient in and gain a permanent +1 to that skill.
Once used twice the book becomes non-magical.

item.name: Performer’s Companion Vol.
entries: These tome contains the secrets to performance and writing.

items: {@item Performer’s Companion Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Performer’s Companion Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Performer’s Companion Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Performer’s Companion Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Performer’s Companion Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets to performance and writing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a {@dice 1d6} to one roll during their downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Artist, Journalism, Performance, or Cook Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Performer’s Companion Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets to performance and writing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a {@dice 1d8} to one roll during their downtime
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Artist, Journalism, Performance, or Cook Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Performer’s Companion Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets to performance and writing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a {@dice 1d10} to one roll during their downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Artist, Journalism, Performance, or Cook Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Performer’s Companion Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets to performance and writing.
It can be read over 1 week to grant a creature a {@dice 1d12} to one roll during their downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Artist, Journalism, Performance, or Cook Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Phoenix Force
entries: Tier 2.

Gas 7. Gas weapons do not require to be loaded, rather attached to them is a tank of fuel. A gas weapon uses one unit of gas per attack, and can attack until the tank is depleted. A Gas tank can be refilled by spending 1 minute per unit refilled. You cannot store additional units of Gas, except within the weapon itself.
Cone 10. Cone weapons attack in a cone with a length equal to their value, using the attack roll rolled on all creatures within its cone area.

item.name: Pistol
entries: Tier 1.

Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Pistol Stock
entries: Effect. The pistol gains 20 normal range.
Restrictions. Requires the Light property, cannot be used with the Hidden property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Plate of Heating and Cooling
entries: This black slate of stone has been enchanted with minor magic to heat or cool food. As an action it can be touched and either heated to a temperature hot enough to boil water or cooled to a temperature enough to freeze water. The effect remains until it is touched again and turned off.

item.name: Potion of Past Memory
entries: This Deep brown potion is filled with concentrated Memento beans, providing the Drinker a deep connection to Time. Before ingesting the Potion, a hair, nail or other small piece of a creature is to be mixed in with the completed Potion, after which time it glows with Chronurgic Magic. Ingesting the potion allows you to peer through that creature's life. You experience any event they would have from their point of view.

This potion's duration is based on the current amount of time the selected creature's life has lasted. 1 hour is equivalent of 1 year of that creature's life, if the creature has lived for 36 years the potion's effects remain active for 36 hours as you experience their life. Within that time, you are {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and {@condition incapacitated}. A creature can resist these effects if they do not want to be under the potion's effects, making a DC 19 INT save, repeating this saving throw each hour that passes or when they take damage. The events are played out backwards, meaning more recent events happen in the first hours, and the beginning of the creature's life happens at the end of the vision. This potion's effects cannot be ended early, unless with a 9th level {@spell Dispel Magic|PHB} or by making the above saving throw. The potion provides no effect to creatures that are dead or undead.

item.name: Potion of Perfection
entries: This potion looks to be made from liquid gold. Drinking this potion grants the creature near Perfection in everything it does. Any d20 roll on a Skill check that is 7 or lower is treated as an 8. Your Proficiency Bonus is treated as 2 Higher. You gain 1 Legendary Resistance, which is lost after the duration runs out.
These effects last for 1 hour. The potion's remaining duration is halved each time you fail a skill check/saving throw.

item.name: Prism of the Moon
entries: This crystal prism can be used as an arcane focus. While using it the holder can change the damage type of any cantrip they cast to fire, acid, radiant, poison, cold, lightning, or psychic. Doing so consumes one charge from the prism, which holds up to 7 charges. It regains {@dice 1d4} charges when it spends a night in moonlight.

item.name: Propeller Hat
entries: This hat can be activated to grant a fly speed of 15 feet to the wearer until the end of their turn. It takes a bonus action to activate. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the propeller snaps and the hat becomes useless.

item.name: Puck
entries: This brightly colored disk is made of some sort of wondrous material and can bend easily. When inverted it will quickly spring itself back to its normal shape, propelling objects on top of it 30 feet into the air. It is an action to arm the Puck and it detonates whenever someone steps onto it or at the start of your next turn. After being used, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a roll of 1 or 2, the Puck snaps and becomes useless.

item.name: Quickdraw Bandolier
entries: Innovative Invention.
This multi-pouch strap can be worn over the chest. The Bandolier contains 5 front pouches and two back straps.
A back strap can hold a thrown weapon, like a spear or dagger, and the front pouches can hold objects such as potions, caltrops, acid vials and other small handheld trinkets.
Items in the bandolier can be drawn as a free action. Placing an Item in the bandolier uses an Item interaction.
Each Pouch can only contain one type of item but can hold up to 5 lbs.

item.name: Reliability
entries: Effect. The firearm gains the reliable property.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Remy
entries: Tier 2.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 2. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Revolver
entries: Tier 1.
Barrel 6. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Revolving Rifle
entries: Tier 2.
Barrel 5. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Rifle
entries: Tier 3.

Clip 8. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Riftgem (Feywilds)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Feywilds. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. Whenever you would cast a spell that expends a spell slot using this as a Focus, you can enhance the spell.

An enhanced spell is upcasted by 1 level. This may cause a Wild Magic Surge. Roll {@dice 1d2}, and on a 2, roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} Table. If the result is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn’t require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.
Additionally, if the spell that was enhanced was an Enchantment spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Casting Modifier.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain a +1 to your Armor class and all saving throws.

entries.caption: Wild Magic Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any {@condition invisible} creature if you have line of sight to it.
A {@filter modron|bestiary|source=mm|search=modron} chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell fireball} as a 3rd-level spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow.
You cast {@spell confusion} centered on yourself.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns.
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode out from your face.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself.
Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A {@spell remove curse} spell can end this effect.
An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older.
{@dice 1d6} {@creature flumph||flumphs} controlled by the DM appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are {@condition frightened} of you. They vanish after 1 minute.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition incapacitated} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
A {@creature unicorn} controlled by the DM appears in a space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to {@spell magic missile}.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours.
For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
You regain your lowest-level expended spell slot.
For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
You cast {@spell fog cloud} centered on yourself.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@damage 4d10} lightning damage.
You are {@condition frightened} by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes {@condition invisible} for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
You cast {@spell polymorph} on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
You cast {@spell fly} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
You become {@condition invisible} for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to piercing damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain all expended sorcery points.

item.name: Riftgem (Plane of Fire)
entries: This gemstone is filled with magic from the Plane of Fire. So long as the portal it is connected to remains open, it remains magical. While attuned, you can use this as an Arcane Focus. You ignore Resistance to Fire Damage when dealing Fire Damage with a Spell cast through the Riftgem. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell that expends a spell slot through the Riftgem that would deal Fire Damage, you can have it Burst.

A Spell that Bursts deals additional Fire damage to all creatures within 5ft of those who were affected by the spell. This damage equals {@dice 1d6} for spells of 1st-2nd level, {@dice 2d6} for spells of 3rd-4th level, {@dice 3d6} for spells of 5th-6th level, {@dice 4d6} for spells of 7th-8th level, and {@dice 5d6} for spells of 9th level.
Finally, while within 60ft of the portal this gem is connected to, you gain resistance to Fire Damage.

item.name: Ring of *Splat*
entries: “You wanna piece of me?”
A ring that smells of rich cinnamon and sweet fruit, creating a unique scent that encapsulates the wearer, confusing creatures that rely on scent.

As a bonus action, the wearer of the ring can conjure a ghostly pie and attempt to smash it in the face of a creature within melee range (improvised weapon attack). On a hit, the pie explodes in the creature’s face, blinding them for one turn and dealing {@dice 1d4} force damage. If the attack misses and there’s a creature directly behind the original target, another attack is made against this new target.
The Ring of *Splat* contains five charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges every day at dawn.
Ghost pie can only be eaten by ghosts. It goes well with ghost vanilla ice cream.

item.name: Rocket Launcher
entries: Tier 4.

Explosive 10. Upon a hit, everything within a radius determined by its explosive value of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + the firearm's tier x2) or take an additional damage equal to the damage roll. If the weapon attack misses, the explosive ammunition fails to detonate. Explosive weapons have their misfire score increased by 1.
Barrel 1. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: Runick Chamber
entries: Effect. As a bonus action, you can summon this firearm into your hand. As a bonus action, you can dismiss the firearm into a pocket dimension.
Archetype. Only Hexlock can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Sanguinity
entries: This tarnished, silvered bracer slides with ease onto any wrist. The bracer is made of Devil’s Mercury inlaid with Bloodsteel. No matter what form of bracer, it always retains an intricate design depicting a well crafted yet horrifying visage of the arts of Sanguine Alchemy.
This bracer punctures into the vital vein of the wearer, using their life essence to power its alchemy. Upon attuning to this item, a creature takes 5 points of piercing damage.
Once attuned, the wearer gains these following traits:

items: Clotted Regeneration: At the start of your turn, you can expend a use of your Hit Dice to gain Temporary HP equal to the amount rolled

Crimson Strike: As a bonus action, you can expend a number of hit dice equal to your level to add to the damage of your next attack (weapon or spell). When you expend these hit dice, roll half the amount of those dice (rounded up) and you take piercing damage equal to the number rolled. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
Blood Shield: When you are hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend a Hit Dice and increase your AC by the amount rolled against that instance of attack.

Eldritch Claret: As an Action, you can expend an amount of Hit Dice equal to the highest Spell Slot you are able to cast, you then regain a spell slot equal to the amount of hit dice you expend. When you expend these Hit Dice, roll half of the amount expended (rounded up), and take piercing damage equal to the amount rolled. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

entries: Curse: Sanguinity is a cursed item. When a creature attunes to this bracer, they are unable to remove it unless a DC 20 Medicine Check is met as well as a cast of the {@spell Remove Curse} spell.

While the creature is attuned to the bracer, once every two weeks they must roll a DC 14 Wisdom Saving throw or become Blood Starved. While Blood Starved, the creature gains 1 point of exhaustion for every week they do not consume the blood from one humanoid creature (other than yourself). The amount of blood to consume must equal one or more pints.
By drinking blood, you are no longer Blood Starved. If you fail this save again without drinking blood, this effect stacks

item.name: Sash of Doluna
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that deals cold damage or restores hit points roll {@dice 1d12} and add it to the damage or healing. In addition, you gain resistance to cold damage, if you already have resistance you gain immunity, if you already have immunity cold damage instead heals you for half the damage dealt.
You gain a swim speed equal to 120 feet and can breathe underwater.

Curse. You require 12x as much water as others. If you go more than 4 hours without drinking at least 1 liter of water, you have disadvantage on all Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks until you drink and if you take fire damage you have disadvantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws and ability checks until the end of your next turn.

Form of the Tides As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the scarf to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: {@creature Water Elemental Myrmidon|MPMM}, {@creature Giant Shark|MM|Giant Shark (type Elemental)}, or {@creature Water Elemental|MM}.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: Creature that receive healing from you gain temporary hit points equal to the amount healed. While they have these temporary hit points creatures that damage those creatures suffer 5 cold damage if they are within 5ft of the damaged creature.

Whenever you cast a spell that deals cold damage, the surrounding area grows frigid. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or have their movement speed halved and suffer cold damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
When you restore hit points to a creature, you can also end one of the following conditions on that creature: poisoned, paralyzed, prone, or stunned.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals cold damage into the Sash to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: Satchel of Shinier Bait
entries: A small pouch containing Morenstar Lake's new special Shinier Bait, a glimmering gem-like item that has little value by itself, but is easily confused as valuable to the casual observer.

As a bonus action, a creature can remove one piece of bait and throw it up to 30 feet away. Alternatively, they can use their bonus action to attach it to a piece of ammunition, due to the Shinier Bait's higher durability.

If it lands within 30 feet of another creature, that creature must make a DC15 Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn. Beasts have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a fail, they must move up to their speed towards the bait and pick it up. The creature is not compelled to move in a way that obviously endangers them; for instance, over a cliff or through a known hazard. If the creature picks it up, succeeds on their saving throw, or if the bait is unreachable, they immediately discern it as a worthless item and are immune to this effect until the next dawn.
The bag contains up to 5 pieces of bait. {@dice 1d4+1} pieces of bait reappear in the bag each day at dawn.

item.name: Sawed Off
entries: Effect. Reduces the range for the firearm by 10, but increases the shotgun cone by 5 feet. Misfire is also increased by 1.
Restrictions. Requires the Shotgun property.
Archetype. Only Buckshots can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Scope
entries: Effect. The firearm does not pose disadvantage when firing at long range.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Scope MK I
entries: Simple Invention.

the basic version of the scope is an attachment that can pe built and placed on a ranged weapon that allows the wielder to use a spyglass wile still holding the weapon (so the spyglass uses no hands) and can be used in tandem with the weapon to see far away targets

item.name: Semi-Auto Sniper
entries: Tier 4.
Semi Auto. As a Bonus Action, you can activate or deactivate your Semi Auto. Semi Auto overrides the Sniper's restriction to Extra Attack and Multiattack.

Sniper When you make an attack action with this weapon, each attack you could have made with that action is instead consolidated into one attack, where each attack you could have made instead increases the weapon's damage die per attack. Snipers also have disadvantage to hit a creature within 15ft of them.

Clip 10. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Sending Stones (Rare)
entries: Sending stones come in pairs, with each smooth stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized. While you touch one stone, you can use an action to cast the {@spell sending} spell from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone and don't cast the spell.
You can cast {@spell sending} through the stones 3 times until they can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the stones in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Shade Goggles
entries: Simple Invention.
While wearing these Goggles, the strain of bright lights is diminished. Creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity and Sunlight Sickness no longer have the negative effects of sunlight affect their vision.

Additionally, creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity and Sunlight Sickness that wear these goggles during the day have a Brightvision now, with a range of 60ft. This acts the same way Darkvision allows creatures to see in darkness, but works for Sunlight instead. Seeing beyond your Brightvision incurs the same negative effects as detailed in your Sunlight Sickness or Sunlight Sensitivity.

item.name: Shard of Illumina
entries: This 1-foot-long shard of gold has veins of silver and platinum along its surface.
Empowered Magic. While holding this shard, you can use it as a spellcasting focus, and it gives a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls.
Enhanced Intelligence. Your Intelligence score increases by 2 while the shard is on your person. The shard can't raise your Intelligence score above 22.
Curse. Attuning to this item extends it curse to you. You remain cursed until you are targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.
The shard's curse causes misfortune to befall you. When you roll 1 on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, roll on the Shard Misfortunes table to determine your misfortune.

entries.caption: Shard Misfortunes table
rows: You accidentally cut yourself with the shard and are poisoned until the next dawn.
You experience a vision of an ancient calamity—a beautiful city threatened by crumbling mountains and erupting volcanoes—and are stunned until the end of your next turn.
For a few seconds, the ground shakes under you. You and each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

The shard releases four glowing darts of magical force that target one random creature within 30 feet of you. If no such target exists, you become the target. Each dart hits automatically and deals 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage to the target.
Until the next dawn, you have -1 to all saving throws.
Nothing seems to go your way. Until the next dawn, you have disadvantage on ability checks.

item.name: Shell Blades
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
These blades have a heavily guarded hilt that protects the forearms of its wielder. While wielding two of these blades you gain a +1 to AC.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Shiverspike
entries: You gain a +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls with this weapon.

Whenever you would take or deal Cold damage, you gain Temporary Hit points equal to your Proficiency Bonus, as Ice crystals coalesce around you. Whenever you would hit a creature this weapon, you can remove any Temporary Hit points you have to cause the attack to deal additional cold damage equal to the temporary hit points removed.

item.name: Shotgun
entries: Tier 1.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 1. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Shuang Gou
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two Shuang Gou you are considered to have reach.
If you use the reach property you can’t make an offhand attack that turn.
Additionally, you have advantage on attack rolls made to disarm opponents if you are wielding two Shuang Gou.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Silencer
entries: Effect. The firearm produces a quarter of its normal noise. For the average firearm, it becomes nearly silent. Removes the Loud property.
Restrictions. Cannot be used on an Explosive or Gas firearm.
Tier. This is a Tier 2 Firearm modification.

item.name: Slingsword
entries: Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Slippers of Hopping
entries: Fluffy and warm, these slippers add 10 feet to the base jump distance of the wearer, even from a standing position. Additionally, they grant the user +1 to all acrobatics checks.

Good Hare Day. Once per day, the wearer of the Slippers of Hopping may boop the noses of their footwear as a bonus action. When this happens, wearer casts Jump upon themselves and triples their jump distance for one minute. For the duration, long rabbit-like ears sprout from the head of the wearer, though the ears may be slicked back if the wearer has a receding hareline. Additionally, every jump is accompanied by a loud “BOING”!
Unfortunately, while wearing the Slippers of Hopping, the user is compelled to do the embarrassing action that bunnies are known for...twitch their nose.

item.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: Tier 1.

Sniper When you make an attack action with this weapon, each attack you could have made with that action is instead consolidated into one attack, where each attack you could have made instead increases the weapon's damage die per attack. Snipers also have disadvantage to hit a creature within 15ft of them.

Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Spear of Thassa
item.reqAttune: by a follower of a Thassa
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
