When you hurl it and speak its command word, it transforms into a torrent of water, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The torrent  turns back into a spear when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the spear plus {@dice 4d6} cold damage. This ability does an additional {@dice 2d6} cold damage when used underwater.
The spear’s property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the spear can still be used as a magic weapon.
The Spear retains all properties from its Staff Form.

item.name: Speed Loader
entries: Effect. Converts a barrel to be loaded as if it were a clip, but the firearm is still classified as a barrel.
Restrictions. Requires the Barrel property.
Archetype. Only Quickdraws can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Staff of Arachnid Domination
entries: The staff allows the wielder to control arachnids, such as spiders and ettercaps, within a certain range.

While holding the staff, the wielder can use an action target to any arachnid within 60 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be charmed by the wielder for 1 hour. The wielder can use their bonus action on subsequent rounds to maintain control over the charmed creature, causing it to take any actions they desire.

Additionally, once per day, Target up to three creatures within 60 feet. The affected creatures must make a Wisdom saving throw against a DC of 15 or be magically {@condition restrained} for 1 minute while they struggle to untangle themselves from the web of lies and deceit. The affected creatures can make the save again at the end of their turn.
While attuned to the staff, the wielder gains resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against poison effects.

item.name: Stench Pistol
entries: Tier 4.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.

Clip 20. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Stinger
entries: Tier 1.
Barrel 4. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

Hidden. Hidden Firearms are small enough to tuck into a sleeve without it showing an outline and are made for assassinations. Hidden firearms come with a small track that can be mounted to the wielders wrist. As an interaction, they can slide the firearm hidden in their sleeve down the track and right into their hand. Creatures searching you for weapons have disadvantage on finding a Hidden firearm, and you have advantage on Sleight of Hand checks to hide it.

item.name: Support Strap
entries: Effect. The heavy weapon can be used by small sized creatures with no issue.
Restrictions. Requires the Heavy property.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Sword of Hate
entries: This simple longsword has embedded in its hilt a rough hew red crystal. The Sword of Hate is a magical longsword, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.

Whenever you have the choice to spar someone, choose mercy, or forgive someone, the sword whispers hateful things into your mind. If you still choose the merciful option, you must give the blade one hit die, which reduces your maximum hit dice by the same amount. If you choose to listen to the blade, the blade gains a stack of Malice. If you have no hit dice left, you cannot resist the blade and must choose the most violent option. At certain amounts of Malice the blade gains more abilities.
2 - The weapon bonus increases to a +2.
4 - The weapon bonus increases to a +3.
6 - The weapon’s critical range is increased by 1.
8 - The weapon deals an additional 1d8 (1d10 if held in two hands) slashing damage.

To regain hit dice consumed by the blade, you must cast a remove curse or similar spell on the blade. Each time this is cast, you regain one lost hit die. The creature casting the remove curse (or similar spell) must make a DC 13 + the number of held hit dice Charisma saving throw or have their alignment shifted down by one row, if it is already evil it is shifted one towards chaotic, if they are already chaotic evil                                                 .
The blade can hold a total of 20 hit dice.

item.name: Temporal Stabilizer
entries: Groundbreaking Invention.
Requires Tinkers Tools + 1 Tinker's Brass + 1 Absintium

This bracer allows the wearer to stabilize themselves in Time. Using the innate power within the Absintium, the wearer becomes immune to spells and magical effects that alter ones time, perception of time, or placement within time (Chronurgy magic, as well as spells such as Haste, Slow, Memento Poison, etc). The Bracer is considered magical, and can be dispelled by casting Dispel magic at 7th level or higher, removing its effects for 1 hour, as well as Anti Magic Fields nullify this effect.

Additionally, the Absintium can attune itself to a Time Rift within 30ft of it after completing a 10 minute ritual. The Absintium is then Entangled with the Time Rift, allowing the wearer to pass through at a predetermined point of their choosing. After which, the Time Rift creates a passageway from that point to the present, and that point cannot be changed. Time that passes within the present passes concurrently in the determined point for 1 year, after which time the Absintium is fully consumed and the Entanglement ends. Any and all changes within time happen simultaneously at once after the year ends.

item.name: The Bunker Buster
entries: Groundbreaking Invention.

This 5ft x 5ft sphere contains enough firepower in it to level a town.  It weighs 75lbs and has large metal handles on the sides for easier carrying. It has an AC of 20, 100 hit points (immune to psychic/necrotic/poison, resist non-magical weapon damage). If its hit points drop to 0 it begins detonation (this does not expose the core, meaning it cannot be disarmed).
Detonation:

As an Action, a creature next to it can make a DC 15 Tinkers Tools check with INT to prepare it for detonation. The Bunker Buster then opens up to reveal a large core charged with arcane energy. Attacking the core in this state with a melee weapon that deals 20+ damage causes it to immediately detonate (AC 15, retaining same resistances and immunities). Otherwise, the core will detonate in 1 minute after the Detonation procedure begins.
Explosion:

When the core explodes, it emits a shockwave in a 300ft radius. Creatures must make a DC 19 Dexterity Saving Throw or take 25d8 Force Damage. Creatures within 100ft of it that are not behind full cover automatically fail the saving throw. The damage dealt by this explosion is doubled against structures. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage, for every 40 damage over their current hit points they took by this explosion causes them to fail 1 death saving throw (normal rules for death saving throws still apply). Creatures that die to this damage are turned to ash.
Disarming:

While the core is exposed, a creature can use an Action to attempt to disarm it. They must make 3 successful DC 20 Tinkers Tools check with INT. Failing this check causes the bomb's timer to speed up by 1d6 rounds (rolled by the DM and kept private).

item.name: The Forbidden Foci
entries: This skull is emboldened with the most ancient forms of magic. When used as an Arcane Focus, you gain a +2 to spell attack rolls and your Spell Save DC, this bonus is doubled for the Forbidden Spell. The Forbidden Spell is immune to Antimagic Fields, and checks to counterspell it/dispel it have disadvantage.

Upon finishing a Long rest, the Forbidden Spell can be wholly modified. You can change the School of Magic the Forbidden spell is considered, and depending on its school, it gains access to a new Arcana option which is always applied to it and does not count against the number that can typically be applied to it. Casting the Forbidden Spell at 6th level or higher allows you to instantly change the Spell School it is considered, but you cannot add the new Arcana type to that casting.

entries.name: Abjuration
entries: You gain resistance to 2 random damage types (roll 2d10, 1 - Cold, 2 - Fire, 3 - Lightning, 4 - Thunder, 5 - Poison, 6 - Acid, 7 - Radiant, 8 - Necrotic, 9 - Force, 10 - Psychic). Rolling the same number twice instead grants immunity to that type. This lasts for 1 minute. Recasting the Forbidden Spell allows you to reroll the d10s, potentially changing the resistances gained.

entries.name: Conjuration
entries: An Elemental of your choice with a CR equal to half of the Forbidden Spell's level appears and fights along side you, operating on your Initiative. They remain until reduced to 0 hit points, or after 1 minute passes.

entries.name: Divination
entries: You gain a +1 to all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Enchantment
entries: Creatures affected by the Forbidden Spell must make a Wisdom Saving throw to harm you, as if you were protected by the Sanctuary Spell. This lasts until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Evocation
entries: The Forbidden Spell's critical range is increased by 1.

entries.name: Illusion
entries: You become Invisible after casting the spell and can teleport up to 30ft within a point you can see.

entries.name: Necromancy
entries: Slaying a humanoid with this spell causes them to rise as an Undead under your control, with the Undead's CR equal to up to 1/3rd of that Humanoid's CR/Level. Must create an Undead they could physically be (DM Discretion).

entries.name: Transmutation
entries: The Creature must make a CON Save, and on a fail their damage resistances are removed until the end of your next turn.

item.name: The Fozz
entries: Tier 3.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.
Barrel 6. A barrel is a chamber that holds a number of rounds. You can spend a Bonus Action to reload a single round in your barrel.

item.name: The Mantle of Pyfrita
entries: While active this cloak sheds dim light for 30ft. Creatures that attack you while it's active have disadvantage and if they are within 5 feet of you when they hit take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. After being hit the cloak deactivates and must be reactivated with a bonus action.
Sage of the Forge. You gain proficiency in smith’s tools. If you already have smith’s tools proficiency you instead add twice your proficiency bonus to your rolls.

When you finish a long rest you can choose one metal weapon, suit of armor, or shield and enchant it with a fiery light. If it is a weapon it deals {@dice 2d6} extra fire damage on a hit, if it is a shield or suit of armor it grants fire and radiant resistance until your next long rest
Cursed. While wearing the cloak you are vulnerable to cold damage.

Form of the Pyre. As an action, you can set loose the spirit contained within the cloak to fight alongside you. The spirit takes on the form of an Elemental from the following list: Fire Elemental Myrmidon, Cinder Hulk, Salamander, or Fire Elemental.
While the spirit is active and has more than 0 hit points, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain immunity to fire damage.
Melee spell and weapon attacks deal 2d6 extra fire damage.
If you cast a spell that deals fire damage roll {@dice 1d6}, on a result of 6 the spell does not consume a spell slot.

entries: When the spirit drops to 0 hit points or 1 hour passes, it vanishes, and you lose the benefits listed above. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again for 90 days. As an action, you can cast a 5th level or higher spell that deals fire damage into the Mantle to lower the time to wait by 1 day.

item.name: The Red Blade
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
While wielding this blade, you can cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|PHB}, {@spell Ensnaring Strike|PHB}, {@spell Pass Without Trace|PHB} and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} once per long rest, each.
Additionally, you no longer need to drink water, and have advantage on Constitution saving throws against overheating.
When you hit with a melee attack using this sword and reduce the target to 0 hit points, you gain 2d6 temporary hit points.
Your theft shall not be forgotten, and my vengeance shall be swift.

item.name: Thermal Scope
entries: Effect. Looking through this scope allows you to see all creatures within your firearm's short range, even hidden behind cover so long as that creature produces heat.
Archetype. Only Snipers can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 3 Firearm modification.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.

items: {@item Thieves Almanac Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +1 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 1.
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +3 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 2.
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +5 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 3.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thieves Almanac Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets to skullduggery and crime.
It can be read over 1 week to reduce the heat of a creature to 0 or reduce a buildings heat by 3. Additionally it can be read to gain a +7 bonus to on roll to avoid gaining heat.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Theft, Forger, Spy, or Gambling Wage Progression by 4.
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Thought Forge
entries: Thought Forges are installed in pairs, directly into the brains of two different creatures.

While those creatures are within 60 ft of them, the Thought Forges remain active. When either of the creatures makes an Intelligence saving throw or uses Intelligence to resist a harmful effect, they use the bonus of the creature with higher Intelligence. Whenever a creature makes an Intelligence saving throw in this manner, both creatures suffer psychic damage equal the difference in their Intelligence scores.

If both creatures have the same Intelligence, then instead they make Intelligence saving throws with advantage while within 60 ft of each other. If one of the characters fails the saving throw, both suffer the saving throw's negative effects, although not damage.

item.name: Throwing Star
entries: Special. After using a Throwing Star for your Attack Action, you can use your Bonus Action to throw an additional Star, provided you have another. You can hold up to three Stars in one hand at a time.
Special. Only Ninjutsu Rogues are able to gain proficiency with this weapon.

item.name: Throwing Star (Bundle of 10)
entries: Most commonly sold in bundles of 10 {@item throwing star|TftJC}.

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets of invention and innovation.

items: {@item Tinker's Tome Vol. I|TftJC}
{@item Tinker's Tome Vol. II|TftJC}
{@item Tinker's Tome Vol. III|TftJC}
{@item Tinker's Tome Vol. IV|TftJC}

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol. I
entries: This tome contains the secrets of invention and innovation.
It can be read over 1 week to gain +10 towards any tool check made in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Teaching, Tinkering, Carpentry, or Smithing Wage Progression by 1
Once this book has been used in this way 2 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol. II
entries: This tome contains the secrets of invention and innovation.
It can be read over 1 week to gain +15 towards any tool check made in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Teaching, Tinkering, Carpentry, or Smithing Wage Progression by 2
Once this book has been used in this way 3 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol. III
entries: This tome contains the secrets of invention and innovation.
It can be read over 1 week to gain +20 towards any tool check made in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Teaching, Tinkering, Carpentry, or Smithing Wage Progression by 3
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Tinker's Tome Vol. IV
entries: This tome contains the secrets of invention and innovation.
It can be read over 1 week to gain +25 towards any tool check made in downtime.
Alternatively, a creature reading it can instead read the book to increase their Teaching, Tinkering, Carpentry, or Smithing Wage Progression by 4
Once this book has been used in this way 4 times it becomes no longer magical. Reading the book can be done during leisure time which requires 8 hours of reading in that week.

item.name: Tommy
entries: Tier 4.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Drum 40. A drum operates the same as a clip, but can store much more rounds. A drum can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 10 minutes. Drum weapons are prone to jam, and have their misfire score increased by 1.

item.name: Tonfa
entries: Paired. Paired weapons has special features that only activate when you are wielding two of the same weapon with the paired property.
When you are wielding two tonfa you gain a +1 bonus to your AC. If you make an attack with both Tonfa on your turn you lose the bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Training Vol.
entries: These tomes contains the secrets on a variety of topics.

items: {@item Tinker's Tome Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Herbalist Helper Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Enchanting Catalogue Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Thieves Almanac Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Performer’s Companion Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Muscle Magazine Vol.|TftJC}
{@item Guileless’ Guide Vol.|TftJC}

item.name: Traveler's Encyclopedia
entries: This book contains space for one to jot down their own notes. The book can be used to record ones thoughts for a total of 40 hours, after which the user can choose 1 skill or tool that they are proficient in and gain a permanent +1 to that skill.
Once used the book becomes non-magical.

item.name: Tripod
entries: Effect. You can deploy this as a Bonus Action on a surface. If you do not move on this turn, the Firearm gains a bonus to hit equal to its Tier if shooting a target who did not move in their last round.
Restrictions. Requires the Two Handed property.
Archetype. Only Snipers can use this modification.
Tier. This is a Tier 1 Firearm modification.

item.name: Unruly Broom of Flying
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.
Unruly (Curse). Whenever you speak the command word for this broom, roll a {@dice 1d6}.

On a 1-3 the broom is unruly and to remain on it, you must make a DC 15 Acrobatics check at the start of your turn or fall off the broom. On a 4-5, the broom is malicious, while on it attack rolls against you have advantage on you, and you have disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws and ability checks. On a 6, the broom is compliant and performs as normal.

A creature can use an action to make a DC 15 Animal Handling check on the broom. If the broom is Unruly or Malicious, it becomes compliant for the next hour, otherwise it cannot be changed until after an hour passes. While Unruly or Malicious, the broom may perform mischievous actions like knocking things off of shelves or attempting to trip the user. Unless the broom is compliant, it remains active for 1 hour, even if you say its command word.

item.name: Urumi
entries: Special. If you roll a natural 1 while using the Urumi you deal 1d8 slashing damage to yourself.
Unique. Gaining proficiency in simple or martial weapons does not grant proficiency in this weapon. It must trained separately.

item.name: Warriors Might Mutagen
entries: A creature can use an action to inject this mutagen into their brain stem. The creature doing the injection must make a DC 30 Medicine check on a failure the injected creature suffers one level of exhaustion and an additional level for every 5 below the DC.

Once injected, the creature's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores all increase by 1 up to 20. The creature gains Vulnerability to Psychic damage. The effect lasts until removed by a wish or magic that remakes a creature's body such as Reincarnate or Wish.

item.name: Waxy Pie
entries: This tasty pie can be shared with up to 4 other people. If shared during a short rest each person that eats it can add {@dice 1d4} to one hit die spent during the short rest. The pie magically reappears each day at midnight.

item.name: Wind Chest
entries: Tier 4.
Loud Loud weapons produce more noise than the average firearm, which may attract or scare other creatures from distances up to 300ft away.

Pump 4. A pump ammo system stores a number of shots directly in the gun. You can reload the barrel with up to 2 slugs as a Bonus Action. Before making an attack with a pump weapon that has more than 1 pump, you can choose to fire up to two shots as a part of the same attack. The first target takes additional damage equal to the weapon's damage die. Pump firearms require a strength score of 13 to reload properly, without this reloading the Firearm is an Action.

item.name: Windchaser Sniper
entries: Tier 2.

Sniper When you make an attack action with this weapon, each attack you could have made with that action is instead consolidated into one attack, where each attack you could have made instead increases the weapon's damage die per attack. Snipers also have disadvantage to hit a creature within 15ft of them.

Clip 8. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Wirelauncher
entries: There are the following versions:

items: {@item Wirelauncher MK I|TftJC}
{@item Wirelauncher MK II|TftJC}

item.name: Wirelauncher MK I
entries: Simple Invention.

A creature can spend 1 minute attaching a javelin to this device. The javelin retains any properties it had before, such as enchantments and rare metal abilities. While attached, the javelin now connects to a canister containing 50ft of thick rope.

The javelin's maximum range cannot exceed how many ft of rope the canister contains. Hitting a creature with the javelin carries the rope with it, allowing you to hold a rope on that creature so long as the javelin remains stuck in the creature. The creature can remove the javelin as an action by making a DC 10 Strength or Dexterity Check.

item.name: Wirelauncher MK II
entries: Innovative Invention.

A creature can spend 1 minute attaching a javelin to this device. The javelin retains any properties it had before, such as enchantments and rare metal abilities. While attached, the javelin now connects to a canister containing 75ft of thick rope.

The javelin's maximum range cannot exceed how many ft of rope the canister contains. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can set a maximum length limit to the rope, so that the rope only goes out a number of feet up to this amount. You can change or remove the length limit as a Bonus Action on a subsequent turn.

Hitting a creature with the javelin carries the rope with it, allowing you to hold a rope on that creature so long as the javelin remains stuck in the creature. The creature can remove the javelin as an action by making a DC 15 Strength Check. While the javelin remains embedded in the creature, their walking/swim/flying speeds are lowered by 10.

item.name: Wolverine
entries: Tier 4.
Auto Auto firearms can make an additional attack as a part of the Attack Action.

Clip 6. Whenever you craft a firearm that uses a clip, you additionally craft 2 clips. A Clip holds a number of shots detailed on the Firearms chart. To reload a Clip, you can use a Bonus Action to replace your current clip with another loaded clip. A clip can be loaded with its maximum number of rounds by spending 1 minute.

item.name: Zar's Fancy Boots
entries: These boots were hand made to your specification by Zar'ryath. While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Zyrial, Heart of the Sea
entries: While wearing or holding this magical gem you can commune with the spirit trapped within to create a powerful magical implement. As an action, you can target one non-magical weapon, armor, or spellcasting focus that you are holding and wearing and cause it to become encrusted with magical gemstones.

Encrusted Weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this now magical weapon. In addition, you deal {@dice 1d6} cold damage on a hit. On scoring a critical hit you deal {@dice 3d6} cold damage to each creature of your choice within 5 feet of the original target.

Bejeweled Armor. You gain a +2 bonus to your AC while wearing the bejeweled armor. In addition, when you take radiant or force damage you take {@dice 1d6} less of that damage. Upon dropping to zero hp points you instead drop to zero and regain {@dice 2d6} hit points. Once this feature has been used the armor becomes non-magical and Zyrial ceases to function for 1 week.

Dazzling Focus. A spell cast with this spell-casting focus gains a +2 to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. In addition, when you deal cold, force, or radiant damage you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} slashing damage. Spells that deal cold, force, or radiant damage to a single target score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

Crystal of the Sea. As an action or as a reaction to taking cold damage, you can cause Zyrial to manifest a suit of crystal armor that engulfs your entire body. This armor sets your AC to 18, 20 if Zyrial was active as Bejeweled Armor, and imposes disadvantage on stealth checks, this armor counts as heavy armor and you are proficient with it while wearing it. This armor lasts for 10 minutes or until you use an action to dismiss it. While active you are immune to cold damage. After using this feature you cannot manifest this armor again until you finish a long rest.
If you use your action to encrust another object the enchantment on a currently encrusted object fades as the crystals fall away.
Sentience. Zyrial is a sentient neutral good object with an Intelligence of 12, Wisdom of 12, and a Charisma of 16. It has hearing and blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.
This object can speak, read, and understand Common and Aquan, and can communicate with its wielder telepathically.

trait.name: Water Rejuvenation
entries: After spending 1 minute submerged in water, the Kelpglider regains all of its hit points and removes any negative conditions from itself.

action.name: Druidcraft
entries: The Kelpglider casts {@spell Druidcraft}

monster.name: Minion

hp.special: 2 + your Charisma bonus + three times your warlock level (the minion has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your warlock level)

languages: Common and all the languages you speak

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting(Warlock)
entries: The minion's innate spellcasting ability is charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components. Its spell casting level is equal to your warlock level.
At will: two Warlock cantrips of your choice.

trait.name: Unfocused Follower
entries: Unless the minion is within 60 feet of its master is has disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Natural Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + PB} slashing damage.

reaction.name: Protect Master
entries: While within 10ft of its master, the minion can use its reaction to add + your proficiency bonus to its Master's AC against one attack, if the attack misses, the attack hits the minion instead.

object.name: Ballista Magazine
entries: Innovative Invention.
This wide magazine allows for quicker reloading of a Ballista. Once crafted, it must be installed on the ballista, which takes 10 minutes.

It has an AC of 15 and 20 hit points. The Magazine can hold up to 14 Ballista Sized Bolts, and while the magazine is loaded with ammunition the Ballista only requires a Bonus Action to reload. All other rules about a Ballista remain the same.
To reload the Magazine, you can spend an Action to place a bolt into the magazine.

optionalfeature.name: Adept
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. You may add your Intelligence Modifier + the spell level to the damage of The Forbidden Spell.

optionalfeature.name: Barrier
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. After casting The Forbidden Spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence Modifier + the spell level.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Herald
entries: You've learned to fight by leading the charge and inspiring your allies. While allies are within 30 feet of you and you succeed on a saving throw or score a critical hit you can use your reaction to grant a number of allies equal to your proficiency bonus temporary hit points equal to your proficiency modifier + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Blade Guard

feature: Pact of the Blade and Master Warlock

entries: You and your minion can cast warding bond once per long rest. When you cast it using this evocation the target must be either the minion or master and you do not need to provide the material component.

optionalfeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: You can cast the hunter’s mark spell once per day without expending a spell slot by expending 50gp. By default, it is cast at 1st level, you can expend 100gp to increase the level of the spell by 1. When you kill a creature affected by hunter’s mark cast from this invocation you gain gold equal to 150% of the gold spent casting this spell. Once you have received gold in this way you cannot receive more gold from this invocation until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Burst
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell explode with its power, dealing half of its damage to creatures within a 5ft radius of it (excluding itself).

optionalfeature.name: Contact
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is reduced to touch, and for every 30ft of range the Forbidden Spell would have had instead grants one additional damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Cost
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell is upcasted by two levels, and then your maximum hit points are reduced by 3d6 until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Distance
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is increased by 10 per Spell Slot it is cast at.

optionalfeature.name: Door of Shadow
entries: You may cast the dimension door spell once per day without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Double
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. You can cast The Forbidden Spell again this turn as a Bonus Action, but it must be cast using a lower level spell slot (which is still spent).

optionalfeature.name: Drain
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. Creatures hit by The Forbidden Spell have their speed reduced by 10ft until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Drift
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Immediately after or before casting The Forbidden Spell, you may teleport up to 15ft to an unoccupied space you can see.

optionalfeature.name: Element
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage type becomes either Fire, Cold, Acid, Lightning or Poison (you choose when you select this Arcana).

optionalfeature.name: Empower
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die uses d8s instead of d6s.

optionalfeature.name: Envelop
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die is lowered by 2, but it becomes a Dexterity Saving Throws affecting creatures in a 15ft radius.

optionalfeature.name: Failure
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected have disadvantage on the next saving throw they would make until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Darkness
entries: You learn the darkvision spell and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. In addition, when cast in this way the darkvision granted by the spell allows the target to see through magical darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Gloom
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell must instead make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a fail are frightened rather than subtracting 1d4, for 1 minute or until they succeed the saving throw by repeating it at the end of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell are no longer subtract 1d4, but now they must instead then make a Strength Saving Throw, and on a fail become Restrained for 1 minute, or until they succeed on the saving throw by repeating it at the end of their turns.

optionalfeature.name: Horizon
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is doubled, but it deals one less damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Leader's Venir
entries: Your minion’s attacks become magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance and deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier if you have hit the target this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Loot Explosions
entries: If you kill a creature with an eldritch blast, they will spew coins out of their mouth (or another applicable orifice) when they die. The amount of coins they divulge is equal to their hit dice and is of the type of coin you used for the material component of the eldritch blast which killed them.

optionalfeature.name: Money Talks
entries: You can cast the magic mouth spell once per day without expending a spell slot or requiring a material component. The object of the spell must be a coin.

optionalfeature.name: Origin
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage type becomes either Necrotic, Radiant or Thunder (you choose when you select this Arcana).

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldly Summons
entries: You can cast summon celestial using a warlock spell slot. Once you do so you can’t cast the spell again until you finish a long rest. While the celestial is summoned, creatures of your choice within 10 feet of it gains +1 to all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Overwhelm
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Passage
entries: Tier 1 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's range is halved, but it becomes a Dexterity Saving throw affecting creatures in a 5ft line.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell gain a -1 penalty to its Armor Class until the end of your their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rakish Fighting
entries: You learned to fight on the streets and use everything you can to your advantage. As a bonus action you can attempt a dirty trick. One creature within 10 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Str or Dex, or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn. In addition, whenever you hit a creature you have advantage on you deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage.

optionalfeature.name: Recovery
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell deals one less damage die, and one ally within range of the Forbidden Spell's attack range regains half of the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Regress
entries: Tier 2 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell instead subtract 2d4 from their next roll.

optionalfeature.name: Renewal
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. The Forbidden Spell's damage die is lowered by 2, but you regain an expended spell slot of 3rd or lower. This must be cast with a spell slot of 4th or higher to use this Arcana.

optionalfeature.name: Repeating
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. You make an additional attack with this spell at another creature within range.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Comprehension

feature: Pact of the Tome and Master Warlock

entries: Your minion can cast the cantrips you have in your Book of Shadows. If you gain the ability to cast rituals your minion can also cast those rituals and together you can both cast the same ritual to lower the time it takes to complete by half.

optionalfeature.name: Teamwork in Servitude

feature: Pact of the Chain and Master Warlock

entries: Your minion, familiar, and any creatures summoned through the use of a conjuration spell gain the Pact Tactics feature but only in relation to each other and you.

optionalfeature.name: The Bank
entries: You gain a sapphire worth 1,000gp that can be used as a material component for the spell instant summons, which you learn when you take this invocations. This sapphire is not consumed when you end the spell, instead, the spell simply ends, and you can reuse the sapphire on another cast of instant summons.If you lose this sapphire you can expend 1,000gp from your Deep Pockets to produce a new one, doing so causes the other to vanish.

optionalfeature.name: Umbral Armour
entries: When you begin combat while wearing medium armour you gain {@dice 1d4} + Charisma modifier temporary hit points. This bonus increases to {@dice 1d6} at 9th level, {@dice 1d8} at 13th, {@dice 1d10} at 17th level, and 1d12 at 20th level.

optionalfeature.name: Wither
entries: Tier 3 Arcana. Creatures affected by The Forbidden Spell have their Strength and Dexterity scores halved until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Age
entries: Darfellan can grow to be 130 years old, reaching maturity around 25.

entries.name: Size
entries: Darfellan are 6-7ft on average, being quite bulky. Your Size is medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet, and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Darfellan have darkvision in a range of 60ft, seeing things in darkness in shades of deep blues.

entries.name: Language
entries: Darfellan speak, read and write Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Darfellan Skills
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Perception}, or {@skill Survival}. Darfellan are all also proficient the {@item net|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item javelin|phb}, and {@item spear|phb}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your tough skin provides you a Natural Armor Class of 13 + Your Dexterity Bonus. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Ice Diver
entries: You take no penalties from swimming in freezing water. Additionally, you can hold your breath a number of hours equal to their Constitution Modifier + 1 (minimum 1).

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Myconids are pacifist and lean towards Neutrality on most occasions.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is small, but you're a fast grower. You start out anywhere between 1 and 2 feet tall. You become a Medium Creature when you become a Myconid Adult, growing to 5ft. You grow to just under 7ft as a Sovereign.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 25ft. Your speed increases to 30ft when you become a Myconid Adult.

entries.name: Fungal Growth
entries: Myconids go through a process of evolution as they mature. At level 1, you are a Myconid Sprout. At level 4, you become a Myconid Adult. At level 7, you become a Myconid Sovereign. Your features change based off what stage of life you are in.

entries.name: Sunlight Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the myconid has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

entries.name: Melding Rest
entries: Myconids don’t need to sleep. Instead, they release calming spores, remaining semiconscious for 6 hours a day. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Underdark Vision
entries: You have darkvision in a range of 120ft.

entries.name: Fungal Resilience
entries: Your fungal body has an easy time adapting to strange airborne toxins. You face no negative effects of polluted air, and have advantage on saving throws against harmful gases and vapors, such as {@spell Cloudkill}..

entries.name: Spores
entries: As your Myconid matures, they learn ways to use their spores. As a Sprout, you can use your Rapport Spores. As an Adult, you can use Pacifying Spores. The Sovereign learns Hallucination Spores.

entries.name: Rapport Spores (1/day)
entries: A 10-foot radius of spores extends from the myconid. These spores can go around corners and affect only creatures with an Intelligence of 2 or higher that aren’t undead, constructs, or elementals. Affected creatures can communicate telepathically with one another while they are within 30 feet of each other. The effect lasts for 1 hour.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores (1/day)
entries: The myconid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target is incapacitated while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Sovereign
entries: When you become a Sovereign, you gain the Powerful Build feature and have advantage on all checks to communicate with other Myconid, as they see you as someone to be respected.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Myconid can write and understand Common and Undercommon. Myconids can speak any language they can understand by expelling spores at a creature.

reward.name: Boon of Minor Combat Might
entries: You have overcome mighty foes in the arena, and have been granted power beyond this.
The first time you would drop to 0 hit points, you instead drop to 1. You can only use this feature once per week.
Additionally, rolling a 19 on a Death Saving Throw now makes you stand with one hit point.

reward.name: Draconic Elemental Affinity (Kobold)
entries: You gain resistance to the damage type of your associated colour.
Your breath weapon is now a recharge of 6 (not affected by the dragon's breath dragon jelly transformation).

You additionally have advantage on saving throws against terrain effects created by a mature dragon of your elemental type's territory/lair, such as extreme heat from a red dragon's volcano or acid pools in a black dragon's swamp.

reward.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: You gain a breath weapon. If you are not draconic, its type is random.
If you already have a breath weapon, you either gain an additional usage of it per rest, or its recharge die is lowered by 1.

reward.name: Dragon's Claws
entries: Your unarmed attacks deal {@dice 1d6} + STR slashing damage.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

reward.name: Dragon's Heart
entries: Advantage against Frightened and Charmed conditions.
Once Per Long rest, you can automatically succeed against a Charm or Frighten Effect

reward.name: Increased Eyesight
entries: You gain Blindsight of 5ft, and your Darkvision is increased by 30ft.

reward.name: Primordial Champion
entries: While within 60ft of another champion, you gain a +1 to all saving throws for each additional champion besides yourself. In addition, once per turn when you deal damage with a spell or weapon attack you deal additional damage equal {@dice 1d6} of the damage type of each other champion (fire for Pyfrita, cold for Doluna, acid for Cavalkal, lightning for Elitanith).

reward.name: Speaker of the Wind
entries: This creature has been attuned the energies of Sky Titan and the Plane of Air. They gain the following features.
They learn to read and write Druidic.
Once per long rest the creature can cast Feather Fall without expending a spell slot.
At 5th level, they gain the ability to cast Warding Wind without expending a spell slot.
At 9th level they gain the ability to cast Wind Wall without expending a spell slot.
Once they have casted any of the three spells with this feature they cannot do so again until finish a long rest.
Your casting ability for these spells is Wisdom.

reward.name: Tough Scales
entries: While Unarmored, your AC is equal to 10 + DEX + Proficiency Bonus.
Creatures grappling you take damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus in piercing damage at the start of their turns.

spell.name: Aqua Whip
entries: You lash out with a watery strike 5 feet wide and 15 feet long. Creatures within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, and on a fail take {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone. You can also use this to pull a loose object that isn't worn or carried within the spell's range to you
entriesHigherLevel: This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d4}, 11th level {@dice 3d4}, and 17th level {@dice 4d4}.

spell.name: Arcane Barrage
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in arcane energy. You shed bright light for 15ft, and dim light for another 15ft. Your movement speed becomes 0, you cannot benefit from movement in any way while this spell is active, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity Saving throws. While in this form, you gain access to a Ranged Spell attack roll, which deals {@dice 4d4} force damage + your casting modifier, with a range of 300 ft. As an Action, you can fire up to three of these Ranged Spell attacks while in this form. You can use an Action to regain your ability to move and your movement speed for the turn but lose the ability to make the aforementioned Shots, after which you can use a Bonus Action to reactivate this form, losing your movement once again.
When the spell ends, you have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Saving throws and Ability checks until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level slot or higher, you can fire an additional shot for every slot above 6th.

spell.name: Artist's Touch

components.m: a paint bruch, quill or similar artistic tool

entries: You conjure from the tip of your brush or quill a single magical effect as a manifestation of your artistic spirit. You can create one of the following effects:

items: You instantly cause a message no more than 25 words in length to appear on a surface within range. The message appears in ink or paint and remains for 1 hour.

You touch unsculpted clay, a bottle of paint, or an ink pot and immediately shape it into an artistic work no larger than 2ft in any dimension. The work is fair but unimpressive to any discerning eye. The work remains for 1 hour.

You draw or sculpt a simple object worth no more than 1 gp and it becomes real. The object is brittle and breaks under heavy use, close inspection reveals it to be made of worthless paste. If you have an example of an object on you when you cast the spell you can duplicate it, such as a specific key, otherwise the objects are generic. The object lasts for 1 hour or until it breaks.

You summon forth a splash of ink or paint at one target within 15 ft attempting to blind them. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded|PHB} until the end of their next turn.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action. If you cast a new one the oldest effect ends.

spell.name: Blade Halo

components.m: one miniature blade worth 5gp for each blade you summon

entries: A circle of four shimmering blades appears in your space, spinning around your body. The blades follow you if you move. As a bonus action on your turn, you can hurl one of the blades at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack, on a hit the target takes {@dice 2d8} magical slashing damage. The blade is then destroyed. You can instead of hurling the blade, grasp it, and make a melee spell attack which does {@dice 2d10} magical slashing damage on hit. For each blade remaining creatures that end their turn within 5ft of you take {@dice 1d4} magical slashing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, you summon one additional blade.

spell.name: Bramble Barrier
entries: A mass of thick brambles and vines rapidly grows from a point within range. The brambles form into a tough dome with a diameter of 15ft, a height of 10ft and a thickness of 1ft. The dome has an AC of 13, has 30 hit points, with vulnerability to fire and immunity to psychic and poison. The brambles remain for the duration or as long as they have hit points. When casting the spell, you can choose to concentrate on it.

While concentrating on this spell, the brambles heal 5 hit points at the start of your turn. If you would lose concentration, the brambles remain for the remainder of their duration or once their hit points reach 0. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, the brambles are conjured with an additional 10 maximum hit points.

spell.name: Brilliant Spectre
entries: You transmute a lantern's flame into a Will-o'-Wisp. The Will-o'-Wisp is friendly to you, and remains for the spell's duration or once its hit points become 0. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the Will-o'-Wisp to perform an action. Additionally, you can give the Will-o'-Wisp a command once a certain event happens, like 'Notify me if anyone enters this area' or 'Attack any undead you see'. You can have up to three Will-o'-Wisp under your control at a time from this spell's effects. If you already have three Will-o'-Wisps under your control and you cast this spell again, that new Will-o'-Wisp becomes hostile towards you.

spell.name: Chains of the Black Bloom
entries: You create a flurry of black petals and launch them at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll against that creature, and on a hit they take {@dice 4d10} slashing damage as rapidly moving petals tear around them. If this attack hits a creature, that creature is also restrained, as the petals turn to solid chains. If the spell hits, then all creatures of your choice within 10ft of that creature must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or also be restrained. Creatures restrained by this spell are freed at the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you deal an additional {@dice 1d10} damage for every slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Armory
entries: You pull forth a magical weapon rack. You additionally create up to 5 magical weapons of your choice and one suit of armor of your choice. If you create a weapon that requires ammunition, you also create 20 pieces of its type of ammunition. The rack, weapons, armor, and ammunition last for the duration, after which they vanish into dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional weapon per slot above 3rd, and 1 additional set of armor for every two slots above 3rd.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, the weapons are +1.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or higher, the weapons are +2.
If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th or higher, the weapons are +3.

spell.name: Decay
entries: You select a creature within range, as their body begins to rapidly rot. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, and on a fail the target takes {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage and deals half damage with all weapon attacks that use strength until the end of your next turn.
This spell’s damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level {@dice 2d6}, 11th level {@dice 3d6}, and 17th level {@dice 4d6}.

spell.name: Deja Vu
entries: You slap a creature within range. They must make an Intelligence Saving throw, and on a fail, forget what happened in the past 6 seconds. If you or your allies had attacked this creature 10 minutes prior to casting the spell, they have advantage on the Saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or 4th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 minute ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or 6th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 10 minutes ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or 8th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 hour ago.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the creature forgets the contents of the occurred up to 1 week ago.

spell.name: Dungrin's Light Spire
entries: You create a light spire within range, a glowing tree-like object that has a height of 10ft. It gives off dim light in a 30ft radius, and bright light within a 10ft radius. Creatures of your choice standing within its bright light gain a +1 to all saving throws. Creatures within the dim light do not benefit from being {@condition Invisible} Creatures can only benefit from one Light Spire at a time.

spell.name: Dying Gasp
entries: When a creature dies, you can grasp its dying energies to force it to make an attack against one creature within its reach. If it has a weapon the attack deals that weapon’s damage but uses your Spell Attack bonus for the attack and damage roll, if it does not have a weapon it deals 1d4 for a Tiny creature, 1d6 for small, 1d8 for medium, 1d10 for large, 1d12 for huge, and 2d8 for gargantuan.

spell.name: Elvinus' Ward of Conflux
entries: You conjure a ward of primal energy that surrounds your body and protects you from elemental magics. Choose one element from fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid damage. You gain resistance to that damage type. When you take damage from one of the listed damage types you can use your reaction to gain resistance to that damage type for the rest of the duration of the spell including the inciting instance of damage. Every time you use your reaction to switch resistances it replaces the previous resistance. In addition, any melee attacks that you hit with deal an extra {@dice 2d10} of the element you are currently resistant to.

spell.name: Epoch Shift

components.m: an egg, ashes of a creature, and an hourglass worth at least 250gp all of which the spell consumes

entries: You pick a point within range and in a 20ft radius around that point you wrest control of the time there. Choose one of the following effects from below to take effect:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: Each creature in the radius has its speed doubled. It gains an additional action on each of its turns which can only be used to Attack (one weapon attack), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use and Object. In addition any effects on the creature progress their durations twice at the start of their turns, including effects that would damage them such as being on fire or poisoned. Creatures age twice as fast while in the area.

entries.name: Arrest
entries: Arrest: You halt the natural flow of time in the area. Effect that would take place at the start or end of a creatures turn do not take effect. Creatures do not age in the area. If you use this effect on an area where time does not normally flow, such as the Astral Sea, or an area effected by this spell or Time Lock you can return time to its normal flow.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: Each creature in the radius has its movement speed halved. They receive a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and can’t use reactions. At the start and end of a creatures turn roll 1d2, on a 2 effects that would normally occur at that point do not occur. Creatures in the radius age at half the normal rate.

As a bonus action on your turn after the initial casting, you can alter the effect to one of the other effects. When changed any creature in the radius can make a Wisdom saving throw, on a success the new effect does not take effect until they end their turn in the radius.

spell.name: Fate Sealed
entries: You dash 30 feet forward pulling everything in your path and within your weapon’s reach on either side. Each creature hit must make a dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d8} force damage, or half as much on a fail. Those that fail are also left prone after being knocked into the air

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every slot above 5th.

spell.name: Final Crescendo
entries: Running your fingers down the bowstring a beam of silver light springs towards your target and music fills the air. Select a creature within range, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail, you make them the target for a barrage of sonic attacks. On a success, they are still targeted but take half damage from any future effects. As a bonus action on each of your turns afterward, you can deal {@dice 2d8} thunder damage to the creature. Each additional time you use your bonus action in this way you deal {@dice 2d8} additional thunder damage. Once you reach 8d8 damage your bonus action instead deals {@dice 8d8} thunder damage in a 5ft radius around the target, each creature, including the target, must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, they take half damage. After this happens the spell ends. The spell ends early if you use your bonus action to do anything other than continuing the spell or if you are restrained or disarmed of the spellcasting focus.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increase by {@dice 1d8} for every spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Frozen Winds of the Tomb
entries: You blow a freezing wind which envelops creatures in a 15 ft cone in front of you. All creatures but those with resistance or immunity to Cold Damage must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, ice begins to grow around their body. As an action, you can blow more freezing wind during the spell's duration. Creatures that fail subsequent saving throws have the freezing effect amplified. If a creature leaves the spell's cone, all effects of the spell are removed from them

items: (1 fail) Their speed is halved until the start of your next turn.
(2 fails) Previous effects, and the creature has disadvantage on all skill checks.
(3 fails) Previous effects, and attack rolls they make before the start of your next turn have disadvantage.
(4 fails) Previous effects, and the creature becomes restrained until the start of your next turn.
(5 fails) The creature becomes petrified in ice for 10 minutes. Any physical changes that occur while petrified carry over once they return to their original state.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the cone increases by 5 feet for every spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Globes of the Land
entries: You designate two 15ft radius spheres within range and swap the contents of them. Each creature in the sphere moves to a new location in the other sphere of your choice along with everything they are wearing and carrying. An unwilling creature must make a Charisma saving throw, on a success they are not moved. Objects are also moved unless they are affixed to the ground, such as a plant, or are not fully inside the radius, such as a cart that is halfway into the radius.

spell.name: Grasp of the Interred
entries: Skeletal hands erupt from the ground and grasp at creatures in the radius of the spell. Each creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d12} necrotic damage and become restrained. On a success, they take half damage and are not restrained. For the duration of the spell, the area becomes difficult terrain and a creature that ends its turn inside must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d12} necrotic damage, half as much on a success. When the spell ends, the difficult terrain vanishes and any restrained creatures are released.

spell.name: Headlong Rush
entries: You embolden yourself with heroism. For the duration, your speed and jump distance/height is doubled when moving directly towards a hostile creature. After finishing moving, you can use your action to immediately make a melee weapon attack against a creature. On a hit, they take {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage + your spellcasting modifier and are knocked prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you deal an additional {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Hero's Helping Hand
entries: You give a hand to an injured creature. They regain {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier in hit points. If the creature was at 0 hit points, they immediately stand up if they were prone, and restore the highest number of hit points possible for the die rolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the creature regains an additional {@dice 1d4} hit points for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Invigorating Word
entries: You speak a magical word that fills a creature with strength and energy. Choose one creature other than yourself within range that can hear you and understands at least one language you speak. Immediately after you cast the spell, that creature can use its reaction to make one action. This action can only be used to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage (and move 5 feet), or Use an Object.

spell.name: Knox's Devious Door
entries: You conjure a plane of force into existence that fills one door or passageway within range. If the passageway or doorway is more than 15 feet in any dimension, the spell fails. Otherwise, the plane of force fills the space and is 1 inch thick. Any creatures you designate when you cast the spell can pass through the plane but other creatures cannot.

The plane has 50 hit points with 5 AC and vulnerability to force damage, immunity to poison and psychic and resistance to all other forms of damage. A creature can attempt a DC 20 Strength check to force their way through the plane. On a success, they pass through the plane.

spell.name: Knox's Numerous Platforms
entries: You summon a pane of magical force 10ftx10ft and 1 inch thick. The pane can appear in an unoccupied space within range and be oriented in any direction. The pane can be opaque or transparent or somewhere in the middle. For the duration of the spell you can summon another pane as an action or move up to three summoned platforms up to 30ft. If you summon more panes than the spell slot used to cast the spell one pane of your choice vanishes. The panes can support 1000lbs of weight each, if more weight than this is applied to one it shatters

Nothing can physically pass through the panes. They are immune to all damage but force and cannot be dispelled by dispel magic. Each pane has an AC of 10 and 25 hit points. If a platform is destroyed it does not count against the number of summoned platforms.

spell.name: Last Light
entries: A burst of brilliant light ushers from you, each creature of your choice in a 20ft radius must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn. You shed bright light in a 20ft radius. At the start of you next turn the light vanishes and a burst of necrotic energy dealing {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage to each creature that was blinded by this spell and still within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range increases by 5 feet and the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level past 1st.

spell.name: Light Charge
entries: You launch forth an intense ball of light. Creatures within its radius have their movement speed halved. As a Bonus Action on a subsequent turns after casting the spell, you can cause the light burst, which ends its effects. Creatures within the cube must make a Constitution Saving Throw, and on a fail take {@dice 4d6} radiant damage, or half as much to creatures that pass the saving throw. Each turn you are concentrating on the spell, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} radiant damage when it bursts. If you would lose concentration on the spell at any time, it immediately bursts

spell.name: Light's Embrace
entries: A creature of your choice within range begins to glow with brilliant light, which causes them to shed bright light for 5ft, and dim light for another 5ft. During the spell's duration, creatures that can see the light have disadvantage on attack rolls that target that creature.

spell.name: Lightning Rush
entries: Your body becomes enveloped in lightning. You become immune to lightning damage, you can squeeze through a space as small as 1 inch, and your movement speed is doubled. While this spell is active, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action, you don’t provoke attacks of opportunity, and any creatures you move through must make a DEX Save. On a fail, they take {@dice 3d6} lightning damage and are knocked prone, or half as much on a success. When the spell ends, your hair becomes frizzy.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Luminescent Lazerbeam
entries: A shining line of light fires out from your hands in a line 150 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution Saving throw. Creatures made of darkness, shadows, or smoke have disadvantage on the Saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 6d6} Radiant damage on a failed save and is blinded until the end of their turn, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 4th.

spell.name: Lunar Lance
entries: You conjure moonlight above your head and fire it in a spray of razor-sharp lances. For each creature in 100 feet long and 5 feet wide line make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 5d8} radiant damage and the next creature hit takes one less d8 of damage. The spell ends if it reaches 0 d8’s of damage or hits its maximum range. If any creature in the line is invisible you ignore the disadvantage imposed by not seeing them and if you hit, their invisibility ends

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Conduit

components.m: a spell scroll of a level 3 or lower spell slot, which is consumed

entries: A circle of arcane glyphs and runes appears on the ground within range. The circle has a 10ft radius and gives off faint light. While standing within the circle, yourself and those other creatures can use a Bonus Action to draw power from the circle, making the next spell they cast as an Action this turn upcasted by one level. They must remain in the circle while casting the spell for the increase to take effect. The conduit has 8 charges, and absorbing its power consumes a charge.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot, the conduit gains an additional 2 charges per every spell slots above 4th.

spell.name: Magnetic Sphere

components.m: a small magnet worth 10gp, which is consumed

entries: You conjure a reflective metallic sphere in range. The sphere is 1ft in radius and hovers 5ft above the ground. It emits a magnetic force in a 45ft radius of the sphere that pulls in metal objects. Upon casting the spell, entering its zone for the first time, or starting your turn within its zone,loose metal objects within the magnetic force are flung towards the sphere and stick to it for the duration of the spell. Metal objects that are held require the wielder to make a Strength Save, and on a fail the objects are flung towards the sphere and stick to it. To retrieve an object stuck on the sphere, a creature must make a Strength Check equal to the spell save DC to successfully remove them from the sphere.

Creatures wearing metal armor are more susceptible to its effects. A creature wearing medium armor made primarily of metal must make a Strength Save, and on a fail, their body is flung towards the sphere and will then be stuck to it. A creature wearing light armor also makes the save, but with advantage. A creature wearing heavy armor makes the save with disadvantage. While stuck to the sphere, the creature is considered restrained. A creature may attempt an Athletics check to remove itself or another creature stuck to the sphere. The same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above depending on the armor type applies to this check.

Creatures that are pulled to the centre of the sphere by its effect take fall damage equivalent of the range traveled. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, when casting the spell you can instead have the orb repulse objects made of metal. Objects are then instead flung outwards of the sphere’s zone of magnetism. Creatures wearing armor are still affected by the same advantages and disadvantages as detailed above.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level slot or higher, its radius is doubled and the caster can alternate between its two modes as a Bonus Action.

spell.name: Minor Magnetism
entries: You affect an item made of metal that you can see with a small magnetic force. You generate one of the following effects:

items: You move the object up to 30 feet.
You bend a piece of non magical metal up to 45 degrees.

entries: Creatures cannot be damaged by the movement of the object affected by the spell, nor can the spell move more than 15 pounds at a time. This cannot affect an item currently wielded by a creature, unless the creature willingly allows it to be moved or the item is not.

spell.name: Minor Smite
entries: A weapon you are holding becomes cloaked in divine light. The next attack you make with the weapon during the duration uses your casting modifier to calculate its to-hit bonus and its damage bonus, instead of your strength. If you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, and on a fail they either cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn or are knocked prone (your choice).

spell.name: Molten Cascade
entries: You conjure molten magma from your hands and launch it from you in a 20ft long and 10ft wide line. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity Saving Throw, and on a fail take {@dice 4d8} Fire Damage. Creatures that fail are then restrained, and on a subsequent turn must make a Strength Check against your Spell Save DC to break free from the now cooled rock that has encased them. Creatures that succeed take half of this damage and are not encased in rock. Another creature can use their action to break free someone trapped in the cooled rock.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Orb of Recall
entries: You conjure an arcane orb that flies out in a straight line. All creatures that the orb passes through must make a DEX Save, and on a fail take {@dice 2d6} force damage. At the end of your turn, the orb flies back to your position, then dissipates. If the orb would pass through the same creature twice, they are unaffected by the 2nd pass

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot above 1st.

spell.name: Overload
entries: A pulse of arcane energy launches out from your hand at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll, a target hit by this takes {@dice 1d4} force damage. If you cast a spell in the same turn as casting this cantrip, you take force damage equal to the level of that spell slot expended, a cantrip deals 1 damage.

spell.name: Recurring Remedy
entries: You generate a consistent stream of healing. Select a creature within range. For the duration, at the start of each of their turns they heal {@dice 1d4} hit points so long as they are conscious.

spell.name: Reveal
entries: With a wave of the hand and a magic word you bring to light that which is hidden. When you cast the spell choose one creature, object, or 10-foot cube within range. Any illusion spell of 2nd level or lower inside that area or effecting a creature or object immediately ends, if the spell is Invisibility or Greater Invisibility the spell ends regardless of level. For each spell of 3rd level or higher in the area, make an ability check with your spell casting ability. The DC for this check is 10 + spell's level. On a success the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the leave of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Scribe

components.m: a silver feathered quill worth at least 50gp and a blank sheet of parchment.

entries: You touch a passage of text that is no larger than 5 square feet and transfer it instantly onto a nearby piece of parchment. The text is copied exactly including signatures, mistakes, or any other oddities within the original text. A DC 25 Investigation check can reveal the subtle markings that reveal magic was used in creating the text but does not necessarily reveal it to be a fake

spell.name: Scurry of Quicklings
entries: You create seven illusory copies of quicklings around you, as you too change your appearance to look like a quickling. All quicklings are indistinguishable from another, and if a creature attempts to attack an illusory quickling it puffs into purple smoke. As a part of casting this spell, you can have all seven quicklings to move in any separate direction you desire up to 120ft. Additionally, your walking speed becomes 120ft for the duration. At the end of the spell's duration, all quicklings will attempt to hide where ever they can. If they cannot hide anywhere, they puff into purple smoke.

spell.name: Shadow Self
entries: You create a shadowy duplicate of yourself that appears within 5ft of you. As a bonus action, you can perceive through the duplicate’s senses, causing your body to go blind and deaf until you use another bonus action to switch back. The duplicate can move 30ft on your turn, but must remain within 60ft of you, or the spell ends. Once, while the spell is in effect, you can swap places with the duplicate as a reaction. You can also take this reaction when you are hit with an attack, causing the attack to miss. Once you swap with the duplicate, it disappears and the spell ends.

spell.name: Sinister Return
entries: You touch a creature with Necromantic energy. Make a spell attack roll, and on a hit the creature takes {@dice 6d6} Necrotic Damage. A hit humanoid must then make a Constitution saving throw, and on a fail become cursed. If the cursed creature dies before completing three Long Rests, they rise as a zombie under your control.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot beyond 3rd.

spell.name: Strike Reflect
entries: As a reaction to taking damage from a melee weapon attack, you strike back at your foe with magical force. You gain resistance to that attacks damage and the attacker then takes force damage equal to the damage you took, and then the attacker must make a Strength Saving Throw. On a fail, they are pushed back 15ft.

spell.name: Tempest
