entries: You create a raging tornado within range. The tornado has a diameter of 20ft, and a height of 100ft. As a Bonus Action on your turn, you can move the tornado up to 30ft in a straight line. Creatures that enter the tornado or start their turn within the tornado must make a Strength Saving throw, and on a fail are flung up into the air inside of the tornado. Creatures affected by the tornado take {@dice 5d4} bludgeoning damage when they fail the saving throw, and cannot concentrate on spells, fail dexterity saving throws, cannot use a fly speed if they have one and are deafened. Creatures affected are flung a number of feet into the air equal to 1d10 x 10 when they start their turn. If a creature goes higher than the top of the tornado, they are shot out of the top of the tornado in a random direction and fall. They fly a number of feet equal to the remaining distance they would have travelled upwards.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level slot or higher, the cube size is increased by 5ft per spell slot above 5th level.

spell.name: The Forbidden Spell
entries: You lash out with magical energy at a creature within range. Make a spell attack roll against them, and on a hit they take {@dice 1d6} Force Damage. That creature also removes {@dice 1d4} from their next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.
This spell can also be cast as a leveled spell, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} per casting slot level used.
This spell's base damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 5th level, 11th, and 17th level.
If someone casts Wish and attempts to recreate this spell it is cast at 9th level, and the caster incurs the penalties described in using Wish to do anything but cast a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell can also be cast as a leveled spell, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} per casting slot level used.

spell.name: Time Lock

components.m: a small doll and an hourglass worth 25gp

entries: You reach out with grasping magical forces to freeze a target in time and space. Choose one target in range, that target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become stunned. While stunned in this way the target is not aware of its surroundings and is immune to all damage. The target cannot be moved from its current location, even remaining airborne if the ground beneath it is removed. At the end of each of its turns the target can make a Wisdom saving throw, on a success the spell ends. When the spell ends, including if they succeed on the saving throw, the target can only take an action or bonus action and has their movement speed halved until the end of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher you can target one additional creature.

spell.name: Toxic Earth
entries: You place your hand on the ground and pour corruptive energies into it turning the very earth toxic to those that touch it. The poisoned area consists of up to 5 15ft cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. The area inside each cube is difficult terrain and each time a creature starts its turn inside one of the cubes it must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d10} poison damage and become poisoned until the start of its next turn, while poisoned in this way the creature’s speed is halved. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and is not poisoned.

spell.name: Warrior's Epitaph
entries: Choose a location in range. A shimmering magical banner appears at that location. Each creature of your choice within 30ft of the banner gains advantage on all attack rolls made until the end of their next turn. In addition, whenever an ally starts its turn within 15 feet of the banner, they gain {@dice 1d4} + your spell casting ability mod in temporary hit points. A creature can pick up the banner and move it after it has appeared

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or 5th level slot, the amount of temporary hit points gained at the end of each turn increases to {@dice 1d6}, at 6th or 7th level it increases to {@dice 1d8}, and at 8th or 9th it increases to {@dice 1d10}.

spell.name: Wayfinder's Monument

components.m: a small tower built from nearby materials.

entries: You create a small monument, which creates a magical connection to you. During the spell's duration, you always know where the monument is, how far you are from the monument, if creatures of one certain type (your choice when you cast the spell) has passed within a 15ft radius of the monument, or if the monument is destroyed, which can be done by toppling the tower. Additionally once per 24 hours, you can channel for 10 minutes to transfer your senses into the monument, while your body becomes blinded and deafened to your surroundings. You can see, hear and smell from the monument, but you cannot speak through it. The connection ends when you choose to end it, or when you take damage.
If you cast this spell on the same area every day for 6 months, it becomes permanent until destroyed or dispelled.

spell.name: Whirlpool
entries: You conjure a rapid pool of twisting water at a point within range. Creatures within a 15ft cube must make a strength saving throw. On a fail, they take {@dice 3d10} bludgeoning damage and are moved as close to the centre of the cube as they can. If they would knock into another creature, both creatures take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. If this spell is cast affecting creatures in water, they have disadvantage on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell deals an additional {@dice 1d10} damager per spell slot above 2nd level.

spell.name: Wishing Star
entries: You utter a magical prayer. At the beginning of your second turn after casting this spell, select up to 3 creatures within range. A comet flies by them, as they heal 45 hit points split between them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level slot or higher, it takes one less turn to complete.

subclass.name: College of the War Poet
subclassFeatures: College of the War Poet|Bard|PHB|War Poet|TftJC|3

subclass.name: College of Tomfoolery
subclassFeatures: When The Fool Fools You, Who Is The Fool?|Bard|PHB|Tomfoolery|TftJC|6

subclass.name: Circle of the Iron Heretic
subclassFeatures: Circle of the Iron Heretic|Druid|PHB|Iron Heretic|TftJC|2

subclass.name: Way of the Four Elements 2.0
subclassFeatures: Way of the Four Elements 2.0|Monk|PHB|Four Elements 2.0|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Way of the God Hand
subclassFeatures: Way of the God Hand|Monk|PHB|God Hand|TftJC|3

subclass.name: Oath of the Masked Rider
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Masked Rider|Paladin|PHB|Masked Rider|TftJC|3

subclassFeature.name: Dasher Weapons
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you gain access to two different types of weapons. Working for one minute, you can imbue a pair of shortswords or a pair of whips with your Artificer magic transforming them into either the Flip Swords or Silver Tethers, respectfully (you are proficient in these weapons). You can only either have one of these options active at a time. If you would imbue one of these weapons with an Infusion, both are affected by the same infusion (this only counts as one infusion being active).

entries.name: Flip Swords
entries: These blades now have curved handles and guards, allowing you to hold them in a reversed grip so that the blades protect your forearms. While wielding both of the Blades, you gain the following features.

items: You gain a +1 to your AC.
Creatures hit by your blades lose 5ft of their walking speed per hit until the start of your next turn.
You can add your ability modifier for damage dealt with your off handed weapon.

entries.name: Silver Tethers
entries: These whips now have retractable metal lines.

items: The whips have a reach of 10ft and deal 1d6 slashing damage. They gain an additional 5ft of reach at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

While wielding the whips, you gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed, as you can use them similar to grappling hooks. They are strong enough to support your weight plus one additional medium or smaller creature.
You can cast Artificer spells originating from the ends of your Tethers, allowing you to cast spells up to the reach with the Tethers.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Blades
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to invent Derby Blades. Derby Blades are a magical set of shoes that you can create as an action on any set of shoes you are currently wearing, provided you have your Cobbler's Tools in hand.
You gain the following benefits while wearing the Derby Blades:

items: Your walk speed is increased by 5 at 5th level, 10 at 9th level, 15 at 13th level, and 20 at 17th level.
You can use your Derby Blades as an Arcane Focus for your Artificer Spells.

For every 5ft you move in a straight line without turning before making a melee attack with a Derby Dasher weapon, you deal an additional 1 Damage, capping the maximum damage up to your Artificer level + your INT Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Dasher Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Derby Dasher Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, and they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Derby Dasher
entries: Derby Dasher is a newer specialization found in the world of inventing, who specializes in hi-tech mobility and movement. Their ability for generating high velocity strikes and quick escapes makes them powerful infiltrators and skirmishers. To help with their abilities, they have invented new pieces of gear to help them get in, and dash out.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency in Cobbler's Tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 5th level, you can attack twice rather than once whenever you take the Attack action on you turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shocking Strikes
entries: At 9th level, you generate static along your weapons. Weapon attacks made by you deal an additional 1d6 lightning damage. Additionally, you Dasher weapons gain bonus effects.

entries.name: Flip Swords
entries: Creatures hit by two attacks made by your Flip Swords in one turn have their walking speed set to 0 until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Silver Tethers
entries: Creatures hit by your main and and off hand Silver Tethers in one turn must make a Strength Save against your DC, and on a fail are restrained until the end of your next turn, or you move beyond your Tethers Maximum reach.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Instincts
entries: At 15th level, your Derby Blades move faster than your enemies reactions. When you would be attacked by an enemy within 5ft of you, or subjected to a Saving Throw to which you are in the area of, you can use your reaction to move your movement. For melee attacks, you would no longer be in range of their attack. If this would move you out of the area of the effect of the Saving Throw, you are considered outside of its area of effect. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost-Shell
entries: In a flurry of Psionis Blasts and shining metal, a duo fight in Tandem with perfect prescision. The Inventor who readies plans and their ultimate creation, an extention of their newfound powers and will. Combining the innovations in modern Construct Creations with latent Psionic ability, Ghost-Shell Artificers' connection to their creations is their most powerful asset. Seen as an extention of Body and Mind, these innovators come equiped with a powerful mechanical force tied to its master's brainwaves.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by Psionic Energy dice, which are each a d6. You have a number of these dice equal to twice times your proficiency bonus, and they fuel various psionic powers you have, which are detailed below.

Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy die they use, as specified in a power’s description, and you can’t use a power if it requires you to use a die when your dice are all expended. You regain all your expended Psionic Energy dice when you finish a long rest. In addition, as a bonus action you can regain two expended Psionic Energy dice, but you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

When you reach certain levels in this class, the size of your Psionic Energy dice increases: at 5th level (1d8), 11th level(1d10), and 17th level (1d12). The powers below use your Psionic Energy dice.

entries.name: Shell Walk
entries: As a bonus action you can pull your shell 30ft closer to yourself or pull yourself closer to your shell. When you move in this way you do not provoke attacks of opportunity and your shell emites a burst of lightning either before or after it moves or before or after you move towards it. Each creature other than yourself must make a Dexterity saving throw or take lightning damage equal to your Psionic Energy die + your intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Psi-Tool
entries: As an action, you can summon a set of tools made of psychic force. When you summon these tools that act as a set of artisan tools and can be a part of your shell if you wish. You are proficient in the summoned tools even if you are not normally. When you use these tools for a skill check you can expend one Psionic Energy die to add the number rolled to the check. The tools exist of one hour or until you summon a new set of Psi-tools.

entries.name: Ghost Projection
entries: As an action, you can project yourself into your Shell. While in your Shell you are blind and deafened but can perceive using the senses of your Shell. While in your Shell you can use all your class abilities using your Intelligence, Charisma, and Wisdom but your Shells Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. This includes casting spells and using class features. If your Shell is destroyed while you are in it, you must make a DC 8 + the CR of your Shell (rounded up) Constitution saving throw or instantly drop to 0 HP. On a success, you instead drop to 1 HP. You can return to your own body as an action. You can use this ability once before needing a long rest, or until you expend a Psionic Energy die to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Shell
entries: At 3rd level, you create a Psionic Shell a mixture of mechanical prowess, arcane formula, and psychic reinforcement. This shell can take the form of any unnamed humanoid or beast with a CR less than your proficiency bonus. The Shell has all the statistics of that creature but cannot cast spells, has an Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma of 1, and is of type Construct. The Shell cannot regain hit points normally, instead regaining hit points if you spend up to 8 hours repairing it or regaining 5 times your proficiency bonus on a short rest.

Your Shell naturally follows you to the best of its ability, unless otherwise directed. It can take the Help, Dodge, Dash, and Disengage actions. In combat your Shell acts on your turn and can either move or take an action. As a bonus action on your turn you can grant your shell additional sentience by expending one Psionic Energy die. Once empowered, the Shell can take the Attack Action, use a Multiattack feature, or use a feature it has. The Shell then gains Temporary hit points equal to the number rolled on the Psionic Energy die + your Intelligence modifier.

As your expertise in creating Shells grows, you can access new schema at certain levels of this class. At 5th level you can create shells using the forms of Monstrosities, at 9th level you can use the forms of Dragons, at 11th level you can use the forms of celestials and fiends, and at 17th level you can use the forms of Aberrations.

subclassFeature.name: Bicameral Mind
entries: At 5th level, you learn to place a small portion of your mind into your shell at all times. Your Shell can both move and take an action while in combat. In addition, it can take the attack action without requiring empowering, making a single attack.
As long as both you and your Shell are not charmed or frightened, the other has advantage on saving throws against those effects.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Touched Spells
entries: At 5th level, when you cast a spell that deal lightning, necrotic, psychic, or force damage, you can expend a Psionic Energy die to empower the spell. An empowered spell deals additional damage equal to a roll of your Psionic Energy die.

subclassFeature.name: False Consciousness
entries: At 9th level, you have learned how to create temporary modes of consciousness and implant them into your shell. You gain access to the following abilities:

entries.name: Route Command
entries: You expend one Psionic Energy die and insert a routine command into your Shell, such as hold this door or patrol this area. The Shell performs this action autonomously for you for a number of minutes equal to the roll of the die + your intelligence modifier. If something would prevent it from carrying out this command, it will go into a dormant state until you give it a new command. If it's time expires, and you are not immediately visible it will go into a dormant state until you give it a new command, otherwise it returns to following you.

entries.name: Contingent Thought
entries: You can place a command in your Shell that activates at a given time. For example, grab me if I fall off the bridge or protect me if I fall unconscious. When the contingent event happens the Shell acts out the planned thought, gaining a bonus to any skill checks involved equal to your intelligence modifier. You can place one command at once and can do so once per long rest, or expend one Psionic Energy die to place a new one.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Frame
entries: At 15th level, you have learned a better way of constructing your Shell. Your shell can gain one of the following benefits:

items: Resistance to one type of damage from fire, lightning, thunder, force, acid, or cold.
Reduce any bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage taken by 3.
Any attack dealt by the Shell deals additional damage equal to your Psionic Energy die.

entries: You can change which of these the Shell benefits from at the end of a short rest.

In addition, when you are using your Ghost Projection, you can expend one Psionic Energy die at the start of each of your turns to restore hit points to the Shell equal to the number rolled + your Intelligence modifier. Each turn you do this, you deal lightning damage to any creatures of your choice within 15ft of the Shell equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Infected Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the power to infect others with your spells. As a Bonus Action, you can add your Virus to an Enchantment, Evocation or Necromancy spell of 1st level or higher you cast using your Poisoner's Tools.If the creature is affected by the spell, select a Virus from the Virus list, and they are affected by it and then by the spell. If the spell has a saving throw and the creature succeeds, the virus does not affect them. If the spell affects multiple creatures, they are affected by the same Virus. This feature can be used as a Free Action a number of times per Long Rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

entries.caption: Virus Types
rows: The creature has advantage on the next ability check or attack roll they make this minute.
The creature subtracts {@dice 1d6} from their next ability check or attack roll they make this minute.
The creature gains {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points.
You can reroll a number of die rolled as a part of the spell up to half of your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Necro Virus Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Necro Virus Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, and they don’t count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Necro Virus Spells
rows: crown of madness, ray of enfeeblement

subclassFeature.name: Necro Virus
entries: Years of meticulous planning and experimentation has led to this moment. Your enemies have only two choices, join willingly or die in vain. Either way, all shall know the blight of the Necro Virus. You have concocted a powerful magic which allows you to control the undead with startling ease, and even make them stronger than they were before. Infect and spread your Virus, and watch as your foes helplessly try and resist your intellect.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency in Poisoner's Tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Infectious
entries: At 5th level, you can spread your Virus to the dead. If a creature would die to a spell infected by your Virus, damage dealt by your Virus or to your Special Infected, you can use your Reaction to spread the virus to their body. Their flesh coagulates and reforms, and they arise as a Zombie under your control in 1d4 + 1 rounds. You can have a number of Zombies equal to your proficiency bonus under your control at one time from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Special Infected
entries: At 5th level, you begin tinkering with your Undead to make them more virulent. As a Bonus Action, you can expend a use of your Infected Spells to target a number of Undead under your control within 60ft of you equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down), they become juiced by your Virus. You can only have a maximum Special Infected under your control at a time equal to half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down) Each Undead becomes one of the following types of Special Infected. You can select multiple different types of Infected when using this action.

entries.name: Hunter
entries: The Undead gains +20 walking speed, a climb speed equal to it walking speed, and Expertise in Stealth.
The Hunter deals an additional {@dice 1d6} Damage on its attacks that it has advantage on.

entries.name: Bloater
entries: The Undead gains +20 maximum and current Hit points. When the Bloater takes damage from a melee source, all creatures within 5ft of it take Poison damage equal to the Artificer's Intelligence Modifier. When the Bloater Dies, each creature within 15ft of it must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC, taking 3d6 Poison damage on a fail.

entries.name: Spitter
entries: The Undead gains a new Ranged Attack, as detailed below. The Spitter additionally gains 30ft of Blindsight.
Venom Spit Ranged Attack, your Intelligence + the Undead's Proficiency Bonus to hit. Range 60/120ft. Hit 2d4 Acid Damage + The Undead’s Constitution Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Virus
entries: At 9th level, your Infected Spells are enhanced. All Virus types from Infected Spells have their die doubled. Augmentation applies to the next two rolls, and Potency can be used up to twice per spell cast. Also, you gain new virus types

entries.caption: Virus Types
rows: The creature has advantage on the next ability check or attack roll they make this minute.
The creature subtracts {@dice 1d12} from their next ability check or attack roll they make this minute.
The creature gains {@dice 2d8} temporary hit points.
You can reroll a number of die rolled as a part of the spell up half of your proficiency bonus and add +1 to each of the die rerolled (rounded down)
The creature has any damage resistances removed until the end of your next turn.
The creature immediately makes an attack at another creature of your choice within their range, without using their reaction.
The creature explodes with energy, dealing 1d12 force damage to it and all creatures within a 10ft radius.
For the next minute, the target takes 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of their turn. If they are humanoid and die while still under this effect, they immediately rise as a Zombie under your control.

subclassFeature.name: Necro Control
entries: At 9th level, you gain the ability to infect the undead with your virus. As an Action, you can target a number of undead within 60ft of you equal to your INT Modifier with a challenge rating or level no greater than your Proficiency Bonus. They must make an Intelligence Saving Throw, and on a fail they become friendly to you and obey your commands until you use this feature again.

Intelligent undead are harder to control in this way. If the target has an Intelligence of 8 or higher, it has advantage on the saving throw. If it fails the saving throw and has an Intelligence of 12 or higher, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour until it succeeds and breaks free. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.

Furthermore, Undead under your control are bolstered by your Virus. They can be healed by your Artificer Spells while under your control, and you can have zombies under your control automatically fail saving throws of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Necrotic Dissolve
entries: At 15th level, your Virus becomes flesh melting. When an Undead under your control dies, their body melts. All creatures within 10ft of the Undead take {@dice 2d10} acid damage, and they leave behind a puddle of Necrosis, which appears in a 5ft puddle directly under them. If a creature steps on it, you can immediately have them be affected by a Virus of your choice (ignoring spell school restrictions). The puddle lasts for 1 minute, or until someone steps in it.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Saboteur
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to magically sabotage mechanisms or arcane equipment within 60 feet. As a reaction, you can target one weapon, arcane focus, or magic item within range. The wielder of the object must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC, on a failure the object is sabotaged and one of the following effects takes place, depending on what the target is:

items: A weapon malfunctions or breaks, whenever it is used to make an attack the attacking creature must roll {@dice 1d4}, and on a 1 the attack hits them instead, dealing the weapons normal damage to them. This effect persists until the creature rolls a 1 or they use an action to fix the weapon, no check is required.

An arcane focus becomes unstable, spell attack rolls made with it have disadvantage, and creatures have advantage on saving throws against spells cast from it. This effect persists until the creature uses an action to fix the focus, no check is required.
A magic item becomes suppressed and stops functioning until the end of your next turn.

entries: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nullifier Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Nullifier Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of artificers spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Nullifier Spells
rows: catapult, protection from Evil and Good
dispel evil and good, hold monster

subclassFeature.name: Nullifier
entries: A Nullifier is an expert at not creating but rather undoing things. Nullifiers use their creations to suppress, break, and disrupt other inventions both magical and mundane. Nullifiers are often looked down on by other artificers, many of whom fear their abilities to undo their work, but for those not gifted in crafts the employment of a Nullifier can be invaluable in undoing magical protections

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Breaker
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain the ability to quickly sabotage non-magical inventions, machines, and mechanisms. You can use a bonus action to make a tinkerer’s tools check to sabotage one non-magical mechanism or disarm one trap within range.
In addition, when you use a tool you are proficient in to deconstruct, damage, or disarm an object you gain a bonus to that roll equal to 1d4.

subclassFeature.name: Stupefying Spells
entries: At 5th level, when you hit a creature with a spell attack that creature has disadvantage on its next attack roll. When a creature fails a saving throw for one of your spells its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Disruptive Genius
entries: At 9th level, you can disrupt spells and attacks with your mind. You can use your Flash of Genius ability to subtract from one attack roll you can see within 30 feet. In addition, you can attempt to counter a spell using your mind. When you see a spell being cast within 30 feet of you can expend one use of your Flash of Genius to use your reaction to attempt to counter. Make an Intelligence check, if you roll higher than 10 + the level of the spell, the spell fails.

subclassFeature.name: Devious Disruption
entries: At 15th level, your magical sabotage has become more deadly. Your Magical Sabator is enhanced with the following effects:

items: When a weapon malfunctions because of your Magical Sabator ability the wielder and each creature within 5 feet take {@dice 2d8} force damage.
When a spell is cast from a focus affected by your Magical Sabator ability the caster suffers magical backlash of force damage equal to twice the spell's level (1 damage for a cantrip).
A magic item becomes suppressed and stops functioning until an action is used to restart it.

entries: In addition, whenever you cast an enchantment or transmutation spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you regain one use of Magical Sabator.

subclassFeature.name: Boastful
entries: At 3rd level, you become obnoxious in your showmanship. You gain proficiency in Performance, and can add your Strength Modifier to any Performance check you would make that focuses on your raw power. While Raging, you have advantage on Performance Checks made in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Honorable Combatant
entries: At 3rd level, you become a practitioner of fisticuffs. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage, and while raging, your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage. Your unarmed strikes can be lethal. Furthermore, you can add your Charisma Modifier to your Initiative Bonus.
At 7th level, your bonus damage increases to 2d4, at 11th level it increases to 3d4, and at 15th level, it increases to 4d4.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Pugilist
entries: Not weighed down by unwieldy swords and pathetic armor, the Pugilist knows that the best weapons they own are the ones they were born with. Pugilists are just as skilled in Boxing as they are in their showmanship. A Pugilist not only wants to defeat their enemies hand to hand, but prove time and time again to their adoring fans how powerful they are.

subclassFeature.name: The Ol' One Two
entries: At 3rd level, you learn a classic technique. After using your attack action to make an unarmed strike, you can use your Bonus Action to make an unarmed strike. This can only be done while in a Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Showstopper
entries: At 6th level, you can perform a powerful wind-up punch. You can declare any unarmed attack you make with a Showstopper. A Showstopper deals an additional {@dice 1d4} + your Charisma modifier in damage. If a Showstopper reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Barbarian level + your Charisma modifier. Regardless if the Showstopper hits or misses, you may attempt to shove or grapple the target as a part of that attack. You can use a Showstopper a number of times per Short or Long rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
Additionally, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: At 10th level, you can distract your foes with your moves. As a Bonus Action, you can showcase your footwork. Creatures attacking you until the start of your next turn have disadvantage, and you can add your Charisma Modifier to Dexterity saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Stubborn
entries: At 14th level, your hard head keeps you in fights longer than the average battler. If you would drop to 0 hit points or activate Relentless Rage, you can use your reaction to immediately regain a spent use of Showstopper and make a Showstopper attack against a hostile creature within reach. If you would gain temporary hit points from your Showstopper attack, you instead gain that amount as hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Vampire
entries: Infused with the cursed blood of a hunter of the night, those who can master their Vampiric Abilities become powerful warriors. Vampiric Barbarians combine their natural strength with their unnatural abilities, chomping their way to victory.

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Fangs
entries: At 3rd level, you gain Vampiric Features. When you enter a Rage, you grow sharp fangs. They can be used as a Natural weapon that deals 1d8 piercing damage. After making your attack action, you can use your Bonus Action to make an additional attack with your Fangs.
Additionally, once per turn when you deal damage with your Fangs, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to your damage roll

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Traits
entries: At 3rd level, you gain additional traits from your Vampiric origins. You have an adversion to sunlight, and have disadvantage on attack rolls and perception checks while you are directly within sunlight. You also gain resistance to Necrotic Damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodthirsty
entries: At 6th level, you can tap into your Vampiric healing abilities. Whenever you make a Fang attack, you can heal a number of hit points equal to half of the damage dealt. You can do so a number of times per Short rest equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

While you are under half of your maximum hit points, your hunger comes out in full force. While you are in a rage, your strength score and strength score maximum are both increased by 2, up to a maximum of 30.
Your Fangs are also considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Take Flight
entries: At 10th level, you become a master of the night. While Raging, you can use an Action to transform into a Bat.

While in your Bat form, you do not need to take/deal damage to maintain your Rage. While you are a Bat, your hp is equal to your Barbarian level + your original Constitution Bonus, and you are resistant to all Damage except for Radiant.
You return to your normal form when your Rage Ends or when it is dismissed as a Bonus Action, or when the bat drops to 0 hit points. Any additional Damage taken is dealt to you.
You retain your mental statistics and your Strength, and can use your Vampiric Fangs while in this form.

subclassFeature.name: Life Consumption
entries: At 14th level, you can absorb the life force of creatures. Whenever you land the killing blow on a creature of CR 1 or greater, you can use your reaction to absorb their life force. Doing so heals you a number of hit points equal to the creature's CR (or level) x 4.

subclassFeature.name: College of the Ancients
entries: The College of Ancients is home to the bards whose focus is on the study, understanding, and emulation of ancient myths and histories. These bards spend their time hunting down long-lost ruins, ancient texts, and obscure myths to better understand the history of their world and prevent the mistakes of the past from repeating.

The bards of this college are not always as flamboyant and performative as other colleges. Often, they focus more on perfecting their written word rather than plotting grand performances to awe crowds. These bards are privy to many secret magical talents forgotten to time that allows them to better grasp the histories they study and to warn others of the troubles they may come across now. The greatest bards of these colleges are inspiring historians that have uncovered great truths about the world, but do not stop there because these bards use history to shape their own present as well.

subclassFeature.name: Stories of Olde
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your studies of ancient stories have granted you peerless mastery of the stories of old. You gain proficiency in History if you don’t already have it. In addition, whenever you make a History check with advantage you roll 3 dice and take the highest instead of rolling 2 dice. You also gain proficiency with Calligraphy’s supplies.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Providence
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn to use your vast knowledge of history to warn others of incoming danger. When a creature you can see uses a spell or an ability that forces another creature to make a saving throw you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to attempt to ward your allies from the spell. Roll your Bardic Inspiration die and add 8 + your Charisma Modifier. If the total is higher than the DC of the ability or spell all creatures that would be affected make the saving throws with advantage.

You learn the cantrip word of radiance cantrip. Additionally you automatically learn the following spells when you gain spell slots for them: healing word, invigorating word, mass healing word, word of recall, divine word, power word pain, power word stun, power word heal, power word kill.

subclassFeature.name: Truth Seeker
entries: At 6th level, you gain spells that help you access deeply guarded secrets and long forgotten lore. You learn the zone of truth and speak with dead spells which don’t count against your known spells and you can cast each once per day without expending a spell slot.
In addition when you grant a creature that is charmed or frightened your Bardic Inspiration they may immediately remake the saving throw against the effect if applicable.

subclassFeature.name: Secret Pilferer
entries: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to quickly memorize magic that you see cast or hear cast if it only has a verbal component. As a reaction when you see a spell being cast you can memorize that spell adding it to your spells known. After you have it memorized you can cast the spell as a Bard spell if you have the necessary spell slot needed. You can only have one spell memorized at a time if you memorize a new one you forget the old one. To memorize a spell, you must have at least one spell slot of that level.
In addition, once per long rest when you cast any spell that only has a verbal component it does not use a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: College of Conducting
entries: Students of the College of Conducting know that the most important member of an orchestra is the one that holds them together.These Bards see music and combat not in single parts, but as a combination of many small moving pieces creating a bigger picture. Their ability to influence these pieces cannot be understated, as any orchestra is only as good as their Conductor.

subclassFeature.name: Conductor's Baton
entries: At 3rd level, you create a Conductor's Baton. It counts as a Bard Instrument, and when used to cast Bard Spells, music magically plays around you. If you ever lose or break your Baton, you can create another one with 1 gp worth of material by spending 10 minutes of time.
As an Action, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to command a friendly creature that can hear you to use their Reaction to immediately make an Action.

subclassFeature.name: Stage Presence
entries: At 3rd level, your presence commands not only your audience, but your band. All creatures of your choice within a 15 ft radius of you have advantage on saving throws against charm and frightened effects.

subclassFeature.name: Duet
entries: At 6th level, whenever you target a friendly creature with a single target spell effect you can target another friendly creature within the spell's range. They are also under that effect. If the spell requires concentration, you are considered concentrating on both at the same time. If your concentration is broken, then both friendly creatures lose the spell effect.
You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and the spell level of the spell being Duetted can be equal to or less than your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Quickened Conducting
entries: At 14th level, your ability to conduct is quickened. Your Conductor's Baton ability can now causes two creatures of your choice to be affected

subclassFeature.name: An Advantageous Disadvantage
entries: At 3rd level, you can help allies twist a situation back in their favour. Whenever a creature inspired by you rolls with disadvantage, they can expend the Bardic Inspiration die to instead roll with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: College of Tomfoolery
entries: Tripping over their feet dashes a prankster, ready to take all of the attention. Behind these simple eyes lies that of a crafty trickster, for the more they fail, the more they are loved. Bards in the college of Tomfoolery are masters at spinning their misfortunes into beneficial situations. As they duck, dive and fail upwards, performers of this variety have egos of steel and surprisingly cunning minds

subclassFeature.name: Distracting Spells
entries: At 3rd level, you can turn your misfortunes into opportunities. Whenever a hostile creature would succeed against a Saving Throw against one of your Bard Spells, you can use your Reaction to allow an ally that can hear you to make one weapon attack against that creature. You can do so a number of times per short rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: When The Fool Fools You, Who Is The Fool?
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to trick your enemies with your foolery. Immediately after you would fail an ability check using either INT, WIS or CHA while interacting with another creature, you can attempt to confuse that creature. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC, and on a fail, your rolled value on the d20 becomes inverted (1s become 20s, 2s become 19s, etc). Creatures that are able to detect lies are immune to this feature, and you cannot use this feature when you cannot lie, like while in a Zone of Truth. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Confusing Spells
entries: At 14th level, your spellcasting becomes difficult for enemies to keep track of. After an enemy succeeds a Saving Throw against one of your Bard Spells you have casted using a spell slot, that enemy has disadvantage on the next saving throw they make within a minute using that ability score. If that enemy fails the next saving throw they would make using that ability score, they take Psychic Damage equal to your Charisma Modifier x 2.

subclassFeature.name: College of the War Poet
entries: Through the fire and smoke raging over fields, a piercing voice echoes through the darkness.
'The lands will not stay quiet, not while we draw breath. Silence is only earned in victory, or in death.'
War Poets are known for their powerful voices, words and mids. They are often seen as leaders in rebel causes, voices of reason in times of uncertainty and steadfast spirits when darkness grows.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 3rd level, you adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if something in the game lets you choose again.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property aspart of the attack you make with the weapon. Inaddition, when you hit with a ranged attack using athrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

entries.name: Raskish Fighting
entries: You learned to fight on the streets and use everything you can to your advantage. As a bonus action you can attempt a dirty trick. One creature within 10 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Str or Dex, or become blinded until the start of their next turn. In addition, whenever you hit a creature you have advantage on you deal 1d6 extra damage.

entries.name: Battle Herald
entries: You’ve learned to fight by leading the charge and inspiring your allies. While allies are within 30 feet of you and you succeed on a saving throw or score a critical hit you can use your reaction to grant a number of allies equal to your proficiency bonus temporary hit points equal to your proficiency modifier + your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Pentameter of Battle
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in medium armors, shields, and the longsword, longbow, and scimitar. In addition, you learn Calligraphy tools, if you already have proficiency in Calligraphy tools you gain a different artisan tool instead.
You ignore the spell list restrictions to cast spells from spell scrolls, and it takes you 10% less time to craft spell scrolls.

subclassFeature.name: War's Voice
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your inspiring words to turn the tide of battle for your allies. As an action on your turn, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration and activate one of your Poet Dictations. Multiple Poet Dictations reference your Bardic dice, when used in a Poetic Dictation they are counted as one die lower. D4 instead of D6, D6 instead of D8, etc. In order for a creature to be effected by a Poetic Dictation, they must be able to hear you and within 30 feet of you. A creatue can only be effected by one Poet Dictation a turn.
The following are the Poetic Dictations available to you:

entries.name: War
entries: Until the start of your next turn, creature of your choice can add bonus damage to a weapon attack equal to a roll of your Poetic Dictation die.

entries.name: Peace
entries: Until the start of your next turn, creatures within range regain hit points equal to a roll of your Poetic Dictation die.

entries.name: Valor
entries: Until the start of your next turn creature of your choice within range, gain 5ft of movement speed, this bonus increases by 5ft each time your Bardic die increases.

entries.name: Warding
entries: Roll your Poetic Dictation die, each creature of your choice that starts their turn within range gains a bonus to their AC equal to the roll until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Focus
entries: Until the start of your next turn, each creature of your choice within range can add a bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws equal to a roll of your Poetic Dictation die.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. In addition, you can now replace an attack with a use of your Poetic Dictation.

subclassFeature.name: Rhythm of War
entries: At 6th level, once per long rest when you activate a Poetic Dictation, you can choose to activate your Rhythm of War which lasts 1 minute or until your concentrating ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Once activated, you can activate a Poetic Dictation on each of the turns without expending a use of your Bardic Inspiration. When in your Rhythm of War, you cannot activate the same Poetic Dictation twice in a row.

subclassFeature.name: Herald of War
entries: At 14th level, whenever an ally is effected by your Poetic Dictations, they also gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, the time it takes you to craft scrolls is reduced by 50%, and you ignore both spell list and spell level restrictions for spell scrolls.

subclassFeature.name: Fate Domain Spells
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

subclassFeature.name: Fate Domain
entries: Some debate whether a God of Fate truly has a Domain. The nonbelievers argue that Fate is simply an idea invented by men that either fear their future or to give reason to their meaningless actions. But the true preachers of the Fate Domain know that Fate is not a predetermined destiny, but a set of probabilities that can be influenced by minute actions to achieve a desired future. Clerics of the Fate Domain pull the small universal strings to move the future in their favour.

subclassFeature.name: Threads of Change
entries: At 1st level, You learn the {@spell Guidance|PHB} Cantrip if you don't already know it. Your ability to weave fate with this cantrip is more potent, as its die turns into a {@dice d6} at 5th level, a {@dice d8} at 9th level, and a {@dice d10} at 13th level.

subclassFeature.name: Woven Fate
entries: At 1st level, whenever you expend a Spell Slot to cast aDivination spell, you gain a number of points of Woven Fate equal to the spell slot level expended. You can expend a number of points of Woven Fate to increase or decrease the value of an attack roll or ability check of a creature within 30ft of you, up to a maximum equal to your Cleric Level. You lose all points of Woven Fate after you complete a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Stolen Fate
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to fix a negative outcome in the potential future. As an Reaction, whenever a creature within 60 ft of you makes an Attack Roll or Saving Throw, you can store that value rolled on the die and replace the die roll with a 10. If you use this Channel Divinity again, you can use the value stored instead of setting it to a 10, replacing their roll with the die value stored. You can only store a die up until you complete a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Fate Weaving
entries: At 6th level, your Woven Fate can affect Saving Throws. Additionally, Guidance has a range of 30 ft.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Visions
entries: At 17th level, your knowledge of Fate is perfected. Any Divination spell that you cast using a spell slot that has a chance at failure now can never fail, nor do Divination spells require material components.

subclassFeature.name: Acolyte of All
entries: You know how to get along with people from all walks of life, races, and religions. Your vast knowledge of religions grants you proficiency in the Religion skill and allows you to add twice your Proficiency bonus to Religion checks. In addition, when you make a Persuasion check you add your Wisdom modifier to the check as well as any normal modifiers when dealing with people of faith.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, one language of your choice, as well as Calligraphy an  Painter's tools.

subclassFeature.name: Polyglot Domain Spells
entries: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared. They do not count towards your limit.

entries.caption: Polyglot Domain Spells
rows: one 1st level spell from any class but cleric, comprehend languages
one 2nd level spell from any class but cleric, suggestion
one 3rd level spell from any class but cleric, tongues
one 4th level spell from any class but cleric, compulsion
one 5th level spell from any class but cleric, seeming

subclassFeature.name: Polyglot Domain
entries: The Polyglot domain isn’t concerned with any specific god or domain but instead pledging fealty and faith to whatever god suits their needs at the current moment. Polyglot clerics don’t subscribe to a single faith but rather all of them. They may carry with them the holy symbols of dozens or hundreds of different faiths and call upon which god or gods can help them at the chosen moment.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Beseech the Divine
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to call upon whatever god will listen.
As an action, you present a holy symbol and roll {@dice 1d100}. A random effect determined by the d100 takes place immediately.

entries.caption: Beseech the Divine
rows: A god of trickery answers allows you to swap the location of yourself and one creature within 60 feet of you. You and the chosen creature teleport, swapping locations and attacks against you have disadvantage on you until the start of your next turn.

A god of death answers, each creature of your choice with 30ft of you must make a Wisdom saving throw or suffer {@dice 2d8) + your cleric level necrotic damage and be unable to regain hit points until the end of their next turn.

A god of fire answers and a flame bursts to life in your hand. The flame sheds bright light in a 15ft radius. Each creature of your choice in the bright light adds {@dice 1d4} to saving throws they make while in the light. The flame takes one hand to keep lit and stays lit until you close your hand or 1-minute passes.

A god of the seas answers, summoning a powerful deluge of water. A surge of water rushes forward from you in a 10ft wide 60ft long line. Each creature in the line takes {@dice 1d6} + your cleric level and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and pushed back 15 feet.

A god of nature answers your call. Barklike growth springs to life over your body granting you resistance to Bludgeoning damage and your cleric level in Temporary hit points. This effect lasts for 1 hour.

A god of mercy answers your call. Each creature within 60 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are charmed by you and while charmed in this way cannot attack another creature or cast a harmful spell. This effect lasts until the end of their turn or until they take damage from any source

A god of law answers, select one creature within 60 feet that must make a Charisma saving throw. If they fail you can designate one action that the creature cannot take for the next minute. The action must be specific, such as casting the spell magic missile or hitting your allies with their sword. If the creature takes this prohibited action they take {@dice 3d8} + cleric level radiant damage and the effect end.

A god of darkness answers, choose a number of creatures up to your cleric level with 60 feet. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are blinded until the end of their next turn.
A god of bravery answers. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you gains your cleric level in temporary hit points and if they are affected by the frightened condition the condition ends.

A god of storms answers, a powerful storm erupts in a 60-foot radius around you. Each creature of your choice must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 2d10} + your cleric level and be unable to take reactions until the end of their next turn. Until the end of your next turn all ranged weapon attacks in the 60-foot radius have disadvantage as the heavy winds swirl.

A god of change answers, each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you until the end of your next turn. While charmed in this way they randomly determine their action as if affected by the confusion spell.
A god of knowledge answers, you gain true sight out to 60 feet for the next minute.
A god of hope answers, each creature of your choice within 30 feet regains {@dice 1d8} + your cleric level hp and removes the prone, grappled, or restrained conditions.

A god of light answers and emblazons your holy symbol with truth finding light. You cast bright light for 30 feet, any invisible creature inside the light is revealed and any melee weapon attacks made by you or your allies deal {@dice 1d8} extra radiant damage. The light shrinks by 5 feet at the end of each of your turns until it vanishes completely.
A god of order answers. Every creature of your choice within 60 feet cannot be affected by disadvantage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Polytheist's Gamble
entries: At 6th level, when you use your Beseech the Divine Channel Divinity you can increase or decrease the result by up to 10. In addition, you gain one cantrip of your choice from any class's spell list, this cantrip becomes a cleric cantrip for you.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Many
entries: At 17th level, when you use your Beseech the Divine Channel Divinity you can roll twice and have two effects manifest. If you roll the same effect twice, reroll one of the effects.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Dragon
entries: The Dragon's Tail is not shockingly home to powerful scaled beasts. The settlers that have shared the islands with these beasts have adapted to their might, and even taken on some of their characteristics.
Druids of the Circle of Dragon embody the unbridled power of a Dragon within them. From toughened scales to powerful breath weapons, their grace and might shall be known to all.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Companion
entries: At 2nd level, you learn the {@spell Find Familiar|PHB} spell. It is a Druid spell for you, is always prepared and does not count against the number of spells you can prepare. Whenever you cast Find Familiar, it appears as a Pseudodragon. This Pseudodragon can make the attack action, and you can use your Bonus Action to command it to do so.

subclassFeature.name: The Dragon's Soul
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you gain a connection to Draconic beings. You learn Draconic, and additionally you grow scales. While you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Your Wild Shapes have a Draconic flare to them, and this bonus is still provided while you are in Wild Shape.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to launch breath weapons. Asa Bonus Action, you can exhale elemental power. Select a Breath Weapon from the list below. Their DC is equal to yourDruid spell saving throw. You can use this feature while in Wild Shape. Its deals {@dice 3d8} damage, increasing by to {@dice 4d8} at 9th level, and {@dice 5d8} at 13th level. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier per Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: From Fur to Scales
entries: At 10th level, your Wild Shape list now includes Dragons, and you can expend two uses of your Wild Shape to transform into a Wyrmling Dragon of your choice, and at 14th level this becomes a Young Dragon. Also, you can cast {@spell Polymorph|PHB} on yourself once per short rest, but can only select a Dragon as a possible form.

subclassFeature.name: Affinity
entries: At 14th level, you fully embrace your Draconic abilities. As an Action, you can unleash a pair of Draconic Wings from your body. You gain a flying speed of 80 feet. This lasts for 10 minutes, and you can do this once per long rest.

Furthermore, all beasts you Wild Shape into are treated as Dragons. Whenever you use your Wild Shape, they also gain the aforementioned wings and flying speed. If they already have a flying speed that is slower than 80 ft, it becomes that.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Iron Heretic
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Iron Heretic find their calling not in the preservation of nature, but in the advancement of it. They see nature as the perfect mechanism for the advancement of intelligent races but unlike their brethren, they do not shy away from the exploitation of natural resources into valuable tools.

These druids use their magic to twist metal and stone into cold lifeless mimicry of natural life and push their own power forward by consuming natural material. Their disregard for nature for progress often puts them at odds with other druidic circles, hence their branding as heretics.

Druids in this circle do not necessarily see natural life as different from that created through construct magic, treating both as useful tools to advance intelligent life forwards. These druids believe that progress and destruction are a natural part of life, embracing modernity as opposed to rejecting it.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your relationship with metal grants you the ability to tap into magic forbidden to other druids. At 2nd level, you learn one of the following cantrips: booming blade, green flame blade, or sword burst. At 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th levels you gain access to the spells listed for that level in the Circle of the Iron Heretic Spells table.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn’t appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Construct Creation
entries: You can expend 2 uses of your Wild Shape to cast the Find Steed Spell. When you summon a steed in this way it is considered a Construct and gains the AC and all other benefits your armor provides you. It also gains the effects of Metal Carapace.

subclassFeature.name: Metallic Carapace
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to make use of metal and shape it into natural shapes. As an action, while wearing metal armor, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to shape both your body and the metal into a new form. You Wild Shape into a Beast as normal but your new form has the following difference: Your AC in your new form is equal to the AC of the armor you were wearing in your normal form, and you benefit from all additional effects granted by your armor.

items: Your creature type is Construct and you cannot regain hit points in your new form.
Your speed in all forms decreases by 10ft.
Your attacks in this form deal {@dice 1d6} extra fire damage from your super-heated metal. This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at level 9 and {@dice 3d6} at level 16.

entries: While wearing heavy armor you cannot Wild Shape into a non-metallic version of your Wild Shape.

subclassFeature.name: Shell of Iron
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain proficiency in heavy armor and ignore the restriction on wearing metal that druids normally have.

subclassFeature.name: Beastial Metal
entries: At the 6th level, you gain the ability to reshape metal both inside and outside of your Wild Shape. You can use a bonus action to expend a use of your Wild Shape to manifest one of the following benefits on a suit of metal armor you are wearing for one hour:

items: Beastial Weapons: You create a natural weapon on your armor such as claws, a bladed tail, or fangs on the helmet. These weapons deal {@dice 1d8} magical damage of either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing (chosen when you choose the weapon). These weapons are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance.
Animalistic Movement: You gain a swim, climb, or burrow speed as your metal converts into claws, fins, or extra legs to assist with movement.
Enhanced Carapace: Your armor changes to grant you resistance to fire, thunder, or lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Creation Core
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to breathe life into metal and grant it a bestial form. You can expend two uses of your Wild Shape to Cast Find Greater Steed. When you summon the steed it is instead of type Construct and gains all the benefits of your Metal Carapace feature. Instead of applying your Beastial Metal to yourself, you can cause it to affect your steed from this feature instead.

subclassFeature.name: Rare Metallics
entries: At 14th level, you have learned to pull trace amounts of rare metals from the earth to fuel your Wild Shapes. When you use your Metallic Carapace or Beastial Metal feature you can choose to apply one of the following benefits:

items: Adamantine: You gain immunity to Critical Hits and your weapons deal double damage to structures and Constructs.
Mythril: Your speed increases by 10 feet instead of decreasing by 10 feet and your natural weapon score Critical Hits on 19 or 20.
Platinum: Your AC increases by 2 and you gain resistance to Radiant damage.

entries: When you summon a steed with the find greater steed spell granted from this class you can apply one rare metallics to your summon.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Seasons
entries: The Circle of Seasons is made up of the attendants of the Fey Court's servants, confidants, assassins, and ambassadors employed by the great Archfey. These druids work to maintain balance and peace between the various factions of the Fey Realm and when needed are sent to the Material Plane to act on the behalf of their masters.

Groups of these druids serve exclusively on the Material Plane as well, forming tribes based on their seasonal prowess. Tribes in great tundra might be masters of their winter forms while their desert dwelling cousins' savants of the fiery summer power. These clans were usually started by an ancestor that crossed over from the Fey Realm and now after generations may not even remember the true meaning behind their powers

subclassFeature.name: Nobility of Court
entries: Starting when you take this circle at 2nd level, you gain knowledge of the proceedings and etiquette of the Season Courts. You learn Sylvan and gain proficiency in Persuasion, your proficiency bonus for Persuasion is doubled when dealing with fey.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Forms
entries: At 2nd level, when you use your Wild Shape you can further enhance your form with the power of the Seasonal Courts. When you Wild Shape you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Druid level x 3, and also you can choose from the Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn forms and gain its special abilities while you are in your chosen Wild Shape form:

items: Summer: You gain resistance to fire and your attacks deal 1d6 extra fire damage, this fire damage increases to 1d8 at 7th level, 1d10 at 13th level, and 1d12 at 18th level.
Spring: You gain resistance to acid damage and you gain the Vibrant Aura feature
Autumn: You gain the Shock Bolt ranged attack and resistance to lightning damage.
Winter: You gain resistance to cold damage and gain the Frost Breath Special action.

entries.name: Vibrant Aura
entries: Vines and plant life spring to life creating a 10ft radius of difficult terrain around you. In addition, any creature of your choice that regain hit points in that radius regains extra hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Shock Bolt
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against one creature. On hit it deals 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier and the creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure it cannot make a reaction until the start of its next turn. The damage increases to 2d6 at 7th level, 3d6 at 13th level, and 4d6 at 18th level.

entries.name: Frost Breath (Recharge 6)
entries: You exhale a blast of freezing wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to 3d8 at 7th level. 3d10 at 13th level, and 3d12 at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Guide
entries: Starting at 6th level, you become an expert at leading groups of people through dangerous areas. While creatures are within 30 ft of you, they benefit from the following effects: They have advantage on Constitution Saving throws to resist the effects of extreme cold or heat, they ignore the effects of difficult terrain caused by natural or magical plants, and have advantage on saving throws to resist being grappled or restrained by natural or magical plants.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Warden
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you use your Seasonal Forms wild shape you can choose to remain in your normal form while gaining the benefits of the Seasonal Form you choose. In addition, you deal extra damage on your spells based on your current Season Form. You add your Wisdom modifier to spells that deal fire for summer, cold for winter, acid for spring, and lightning for autumn while you are in that form. You still gain the aforementioned Temporary hit points from your Seasonal Forms feature, and when these temporary hit points are lost, you lose the bonuses from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Land and Air
entries: Starting at 14th level your Seasonal forms change the world around you. While in your Seasonal Form or Seasonal Warden form you create a 15ft aura around you with effects depending on your form:

items: Summer: Friendly creatures have resistance to fire damage and hostile creatures take fire damage equal to your proficiency modifier at the start of their turns.
Spring:  Friendly creatures have resistance to acid damage and regain the maximum hit points possible from healing spells
Autumn: Friendly creatures have resistance to lightning damage and hostile creatures that cast spells in the radius take lightning damage equal to half your druid level.
Winter: Friendly creatures have resistance to cold damage and hostile creatures have their movement speed reduced by 10

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Titans
entries: Meek and meager beasts have inhabited the lands today, but deep beneath the ground lay the bones of Titans who once ruled over all. Some Druids channel these dead beasts to return their might to the puny world above. Channeling the energy of ancient beasts, Druids of the Circle of Titans empower themselves with long forgotten colossi.

subclassFeature.name: Knowledge of Ancient Beasts
entries: At 2nd level, you learn of Ancient Beasts that once walked the lands. You can Wild Shape into any Dinosaur Beast (so long as you still meet any wild shape restrictions). You also learn the Primordial Language, or another language if you know this language already.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Form
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you can embolden your Wild Shapes with Titanic Power. When you enter a Wild Shape, you can choose to make that form a Titan. It grows one size category larger, and its Strength is increased by 2, up to 20. It additionally gains 1 extra hit point per hit die that creature has.

Additionally, you can expend 2 uses of your Wild Shape to transform into a Dinosaur. You must be a Druid level equal to or higher than that creature's CR to transform into it. You cannot make a Dinosaur you Wild Shape into with this ability a Titan.

subclassFeature.name: Menacing Stature
entries: At 6th level your body gains the ability to grow as well. You learn the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} spell, and always have it prepared as a Druid spell for you. You can only cast the Enlarge portion of the spell. Whenever you would attack a creature that is at least a size category smaller than you, you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage equal to how many size categories smaller that creature is compared to you.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Might
entries: At 6th level, your Titanic Forms grow even stronger. When you enter a Wild Shape, if the creature's strength score is less than 18 after entering a Titan Form, it becomes 18. Additionally, Titanic Wild Shapes have resistance to non magical Bludgeoning, Slashing and Piercing Damage.

subclassFeature.name: Indomitable Stature
entries: At 10th level, your Menacing Stature is improved. When you cast Enlarge/Reduce, you now grow the target two size categories. Your Titanic Wild Shapes also grow two Size categories. Your Wild Shapes are considered Monstrosities now when you choose to make them a Titan

subclassFeature.name: Primal Reckoning
entries: At 14th level, your Titanic might is at its peak. Your Wild Shapes now heal a number of missing hit points equal to their Constitution Modifier + your Proficiency Bonus at the beginning of your turn while you are under half of your maximum hit points, and their Strength Minimum now becomes 22. All creatures of your choice that are smaller than your Wild Shape forms must make a Wisdom Saving throw against your Druid DC when they either start their turn within 30ft of you, or enter that space. On a Fail, they are Frightened until they leave this area, and on a success they are immune to the effect for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Armsmaster
entries: A Divine solider, gifted a weapon from the heavens. Slicing down foes, with the might of Celestials, the Angelic Armsmaster unleashes Divine Fury.
Angelic Armsmasters can summon weapons of light to adapt to any situation and destroy any foe.

subclassFeature.name: Language of the Gods
entries: At 3rd level, you become adept in speaking to angelic beings. You learn Celestial, or alternatively you gain proficiency in the Arcana, History or Religion skill.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon of the Gods
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, your connection to Celestials can allow you to conjure weapons of Light. You can conduct a 1 hour ritual with a weapon you are holding to convert it into a Weapon of the Gods, at which time it vanishes.

As a Bonus Action, you can conjure one of your Weapon of the Gods. It appears as a glowing and translucent version of that weapon. If the weapon requires ammo, you additionally create a quiver or pouch filled with the required ammunition. This weapon can be dismissed as a Free Action. If the weapon would leave your hands, it disappears after one round. You can only have one weapon conjured at a time.

This weapon deals Radiant damage instead of its normal damage type. Additionally, once per turn you gain a bonus to your damage rolls equal to your Proficiency Bonus when using your Weapon of the Gods.
Finally, you learn the {@spell Light|PHB} cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Light Constructs
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to use Radiant Reach and Light Shield. You can use these features a total number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest. The Spiritual Weapon uses your Wisdom to calculate to-hit bonus and damage rolls.

entries.name: Radiant Reach
entries: You can cast the spell Spiritual Weapon, selecting a weapon in your arsenal as the Spiritual Weapon, it then gains any bonuses that weapon has, and deals Radiant Damage instead of Force. It returns to your Arsenal after the spell ends.

entries.name: Light Shield
entries: As a Reaction to an ally within 30ft of you being attacked, you can cast Shield of Faith on that creature, potentially making the attack miss them. You then begin concentrating on the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Blinding Brilliance
entries: At 10th level, you can perform a Blinding Attack. After hitting a creature with a Weapon of the Gods, you can force that creature and all other creatures within a 10ft radius of it to make a Constitution Saving Throw, using your Wisdom Modifier to calculate the DC (8 + prof + WIS). Creatures that fail are blinded until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest.
Additionally, you are immune to the blinded condition when the source would be from a powerful light.

subclassFeature.name: Pierce the Light
entries: At 15th level, you can weaken your foes to your Light. As a part of conjuring a weapon through Weapon of the Gods, you can select a creature you can see within 60 ft of you. Until the start of your next turn, they become vulnerable to Radiant damage. You can only do so once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Angelic Arsenal
entries: At 18th level, you can unleash your entire arsenal. As an Action, select a point within 60ft that you can see. Creatures within a 15 ft radius of this point must make a Dexterity Saving throw, using your Wisdom Modifier to calculate the DC. Creatures that fail take {@dice 12d6} radiant damage, as weapons rain down on them, or half as much on a successful save. Creatures of your choice are immune to this damage. You can use this ability once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Desert Acclimation
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you are accustomed to battling within a sandy terrain. You are not affected by difficult terrain on uneven ground, or shifting sands. You have advantage on Constitution based saving throws against overheating. You can hold 4 times the amount of water in your body than the average person. Finally, you know the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrip which increases in size to a 10ft cube at 7th level, and a 2oft cube at 10th level, and a 100ft cube at 18th level, and can use it as a Bonus Action if using it on sand.

subclassFeature.name: Desertstrider
entries: Deep in the Dunish Desert travels warriors accustomed to its unique terrain. From wanderers, bandits and soldiers, Desertstriders make the most of their environment in combat,harnessing the sands for their strength.

Desertstriders control their terrain to confuse and control their foes. Desertstriders are able to shift the earth to their will, showing no mercy to their foes, as does the unrelenting dunes of Dunish.

subclassFeature.name: Sand Swipe
entries: At 3rd level, you can weave sand into your attacks. At the start of your turn, you can fling sand at a creature within 10ft's eyes provided you have a free hand to do so. Your first attack against that target has advantage. You can instead use this at the end of your turn, and the target's next attack before the end of their next turn has disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Pitfall
entries: At 7th level, you can cause disturbances in the ground to pull in your prey. You can replace one attack to stomp the ground. All creatures standing on the ground that are no more than one size category greater than yours within a 15ft radius of you must make a Dexterity Saving Throw (DC = 8 + prof + CON). Any creatures that failed are pulled within 5ft of you. If this ability would affect an underground creature, they automatically fail the saving throw and are pulled aboveground to you. If this ability is used on sandy terrain, creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sand Blast
entries: At 10th level, your Sand Swipe is improved. When you use Sand Swipe, you next attack deals an additional {@dice 1d12} piercing damage, and if used instead at the end of your turn, the next time you would take damage that amount is reduced by {@dice 1d12}. Sand Swipe's range also becomes 30ft.

subclassFeature.name: Shape Earth
entries: At 10th level, you Mold Earth cantrip is enhanced. It now affects a 30 ft cube. Mold Earth also gains the following effect.

items: If you target an area of earth, you can transform it into sand.

subclassFeature.name: Land Shark
entries: At 15th level, you can travel through the ground. You can a burrow speed equal to your walking speed. When burrowing through sand, that speed is doubled.
