While underground, you gain a tremorsense of 15ft, and this range is doubled when in sand. Finally, your Pitfall's radius is increased to 30ft and can pull creatures affected by it underground towards you if you use it while burrowing. Creatures affected by Pitfall take {@dice 1d12} + your Constitution Modifier bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Terramaster
entries: At 18th level, your earth shaping abilities are at their peak. Your {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} Cantrip can now affect a 100ft cube.
You learn the {@spell Earthquake|PHB} spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot once per long rest (DC = 8 + prof + CON).

subclassFeature.name: Buckshot Archetype
entries: The sound of a heavy gun cocking echoes through the streets. A gas canister flies though the air, as fog obscures the area, the only thing that can be heard is the sound of a loud boom. As the smoke clears, a lone gunner walks off, with their boomstick proudly slung over their shoulder.

subclassFeature.name: Raw Muscle
entries: At 2nd level, You gain proficiency in Athletics, and you gain proficiency in Medium Armor. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain another from the Gunner's skill list.

subclassFeature.name: Shotgun Progression
entries: As your skills improve, you learn to modify your Shotgun. As your Gun Tier levels up, your weapon is upgraded into its next tier by paying for the upgrade cost and spending 1 hour using your Gunsmith's Tools. If you lose or need to replace your special firearm, you can spend 1 hour per Tier it was crafting a new one, and the combined gold cost.

subclassFeature.name: Shrug It Off
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, you learn to shake off damage. You can forgo an attack on your turn to instead gain a number of temporary hit points equal to half of your level in this class + your Strength modifier + half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) per hostile creature within 5ft of you. You lose all temporary hit points granted by this feature outside of combat, and can only use this feature whenever you are below half of your maximum hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Buckshot Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Buckshots gain access to new modifications which do not count against their known Modifications. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Smokescreen
entries: At 6th level, you learn to craft smokebombs. You craft a number of smokebombs equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest, and can have a number of Smokebombs equal to your Proficiency Bonus. You can replace a ranged attack with a Shotgun firearm with a smokebomb, firing it out of your Shotgun a distance up to its range. The smokebomb then detonates and fills a 10ft radius area with smoke, heavily obscuring it. The smoke remains for a number of rounds equal to your Proficiency Bonus, or until blown away by a strong wind.

subclassFeature.name: Push 'em Off
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to get foes out of your space. After you use Shrug it Off, if there is a creature within your melee attack range, you can bodycheck them. You expend a use of Shoot to Thrill, and the target creature makes a Strength Saving throw (DC equal to 8 + the firearm you are currently wielding's tier x2). On a fail, they are shoved back up to 10 feet, and then you can immediately make a ranged attack with a firearm against that creature as a part of this action.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot to Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enhanced. When making a ranged attack with a Shotgun that is enhanced by Shoot to Thrill, if the attack hits the length of its cone is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Scatterslug
entries: At 14th level, your Buckshot is more deadly. Creatures immediately behind your initial target of ranged attacks made by your shotgun firearms no longer have the damage dealt to them by the cone halved.

subclassFeature.name: Blast Gun Progression
entries: As your skills improve, you learn to modify your Blast Gun. As your Gun Tier levels up, your weapon is upgraded into its next tier by paying for the upgrade cost and spending 1 hour using your Gunsmith's Tools. The Blast Gun has unique modifications, which are unlocked at level 5, and these modifications can be upgraded at level 13 by paying the gold cost and spending 4 hours of work. These modifications can be attacked to the Blast Gun to allow it to perform new attacks. These new attacks have separate ranges, damage types, and use their own ammunition.

subclassFeature.name: Demolitionist Archetype
entries: Walking through the smoke of a destroyed building emerges a creature, head to toe in weapons of mass destruction. Between explosives, guns and fire, the Demolitionist is ready for any mission, so long as that mission is causing as much destruction as possible.

As a Demolitionist, you excel in destruction. Between your array of unique weaponry to your aggressive fighting style, Demolitionists put themselves in the way of danger to fully utilize their weaponry to its potential.

subclassFeature.name: Frontloaded Savagery
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, your attacks become lethally savage. Your firearms gain an additional range, equal to half of its normal range. Attacking an enemy in this range with a Firearm allows you to reroll a number of the damage die up to your Constitution Modifier once per turn. You also gain proficiency in Medium Armor.

subclassFeature.name: Property Damage
entries: At 2nd level, your firearms blow up the neighbourhood. Your Demolitionist Firearms deal double damage to structures and buildings.

subclassFeature.name: Demolitionist Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Demolitionists gain access to new modifications which do not count against their known Modifications. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Overcustomized Firearms
entries: At 6th level, you can modify your weapons past their limits. You can treat all firearms as if they have an additional Modification Slot. Only you can benefit from the additional modification.

subclassFeature.name: Rocket Jump
entries: At 10th level, you can use your firearms to make a narrow escape. You can expend a use of Shoot to Thrill, and then replace one of your attacks with your Blast Gun with a Rocket Jump, which allows you to immediately fly up to 30ft in an arc in a direction of your choice. This does not provoke opportunity attacks. If there were creatures within 5ft of your starting pointCreatures within 5ft must make a Dexterity Saving Throw (DC equal to 8 + the firearm's tier x2) all creatures hit then take the Blast Gun's damage. You still take falling damage as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot To Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enhanced. When Shoot to Thrill is used to an enhance a ranged attack made with a Blast Gun or one of its Modified weapon attacks, the attack gains explosive 15 (or if the attack already has explosive, 15 is added to the radius). This attack deals maximum damage to structures.

subclassFeature.name: Fear No Flame
entries: At 14th level, you learn to bear the damage you cause. You gain resistance to Fire damage, and creatures of your choice have advantage on explosive saving throws you impose on them. You take no damage from Demolitionist Firearms you attack with.

subclassFeature.name: Burst Strike
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, you can use the cartridges loaded in your Gunblade to bolster your attacks. As a part of a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend 1 cartridge from your Gunblade’s barrel to deal an additional 1d10 Fire damage, in addition to the weapons normal damage. If you miss your attack, the cartridge is still consumed. This feature can only be used when using a Gunblade. This damage increases as you gain levels in this class, growing to 2d10 at level 11.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn’t behind total cover, even if you’re blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Rakish Fighting
entries: You learned to fight on the streets and use everything you can to your advantage. As a bonus action you can attempt a dirty trick. One creature within 10 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Str or Dex, or become blinded until the start of their next turn. In addition, whenever you hit a creature you have advantage on you deal 1d6 extra damage.

subclassFeature.name: Gunblade Progression
entries: As your skills improve, you learn to modify your Gunblade. As your Gun Tier levels up, your weapon is upgraded into its next tier by paying for the upgrade cost and spending 1 hour using your Gunsmith’s Tools. If you lose or need to replace your special firearm, you can spend 1 hour per Tier it was by crafting a new Gunblade, and the combined gold cost.

subclassFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype
entries: Moving faster than a speeding bullet, this warrior combines steel and gunpowder to eviscerate his foes. As a Gunbreaker, you specialize in close range combat while weaving in bullets and flaming strikes with your Gunblade, a perfect marriage of blade and gun.

subclassFeature.name: Gunbreaker Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Gunbreakers gain access to new modifications which do not count against their known Modifications. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Rough Divide
entries: Beginning at 6th level, as a bonus action on your turn, you may expend one cartridge from your barrel to increase your movement speed by 15ft, or triple your jump distance (your choice when using this feature) until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Draw and Junction
entries: Beginning at 10th level you new ways to fire your Gunblade:

entries.name: Danger Zone
entries: As an action on your turn, you may expend any number of cartridges from your Gunblade, creating an explosion centered on you with a 10ft radius. All other creatures in range must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC is equal to 8 + the tier of your firearm x 2), taking 2d8 Fire damage for each cartridge spent on a failure, and half as much on a success.

entries.name: Royal Guard
entries: When you or an ally within your reach or the short range of your weapon takes damage, you can use your reaction to expend a bullet to reinforce the creatures body. The creature takes reduced damage from that source equal to a roll of your Burst Strike + your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot to Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enhanced. Using Shoot to Thrill also activates your Burst Strike without expending a bullet.

subclassFeature.name: Renzokuken
entries: Beginning at 14th level, as an action on your turn, you may expend all cartridges remaining in your Gunblade, and make an attack against a creature within range for each cartridge expended in this way (you cannot select the same creature twice). Each of these attacks is treated as being a Burst Strike attack. Each attack made in succession while using this feature increases your Gunblades Misfire score by 1 until the end of your turn.
Once you’ve used this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hexed Bullets
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, you gain the ability to magically enchant bullets to produce deadly effects. You learn three Hexed Bullets, as listed in the Hexed Bullets Progression Table, and can produce up to twice your proficiency bonus of those bullets when you finish a long rest. Whenever you finish a long rest, all the Hexed Bullets you have enchanted lose their potency. You learn an additional Hexed Bullet whenever you learn a new tier of firearm.

Prepared Hexed Bullets are placed in a magical receptacle, such as an enchanted bandolier, a special clip, or other magical storage device. As a free action once per turn when you make a ranged weapon attack with a firearm, you can cause one of the prepared Hexed Bullets to teleport into your firearm, enhancing your next attack with that Hexed Bullets effects, and consuming one use of your Hexed Bullets.
Whenever you gain another Gunner level, you can replace a known Hexed Bullet option with another.

entries.caption: Hexlock Spellcasting
rows: The shot deals additional damage of either fire, lightning, cold, acid, or thunder (chosen when created) equal to 1d6+the tier of the gun.
The attack’s range is increased to its maximum range, with no short range. In addition, if the attack hits you can target another creature within range and remake the attack with disadvantage.

This attack deals extra radiant damage equal to half your gunner level, this bonus is doubled against undead and fiends. In addition if the target is an undead or fiend, any Undead Fortitude or Magical Resistance that creature might have ceases to function until the start of your next turn.

A creature hit by this bullet must make a Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. A creature can use an action on subsequent turns to attempt to break free by making an Athletics or Acrobatic check against your save DC. On a failure they take piercing damage equal to half your gunner level, on a success they break free.

The fired bullet shatters into tiny magical darts. You create a number of these darts equal to your firearm’s tier, each dart deals force damage equal to a single die of the weapon’s damage die + the firearm’s tier. These darts automatically hit targets within the short range of your weapon. These darts can be blocked by effects that would block magic missile.
The hit creature must make a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10ft and deal half damage on Strength based weapon attacks until the start of your next turn.
The hit creature takes additional Force damage equal to the Weapon’s Tier, and afterward you teleport to an unoccupied space of your choice within 15ft of that creature.

Choose one spell you know. When fired the shot takes the effect of that spell, if the spell comes from a point, the point can be any place within range that you could fire at (this expends the spell slot).

Choose a point with your firearms short range. Each creature with 15ft of that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure they suffer the weapons damage die in thunder damage + your INT modifier and are deafened and blinded until the start of your next turn. On a success they take half damage and are not blinded or deafened.

You fire your gun into the air, bolstering allies within 30ft of you. Each ally gains temporary hit points equal to the firearm’s tier + your INT modifier and has advantage on the next attack roll they make.

The hit creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become swarmed by small insects. While swarmed it cannot benefit from cover (including full) from you and all attacks have advantage against it. At the end of the creature’s turn it can remake the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
The hit creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw they would make against a Spell.

You fire a drilling bullet that cuts through anything it hits. Your attack becomes a 5ft line with a range equal to the gun’s short range. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw or take Piercing damage equal to the gun’s damage die + your INT modifier. On a success they take half damage.
This bullet triples your gun’s misfire score for this shot but if it hits deals maximum damage.

You make the attack roll at disadvantage, you cannot gain advantage from any source on this attack. If the attack hits, you regain one expended pact slot and deal extra damage equal to twice that spell slot’s level.

A creature hit with this bullet must make a Constitution saving throw or become restrained. If restrained, on their next turn, they must make the Constitution save again. On a success, the restrained ends. On a failure, they are petrified as they turn to gold. This petrification lasts 1 minute, or until the creature takes damage equal to twice your gunner level.
When fired, expend one spell slot. If the attack hits, it deals additional radiant damage equal to 4d8 + 1d8 for each spell level.
Religion from Magical Acolyte. Only one can be prepared per long rest.
When fired, the bullet explodes into wooden spears. Make an attack roll against any number of creatures within range.
Nature from Magical Acolyte. Only one can be prepared per long rest.

The bullet is fired on the Ethereal Plane. The target’s AC is calculated using only the target’s Dexterity bonus, ignoring bonuses granted from Shields, Armor and other AC increasing effects. This bullet passes through all barriers, including things such as Wall of Force, Force Cage, or planar portals. On hit, the target takes additional force damage equal to twice the difference between your attack roll and their AC.
Arcana from Magical Acolyte. Only one can be prepared per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hexlock Archetype
entries: As bullets fly from the chamber, runes along the bullet suddenly burst to life, casting a golden tail behind the bullet as it flies forth. The bullet lands true between the ghast's head and for a second the undead monstrosity merely recoils from the impact before a burst of gold blasts out its eyes and mouth, the creature slumps to the ground, dead.

As a Hexlock you merge the complex machinery of firearms with the equally complex nature of magic. You possess a multitude of magical enhancements that can be placed on ammunition, turning your bullets into sanctified missiles, explosive ordinance, or bolts of lightning.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Acolyte
entries: At 2nd level, you choose an arcane discipline to learn from to enchant your firearms. You gain proficiency in either Nature, Religion, or Arcana, and your proficiency bonus for that skill is doubled. Depending on your choice, you unlock a unique Hexed Bullet the Pact Magic feature. If you choose Nature, your spell list is from the Druid and Ranger list, if you chose Religion your spell list is from the Cleric and Paladin list, and if you chose Arcana your spell list is from the Wizard and Artificer list. Regardless of your choice, your spell casting modifier is Intelligence.
At certain level, when you gain new Hexed Bullets you automatically learn the ones associated with your spellcasting list.

subclassFeature.name: Firearm Enchanter
entries: At 6th level, you have mastered placing arcane enhancements on firearms. The first Hexlock modification placed on a firearm does not count against the number of modifications on a weapon.
Firearms with at least one Hexlock modification count as magical when overcoming damage resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Hexlock Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Hexlocks gain access to new modifications which do not count against their Modifications known. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot To Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enhanced. When Shoot to Thrill is used to enhance a ranged weapon attack, you can choose to immediately apply one Hexed Bullet to the attack, following the normal restrictions of that bullet.

subclassFeature.name: Spellshot Combo
entries: At 10th level, after casting a spell or cantrip you can make one ranged weapon attack with a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Hex Master
entries: At 14th level, you learn to apply Hexes on the fly. You can replace any number of bullets fired on your turn with Hexed Bullets.
If you ever roll for initiative with no remaining Hexed Bullets, regain one use.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw Archetype
entries: A lone desperado stares down his opponent whilst the townsfolk watch on in anticipation. The clock strikes twelve, and in a flash of light, the desperado blows the smoke from his gun.

As a Quickdraw Gunner, you are an expert in engaging your opponent before they even prepare their weapons. Not only are your marksman skills incredibly fast, but you aspire to stand out amongst the crowd, flexing your talents.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw Style
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, you become adept in the Quickdraw style. While wielding two Light firearms, you can engage in two-weapon fighting and add your Dexterity Modifier to the damage of your off hand firearm. For each ranged attack you make with a firearm on your turn, your movement speed is increased by 5ft until the end of the turn. You can reload one handed ranged weapons while your hands are full.

subclassFeature.name: Revolver Progression
entries: As your skills improve, you learn to modify your Revolvers. As your Gun Tier levels up, both of your weapons are upgraded into its next tier by paying for the upgrade cost and spending 1 hour using your Gunsmith's Tools. If you lose or need to replace your special firearms, you can spend 1 hour per Tier it was by crafting a new pair, and the combined gold cost. Both of the dual firearms the Quickdraw gains from this class can be equipped with unique Modifications. Though Revolvers can be crafted together, they are treated as individual weapons for things such as Rare Metal Crafting, Enchanting, etc.

subclassFeature.name: The Travelling Gun
entries: At 2nd level, you become a showboat for your skills. You gain proficiency with Performance or Land Vehicles, or if you already have this, you instead gain proficiency with another skill from the Gunner class skill list.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Quickdraws gain access to new modifications which do not count against their known Modifications. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw Showdown
entries: At 6th level, you become incredibly fast at unholstering your weapons. You have advantage on Initiative Rolls, and can take out a firearm or a pair of light firearms as a free action on your first turn in combat. Furthermore, attacking a creature who is yet to act in initiative gives you the upper hand, causing your attacks to deal additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Lightning Round
entries: At 10th level, your Quickdraw skills are impeccable. When initiative is rolled, you can expend a use of Shoot to Thrill, and then immediately equip a Light firearm make one ranged firearm attack with that weapon at a creature within range. If the attack hits, it is treated as a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot To Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enhanced. It can now be used as a Free Action.

subclassFeature.name: Drop N' Dance
entries: At 14th level, you gain superhuman accuracy to bully your foes. Before making a ranged firearm attack, you can declare it as Make it Drop or Make it Dance.

entries.name: Make It Drop
entries: If the attack hits, the target suffers no damage, but instead drops a held item in their possession of your choice. Additionally, the hit creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC is equal to 8 + the Tier of the firearm you are using x2), and on a fail, the hit limb is injured and cannot be used until the end of that creature's next turn.

entries.name: Make it Dance
entries: If the attack hits, you fire at the target creature's feet. The target must make a Wisdom Saving throw (DC is equal to 8 + the Tier of the firearm you are using x2), and on a fail are forced to Dance in place until the end of their next turn. Creatures immune to the frightened condition are immune to this feature. Using this ability empties all bullets loaded in a weapon you are holding.
A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Perch
entries: At 2nd level, you become adept at hiding your position. By spending a minute preparing your position and making a Stealth check, you are not automatically revealed to enemy creatures after attacking them with a Sniper firearm. You remain hidden from enemies that are further than 30ft away from you as long as you do not move from this position. You can also take the Hide Action as a Bonus Action.

subclassFeature.name: Sniper Archetype
entries: Sitting at the highest point, a slender barrel watches its target. A single shot tears through their sky, as the target falls. The barrel slinks back into the shadows, away from sight.

subclassFeature.name: Sniper Progression
entries: As your skills improve, you learn to modify your Sniper. As your Gun Tier levels up, your weapon is upgraded into its next tier by paying for the upgrade cost and spending 1 hour using your Gunsmith's Tools. If you lose or need to replace your special firearm, you can spend 1 hour per Tier it was crafting a new one, and the combined gold cost.

entries.caption: Sniper Firearms
rows: two handed, semi auto, sniper, clip 10
two handed, semi auto, standard, sniper, clip 12

subclassFeature.name: Sniper's Eye
entries: When you choose this archetype at 2nd level, your accuracy is enhanced. You gain proficiency in Perception, or if you already have this, you gain proficiency in another skill from the Gunner's skill list.

subclassFeature.name: Calm Mind
entries: At 6th level, you learn to remain calm in the heat of battle, which aids your aim. You may add your Wisdom Modifier to your to-hit bonus of Sniper firearms. You can use this ability only if you do not move during your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sniper Modifications
entries: At 6th level, Snipers gain access to new modifications which do not count against their known Modifications. You gain the Tier 2 modification at 10th level, and the Tier 3 modification at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Rounds
entries: At 10th level, your bullets can pierce through creatures. You can expend a use of Shoot to Thrill as a Bonus Action, and for this turn if you hit a creature with a ranged attack with a firearm, the attack continues in a line beyond the target. You use your initial attack roll, add 10 and then subtract the enemy's AC. If this attack hits a creature behind them, they take the same damage as the initial target. This continues in a line until the bullet reaches a wall or enters its long range.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot to Thrill Improvement
entries: At 10th level, your Shoot to Thrill feature is enchanced. When you use Shoot to Thrill, you immediately gain the benefits of Calm Mind or your Hidden Perch, ignoring its prerequisite. You can only select Hidden perch if you are already hiding or hidden.

subclassFeature.name: Headshot
entries: At 14th level, your sniper skills are immaculately accurate and deadly. When using your Hidden Perch, your first ranged attack with a firearm against each creature deals double damage. This extra damage can be applied to the same creature once per hour.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Nature
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can interweave your strikes with your elemental attacks. When using Flurry of Blows, you can instead cast a Spell on the Four Elements List.
Additionally, spell attack rolls you make can use your Dexterity or Wisdom Modifier to calculate the to-hit bonus when using a spell on the Four Elements list.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you augment your martial arts with the ability to cast spells. See Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for this subclass' spell list.

You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Four Elements spell list. You learn an additional cantrip at 10th level. Additionally, you learn two of the following cantrips: Shape Water, Mold Earth, Gust or Produce Flame.

The Four Elements Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know a 1st-level spell and have a 1st level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast that spell using either slot.
You know three 1st-level Elemental spells of your choice.

The Spells Known column of the Four Elements Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. These spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell of your choice from the Four Elements spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Four Elements 2.0
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the elements. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body. Some members of this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, but others weave the elements together.

subclassFeature.name: Balance
entries: At 6th level, through your connection to the elements and Ki, you can intertwine your powers. You gain access to new ways to empower your strikes. When you take the attack action, choose one of the following. You can only use one effect once per turn.

items: Stream of Air. A creature hit by this strike must make a Strength save against you Monk DC, and on a fail be moved 10ft in a direction of your choice.
Force of Earth. A creature hit by this attack must make a dexterity save against your DC, and on a fail become grappled as stone envelops them. This lasts until the end of their next turn.
Fangs of Fire. A creature hit by this attack additional fire damage equal to your Martial Arts die.
Whips of Water. Your unarmed attacks this turn gain an additional 5ft reach.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Force
entries: At 11th level, your magic can be enhanced with your Ki. Whenever you would cast a spell, you can expend a Ki point to upcast the spell by a level.

subclassFeature.name: Cataclysm of Nature
entries: At 17th level, your control over the Elements is at its peak. Once per day, you can cast one of the following spells without expending a spell slot, or having them on your spell list. You can expend a number of Ki points equal to the level of that spell to do so again.
Bones of The Earth, Cone of Cold, Immolation, Investiture of Flame, Investiture of Ice, Maelstrom, Wall of Stone, Wind Walk.

subclassFeature.name: Guide Thy Hand
entries: At 3rd level, you learn how to seamlessly weave unarmed strikes and ranged attacks. When you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you don’t suffer disadvantage on ranged attacks if a creature is within 5ft of you until the end of your turn. In addition, when you take the Flurry of Blows bonus action, you can replace the two unarmed strikes with one ranged weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the God Hand
entries: A crack of gunpowder and smoke briefly illuminate a figure draped in gray and red. As the bullet leave the figure's firearm, it whizzes towards the bandit hiding behind the overturned carriage. A sigh of relief leaves the bandit’s lungs as the bullet passes them by. Suddenly there is a flash of gold from behind them. They turn just in time to see a golden spectral hand slam into the bullet's path, deflecting it right back into the bandit. Reeling from the impact, the bandit stragglers back, right into the gray figure that has approached in the interim. With a swift chop of their hand, the bandit crumples to the ground.

Those trained in the techniques of the God Hand can extend their fists and feet beyond their body, using it to guide and deflect projectiles. While most monks focus on being up close and personal, those of the God Hand command the battlefield from any position with deadly projectiles and waiting fists.

entries.subclassFeature: Weapons of the God Hand|Monk|PHB|God Hand|TftJC|3

subclassFeature.name: Weapons of the God Hand
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn mastery of all forms of ranged weaponry. You gain proficiency in all simple or martial weapons that have the Range property, as well as proficiency in firearms. Any ranged weapon (excluding the longbow) that does not have the heavy property can be a monk weapon for you.
In addition, you learn the {@spell mage hand|PHB} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action.

Once per turn, you can replace one of your unarmed attacks to be made at a creature within 5ft of your Mage Hand, but using Wisdom instead of Strength or Dexterity. The Mage Hand can also be used to make attacks of opportunity, using your reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Deflecting Hand
entries: At 6th level, while you have your mage hand active you can use your Deflect Missiles feature when any ally is hit within the range of your mage hand. When you deflect missiles in this way you reduce the damage by 1d4+your Wisdom modifier+your monk level. If the damage is reduced to zero, you can spend ki as normal to redirect the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Path
entries: At 6th level, you learn to manipulate the path of projectiles you fire. Once per turn, when you hit with a ranged weapon attack, you deal additional damage on the attack equal to a roll of your martial arts die. In addition, when you make a ranged weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki to make the attack ignore 1⁄2 or 3⁄4 cover or 2 ki to ignore total cover and remove any disadvantage that would affect the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Fist of the Gods
entries: At 11th level, once per long rest you can expend 4 ki points to cast the bigby’s hand spell. While concentrating on this spell, you can use your Deflecting Hand ability with the range of bigby’s hand rather than mage hand.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Bullets
entries: At 11th level, when you replace your Flurry of Blow attacks with ranged weapon attacks, you can make two instead of one. Whenever you make an unarmed strike, you can ignore the loading property of a weapon you are holding, reload one firearm, or attempt to repair one firearm.

subclassFeature.name: Hand of God
entries: At 17th level, once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack you may immediately make one unarmed attack roll against them, as long as they are within the ranged weapon’s range, and you can see them.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Stance
entries: At 3rd level, you can enter various stances to augment your combat. As a Bonus Action, you can enter a stance. A Stance ends after a minute without taking or dealing damage. Once per turn on your turn, you can expend one Ki point to enter a stance or switch your stance as a Free Action.

entries.name: Hunter Stance
entries: Your first attack you make each turn has advantage.Creatures have disadvantage on Opportunity attacks made against you when you move out of their reach.

entries.name: Graceful Stance
entries: You gain a bonus to your Dexterity Saving Throws equal to your Wisdom Modifier. When Dodging, you can add your proficiency Bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Titan Stance
entries: Once per turn, when dealing damage to a creature with an unarmed strike or a Monk weapon, you can force that creature to make a Wisdom Saving Throw against your Monk DC, and on a fail, they are frightened of you until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Spirit
entries: As the lands grow older and the people move further away from the ancient ways, those who practise the Way of the Spirit hang behind and preserve their sacred stances. They channel the powers of long forgotten spirits, who guide their techniques.

Practitioners of the Way of the Spirit are masters of Spirit Stances, powerful cumulation of Spirit energy that embolden their physical abilities. Monks of this Tradition may have spiritual animals guide their movements, or even powerful demons who may be bound to the order.

subclassFeature.name: Stance Shift
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can more fluidly change stances. After using your Flurry of Blows, you can immediately change or enter a stance. Upon exiting a stance, you gain a bonus based on the stance you have exited.

entries.name: Hunter Stance
entries: Until the end of your next turn, your walking speed is increased by 15 ft, and you have advantage on Dexterity based Stealth Checks.

entries.name: Graceful Stance
entries: You can remove one of the following effects on yourself: Blinded, Restrained, Grappled, Poisoned.

entries.name: Titan Stance
entries: Your next attack with an Unarmed Strike or a Monk Weapon deals additional damage equal to your Monk Level.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Connection
entries: At 11th level, you connect further to the spirit realm. You learn the {@spell Speak With Dead|PHB} spell, and can cast it by expending 2 Ki points.

Furthermore, each time you complete a long rest, you can channel the power of the spirits to protect you from harm. Select either Radiant, Necrotic, Psychic or Force damage.You gain resistance to that damage type until you complete your next long rest. As an Action, you can also spend 2 Ki points to change this resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Brothers
entries: At 17th level, you gain mastery over your stances, and can spread their power.

Whenever you change into a new stance, you can provide the effect of that stance granted by the Spirit Stance and Stance Shift to a creature of your choice within 30ft of you. That creature uses your Monk level and Monk Save DC for any abilities.

Also, whenever you would change your stance, you can choose the same stance you are currently in, Awakening the stance. This still counts as changing stances. If you Awaken a stance, you gain the following effects along side the effects granted from Spirit Stance.

entries.name: Hunter Stance, Awaken
entries: Your Critical Strike range is increased by 1, and your Extra Attack feature gains an additional attack.

entries.name: Graceful Stance, Awaken
entries: Your Strength and Dexterity, or Wisdom and Charisma Score increases by 5, up to a maximum of 30.

entries.name: Titan Stance, Awaken
entries: You take reduced damage from all sources equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this Oath at 3rd level, you gain access to two new channel divinity options.

entries.name: Fervor
entries: As an Action, you ignite a weapon you are holding with Holy Fervor. It becomes magical for purposes of damage against other creatures. Select either Fire or Radiant damage. For the next minute, at the start of your turn your weapon grows in power. It deals an additional 1 Radiant or Fire damage (your choice when you first activate this ability). This bonus continues to add on at the start of each of your turns (up to a maximum of 10), and is lost when you fall unconscious or after a minute passes.

entries.name: Leaping Flames
entries: As a Bonus Action, you imbue a melee weapon within 30ft of you that you can see with Flames. For the next minute, the wielder's body is engulfed in flames, granting them a +10 to all Intimidation (Charisma) checks they make. The wielder can end this effect early if they choose by using the flames to empower a weapon attack. The next melee weapon attack they make with the flaming weapon gains an additional 30 ft of reach. Then, all creatures within 5ft of the target creature (including the target creature) take fire damage equal to your Charisma Modifier. The adjacent creatures also take additional Fire damage equal to the weapon's damage die.The flames are ended after the attack is made, the weapon is dropped or stowed, or a minute passes.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Divine Justice
entries: Following the belief that all creatures fall under one law, Paladins of Divine Justice act as Judge,Jury and Executioner for those who dare break said law.
Paladins under the Oath of Divine Justice strike forth with Holy Fire, burning all evil in their path to a perfect world, at any cost.

entries.subclassFeature: Oath of Divine Justice Spells|Paladin|PHB|Divine Justice|TftJC|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Divine Justice
entries: None are free from Judgement. Any and all living creatures are under your law. You uphold this law at any cost.
Purify in Flames. Impure Creatures are to be burned with Holy Fire, as to cleanse their filth from this world.
Hope for a Brighter Tomorrow. Every action you make is in the name of a better future for all, as long as they too live under your law.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Arclight
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain 60ft of darkvision that can see through magical darkness.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Fire
entries: At 15th level, your strikes intertwine in Holy Fire. Whenever you would deal Fire Damage, you deal additional radiant damage equal to your Charisma Modifier. Also, whenever you deal Radiant Damage, you deal additional Fire Damage equal to your Charisma Modifier. This effect cannot activate off of itself.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Judge
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of a Divine Judge.Your form becomes cloaked in Holy Light that burns to the eye, and may adopt other features such as a Flaming Halo or Golden Armor.
As an Action, you undergo a transformation and gain the following benefits. This transformation lasts a minute, or until you fall unconscious.

items: You become under the effects of Fervor and LeapingFlames. If you are already under one or both effects, they end first and afterwards are applied. All creatures of your choice within your Aura of Arclight also gain the benefits of Leaping Flames.
You gain a Hover Speed equal to your walking speed.
You can use the Dash Action as a Bonus Action, provided you are approaching a hostile creature.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this Oath at 3rd level, you gain access to two new channel divinity options.

entries.name: Relinquish
entries: As an action, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to break an effect keeping someone trapped in place. One effect of your choice within 30 feet that is causing a creature to have their movement reduced or be grappled, restrained, paralyzed, petrified or stunned ends immediately.

entries.name: Crushing Might
entries: As part of an attack against an inanimate object, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to have the attack be a critical hit and deal bonus damage equal to your Paladin Level.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Liberation
entries: Rumors travel of a lone warrior fighting corruption chain by chain. Freeing slaves ,destroying prisons, all in a days work for those under the Oath of Liberation
Paladins under the Oath of Liberation detest anything that would prevent their freedom with a burning passion, destroying walls, blockades and soldiers that would stand in their way with impunity.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Liberation
entries: Break the Chains. Free all those imprisoned, bound and restrained.
Death before Bondage. You shall never be captured against your will, and will die trying to free yourself and others.
Lead by Example. Show those around you the pleasures of freedom and teach others how to keep themselves free.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Juggernaut
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and any friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on Strength saving throws, and can spend 5 feet of movement on their turn to escape an effect that has them grappled or restrained.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Strike the Foundations
entries: At 15th level, your strikes break the foundations. Any weapon you are wielding is treated as having the siege property. Additionally, after you or a friendly creature within 30ft of you succeeds on a Saving Throw against having their movement reduced or set to 0, they gain advantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of their turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arbiter of Freedom
entries: At 20th level, you can fully enhance your Liberation abilities. As an action, you can transcend the barriers of reality for 1minute, giving you and creatures of your choice within 30 feet the following properties:

items: You can choose to ignore all magical restrictions and qualifications on spells based on creature type or description, such as those on antilife shell, hallow or glyph of warding.

You can move through solid terrain at half speed. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this or a similar effect is no longer active for you, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.
You have resistance to all damage but force.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this Oath at 3rd level, you gain access to two new channel divinity options.

entries.name: Mask Change
entries: You can conduct a 1 hour Ritual with a set of Armor you are wearing, a weapon and optionally a shield. These items then disappear and are stored inside a pocket dimension inside of your Holy Symbol. Then as a Bonus Action, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity to summon these items and immediately equip them. After doing so, all creatures within10ft of you must make a Constitution Saving Throw, and on a fail take 2d8 Thunder Damage and are shoved 10ft away from you, or half as much on a successful save and are not moved. This damage increases by 1d8 at 5th, 9th, 13th and17th level. You can dismiss these items back into your Holy Symbol as a Free Action.
You can use this ability without expending a use of ChannelDivinity, but it then requires an Action to use, and deals no damage nor does it push away nearby creatures.

entries.name: Explosive Finisher
entries: After dealing Thunder or Force Damage, you can use your Reaction to expend a use of Channel Divinity to finish your opponent. You move your movement to a creature that took the damage, without provoking attacks of opportunity, then immediately make a melee attack against them. If that attack hits, it is treated as a Divine Smite at the highest level for which you have spell slots. If this damage leaves the creature with hit points equal to or less than your Paladin Level, they are finished off (you can decide lethal or non lethal). Regardless of hitting the target or not, the target is knocked prone.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Masked Rider Spells

entries.caption: Masked Rider Spells
rows: Freedom of Movement, Wall of Fire

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Masked Rider
entries: As villains run wild and monsters destroy the city ,a brave warrior steps up from the crowd. Brilliant armor coalesces around them, as an imposing Mask covers their face. They race off to any challenge in their path, as onlookers cheer for the spectacle.
Paladins under the Oath of the Masked Rider dash forth in blazing explosions, defeating evil with style, flair and loud kabooms.

entries.subclassFeature: Oath of the Masked Rider Spells|Paladin|PHB|Masked Rider|TftJC|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Masked Rider
entries: Masked Identity. Many Masked Riders keep their identity hidden, as they are meant to be a symbol to the people.
Inspire Hope. Your feats are meant to inspire those around you to one day take up the Mask and carry on your legacy.
Heroics are all but Silent. Defeating a foe should be a spectacle, marked with explosions and high flying stunts.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Blasting
entries: Starting at 7th level, whenever you or friendly creatures within 10ft of you forcibly move a hostile creature, that creature takes 1d8 thunder damage. This damage can only be done once per turn, per creature.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Virtuous Blasts
entries: At 15th level, your resolve causes explosive force to emanate from you. Whenever you would succeed on a Saving Throw, you can make all creatures within 5ft of you take Thunder damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Masked Champion
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of a Masked Champion. Your armor may become golden, your strikes moving faster than the eye can see, or your explosions shine off golden light. As an Action, you gain the following features.This lasts for 1 minute, or until knocked unconscious.

items: Upon activating the ability, you can immediately use your Mask Change Channel Divinity (this does not expend the use of your Channel Divinity). If you are already wearing your armor, it remains and instead you only deal the damage and the shove effect. When used in this way, it deals double the damage die.
Using your Explosive Finisher Channel Divinity does not expend your Channel Divinity if that attack would finish the creature hit.
Whenever you would deal Thunder Damage to a single creature, all other creatures within 10ft of that creature take the same amount of damage. This effect cannot activate off of itself.

entries: You can use this feature once per Long Rest, or by expending a 5th level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this Oath at 3rd level, you gain access to two new channel divinity options.

entries.name: Rebuke the Hunted.
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer of rebuke, using your Channel Divinity. Every creature of your chosen Slayer's Quarry within 60 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw, unless it is immune to being frightened. Fiends and undead are also affected. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. While frightened, the creature is paralyzed. On a successful save, the creature cannot take reactions this turn.

entries.name: Slay Thy Hate.
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike an especially deadly blow. When you hit with a weapon attack you can use your Channel Divinity to double your weapon's damage dice.If the target of the attack is also your Slayer's Quarry you add half your paladin level to the damage as well (minimum 1).

entries.caption: Slayer Spells
rows: locate plants or animals, see invisibility

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Slayer
entries: Sometimes a warrior will come across dangers that go well beyond the handling of mundane warriors. Dragons, demons, giants, fey, whatever supernatural threat befalls the people of world the Slayers are there to take up the fight. Many religious orders have their own sect of Slayers dedicated to eradicating the evil of their beliefs.
Most Slayers are trained from a young age to fight the target of their quarry. By the time they reach maturity hunting their quarry is not just their mission, it is their life.

A Slayer’s Quarry has a profound impact on a Slayer's fighting style and lifestyle. A giant hunter might use a polearm and a sling to poke and prod their quarry until they succumb. Dragon slayers might use heavy armor, heavy shields, and a large sword to protect themselves from their target’s flames and claws. The way a Slayer fights, acts, and lives, all serve to make them the ultimate opponent for the thing they hunt.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Slayer
entries: Shelter the Hunted. Aid those that are harmed by your quarry and the forces of evil.
Quell your Quarry. Seek out your quarry wherever they may hide and show no mercy in quelling their plots.
Restore the Broken. A slayers job does not end when the quarry is dead. Help tore build that which has been broken by evil.

subclassFeature.name: Slayer’s Protection
entries: Starting at 7th level, you project an aura that protects those around you from the attacks from your Slayer's Quarry.Whenever a fiend, undead, or your Slayer’s Quarry forces a creature that benefits from your Aura of Protection class feature to make a saving throw they can add a 1d4 to the roll.A number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier can benefit from this effect at once.
At 18th level, the d4 increases to a d6.

subclassFeature.name: Blood of the Hunt
entries: At 15th level, whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. In addition, when you reduce a fiend, undead, or your Slayer’s Quarry to 0 hit points you may take an additional action. Once you use this secondary effect you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Slayer
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you can empower your body to become the perfect hunter. Your body adapts to better hunt the Quarry of your oath. The transformation lasts 1 minute.You gain the following benefits:

items: You make any saving throws against your Quarry at advantage. In addition, if they force you to make Dexterity saving throws you take half damage on a failed save, and no damage on a success.
You are immune to the fear and charmed conditions.

Whenever a creature, other than you, succeeds on a saving throw while benefiting from your Slayer’sProtection the creature that forced them to make the saving throw takes psychic damage equal to yourCharisma Modifier.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Burning Strikes
entries: At 3rd level, your strikes have been enhanced with a divine cleansing flame. Once per turn you can deal 1d8 extra fire damage on one of your attacks or spells. This damage ignores resistance if the target is also your favored foe/enemy. When you reach level 11 in this class the extra damage increases to 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Devastator Conclave
entries: Most ranger conclaves strike a balance between the protection of civilization and the conservation of nature but not those of the Devastator conclave. For these rangers their mission is only total, indiscriminate, and inescapable destruction. Devastators are shunned by most conclaves and especially by druids who see their ways as nothing more than primitive destruction. In truth Devastators use their vast destructive powers only rarely, when all other methods have failed.

subclassFeature.name: Devastator's Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Devastator Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Devastator's Tools
entries: At 3rd level, you’ve been trained with the tools needed to cleanse nature. You gain proficiency in firearms (if they exist in your setting) in addition, you learn the firebolt and produce flame cantrips, and they are ranger spells for you.
You learn the spell burning hands and can cast it once per day without expending a spell slot. When you cast it using this feature, it is cast with a spell slot equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Seeking Flames
entries: At 7th level, when you use your Burning Strikes your flames also jump to a number of other creatures nearby within 10 feet up to your proficiency modifier. Each target takes the same amount of fire damage rolled on your d8 from Burning Strikes.

subclassFeature.name: Devastator of Nature
entries: At 11th level you’ve become a flaming visage of destruction against natural forces. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell or attack that creature explodes in a flurry of fire, dealing 2d8 + your proficiency modifier to all creatures other than you in 10 feet.

In addition, difficult terrain caused by plants, magical or otherwise, disappears permanently if you move into its square as the plants shrivel and die in your presence. You gain immunity to spells of levels under your proficiency bonus that use plants, such as entangle or thorn whip.

subclassFeature.name: Flame of Destruction
entries: At 15th level, you can conjure a powerful flame of destruction and all of your fires burn with a destructive fury. You learn the investiture of flame spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot.

In addition, once per turn when you deal fire damage to a creature that creature must make a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check they make before the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Miraculous Recovery
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your wounds heal quicker than others. Whenever you would make a Death Saving Throw, you can choose to instantly become stabilized, then regain a number of hit points equal to your Ranger Level. You can only do so once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor Conclave
entries: Wandering alone in the wastelands, a warrior who has faced death countless times persists.Though resources are scares, the light fades and hope looks grim, they know they will survive. Rangers of the Survivor Conclave do everything in their power to persist through unthinkable dangers and ridiculous conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Survivor Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Wasteland Diet
entries: At 3rd level, your magic helps feed you and others. You learn {@spell Goodberry} (it does not count against your spells known), at the end of a Long Rest you generate a number of berries equal to your Ranger Level. You can also consume a number of goodberries as a free action each turn equal to your proficiency bonus. If you eat a goodberry and your health is full, you instead gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier. Once on your turn, when you would make an attack and you currently have temporary hit points, you can remove all of them to have that attack deal an additional {@dice 1d6} of damage.
At 7th level, when you cast {@spell Goodberry} in this way, one berry in the bunch becomes golden. A golden berry cures a disease or the poisoned condition affecting the creature of your choice.
At 11th level, a golden berry can remove a point of exhaustion instead.
A creature can only benefit from a golden goodberry once per day.

subclassFeature.name: Rugged Resilience
entries: At 7th level, your body adapts to harsher environments. You gain proficiency in Constitution Saving Throws. If you already have this, then you can become proficient in either Strength or Dexterity saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Scrap Crafting
entries: At 7th level, you can create weapons on the fly. You can spend 1 minute taking raw material, such as metal, wood, stone, or similar things to craft items. You can create shields, simple and martial weapons, so long as you have proficiency in those weapons and the appropriate materials. The weapons fall apart into their raw materials after a day of use.
At 11th level, Scrap weapons you create are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities when you wield them.
At 15th level, Scrap weapons you create have jagged edges. Scrap weapons have their critical strike range increased, and critically hit on a 19 and 20 when you wield them.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Medic
entries: At 11th level, you can heal your wounds on the fly. If you drop to 0 hit points and don’t die outright, you can use your reaction to make a DC 15 Medicine Check. If you succeed,you drop to 1 hit point instead.
Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.

subclassFeature.name: Doom Designator
entries: At 15th level, you have escaped death so many times that it has left a supernatural effect on you. As an action, designate a creature within 60ft of you that you can see. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your Spell SaveDC. On a fail, they are doomed. The world around them begins to react to their impending doom, with things such as buzzards flocking around them or clerics adverting their eyes.If the creature has more than 100 hit points, they gain a point of exhaustion for every hour that passes, ending after the 6th hour. If they have fewer than 100 hit points, they instantly reach 6 points of exhaustion. A creature that dies by this ability becomes dust.

If a creature passes this saving throw, they are immune to you using this ability on them for the next 2d4+4 days. This ability can be used once per long rest. A Doomed creature can be saved by having Remove Curse cast on them anywhere at or above 7th level.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you choose this Conclave at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Investigation, Perception, Nature, Sleight of Hand, Survival. You also learn a Language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: On the Go!
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you're always in a hurry to get to what comes next. You have advantage on Initiative Rolls. You can take the Dash action as a Bonus Action. Furthermore, once per turn if you move your full movement on your turn, you deal an additional 1d6 damage. You must have moved to deal this bonus damage.

Finally, whenever entering a location you have never been,you become quickly accustomed to the land. You have advantage on Wisdom and Intelligence checks that you make to discover more information about this location. This bonus lasts a number of hours equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Wayward Conclave
entries: With a gleam in their eye and adventure on the horizon, a traveler sets out on an epic quest. Monsters to be encountered and friends to be met, oh the fun you will have!

Rangers in the Wayward Conclave explore the open road and refuse to be tied down. With their rapid teleportation and eagerness to brave the unknown, a Wayward Conclave Ranger makes sure the journey matters just as much as the destination.

subclassFeature.name: Wayward Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the WaywardSpells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Can't Be Tied Down
entries: At 7th level, your ability to slip away becomes unmatched. You have advantage on Saving Throws and ability checks against being grappled, restrained, or effects that would lower your speed. Furthermore, you learn the Far Step spell, and can cast it once per short or long rest without spending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: A New Adventure Awaits
entries: At 11th level, you can follow creatures that try to go off on their own. Whenever a creature within 30ft of you casts a spell with the Teleportation tag, or uses an ability that causes them to Teleport, you can use your reaction to teleport to where ever they arrive alongside them. You appear in the nearest space to the target creature. You can do this a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier per Long Rest.

At 17th level, you can bring up to three willing creatures within 30ft of the creature teleporting. Any additional creature brought by this effect also appears in a random space within 30ft of the target creature.

subclassFeature.name: Places to be
entries: At 15th level, you can easily get to where ever you need to be in a battle. As a Bonus Action, you can teleport up to 150ft. Your next attack this turn has advantage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Luck Cutter
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to cut away the luck of your enemies and use it for yourself. When you hit a creature and use your Sneak Attack roll {@dice 2d4} and deal additional damage equal to the number rolled, in addition subtract it from that creatures next attack roll or saving throw and you add the number rolled to the first attack roll or saving throw you make. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.
The bonus from this ability increases to {@dice 2d6} at level 5, {@dice 2d8} at level 9, {@dice 2d10} at level 13, and {@dice 2d12} at level 17.

subclassFeature.name: Luckthief
entries: Lesser thieves may steal things like gems, or coins, or identities and while those are within their grasp a Luck Thief concerns themselves with a greater prize, a person’s luck. This ancient art was said to have been founded by an order of mystics who experimented on their assassins to make perfect killers that could cut the cords of fate of their enemies forcing them into a downward spiral of misfortune. Others say that the ability is something inherent, a gift of the bloodline. Others still say it is a blessing from the god of luck. The true origin of this skill is impossible to pin down but the skills of those that wield it is renowned.

Luck Thieves can steal the fortune from their enemies causing them to then fall into disadvantageous positions. Not only that but they are also able to shape their own fate by stealing glances of their future to avoid getting caught in their behavior. The greatest of them are even able to share this wealth with their allies, stealing fortune not just for themselves but for their allies as well.

subclassFeature.name: Watcher of Fate
entries: When you take this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the bless and bane spells and can cast each of them once without expending a spell slot before having a long rest. Your Wisdom is your spell save ability for these spells.

subclassFeature.name: Bend Fate
entries: At 9th level, you can directly gaze upon and influence the fates around you. You gain the divination spell and can use it once without needing material components or expending a spell slot before having a long rest. When you use this ability, you can then reroll one attack roll, saving throw, or attack roll you make in the next 24 hours, you must use the new result.

subclassFeature.name: Share the Fortune
entries: At 13th level, you can choose to share your luck with your allies. When you use your Luck Cutter ability you can choose to forgo the bonus on your own roll to instead grant advantage to the first saving throw or attack roll of any number of creatures within 30ft of you made within the next minute.

subclassFeature.name: Sever the Thread
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to deal a greater wound to someone’s luck. When you use your Luck Cutter ability you can forgo the bonus and instead choose to cause the next attack roll against the target to be a 20 on the die, and the next attack roll against you to be a 1 on the die. Once you use this ability you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 3rd level, you also adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Blind Fighting
entries: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in total darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and on other weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon. In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Ninjutsu Techniques
entries: At 3rd level, you learn ancient techniques of Ninjutsu. You learn two of these Techniques at 3rd level, and you can use these Techniques a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest. You learn a new Techniques that require a saving throw is calculated by 8 + Prof Bonus + INT modifier.

entries.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: As a Bonus Action, you create an explosion of Fog in a 10ft radius around you, which heavily obscures the area. You also become invisible until the start of your next turn, or attack or cast a spell.

entries.name: Flash Bomb
entries: As a Bonus Action, you throw a Flash Bomb at an area within 60 ft. All creatures within a 15 ft radius of the explosion must make a Constitution Saving Throw (DC = 8 + prof + INT) or be blinded for a number of rounds equal to your Proficiency Bonus. Creatures blinded by this can repeat the Constitution Saving Throw at the ends of their turn, removing the effect on a Successful Save. If you have a free hand when you throw the bomb, you can use it to guard your eyes, granting you advantage on the Saving Throw if you are within the radius.

entries.name: Shadow Clone
entries: As a Bonus Action, you apparat a shadowy version of you, moving in and out of your space. For the next minute, if you would be attacked, the attacker must roll 1d20. On a 9 or lower, the clone is hit instead of you, which destroys the clone if the attack meets your AC.

entries.name: Grappling Swing
entries: As a Bonus Action, you gain a Fly speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn, provided there is terrain or structures to grapple to within 60ft of you. If you end your turn in the air, you immediately fall, suffering fall damage as normal.

entries.name: Acupuncture Dart
entries: As a Bonus Action, you throw a single dart at a creature within 30ft. Make a Ranged attack roll against that creature, and on a hit they take 1 piercing damage and must make a Constitution Saving throw against the Stunned Condition. On a fail, they are stunned until the end of their turn.

entries.name: Shadow Binding
entries: As a Bonus Action, you target a creature that is in dim light or darkness within 30ft. Shadowy arms grab the creature, they must then make a Strength Saving Throw or become restrained until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ninjutsu
entries: A branch into the days of old, practicians of the Art of Ninjutsu hone their skills and mind though rigorous training, day and night.

You have studied the ways of the Ninja. Your abilities of stealth and reconnaissance are unparalleled. Whether it be in a clan of fellow Ninja or that of a lone warrior, nothing will stop you from completing your mission

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Specialist
entries: At 3rd level, you can pull from a larger set of weapons compared to most Rogues. You gain proficiency in Martial Weapons. You also gain proficiency in two special weapons, the Katana and the Throwing Star.

entries.name: Katana
entries: A Katana costs 30gp and has the following stat block: melee, reach 5ft, finesse, special, 1d8 slashing, versatile. It weights 2lbs.

entries.name: Throwing Star
entries: Throwing Stars cost 5sp for a group of 10 and has the following stat block: thrown, light, range 30/90, special, 1d4 piercing. They weight 0.25lbs.

items: After using a Throwing Star for your Attack Action, you can use your Bonus Action to throw an additional Star, provided you have another. You can hold up to three Stars in one hand at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble
entries: At 9th level, your ability to move is enhanced. Your walking speed increases by 10 ft, and you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. Your long jump distance is tripled and uses your Dexterity to calculate distance, instead of Strength.

subclassFeature.name: Preparedness
entries: At 9th level, whenever you roll initiative you regain an expended use of your Ninjutsu Techniques.

subclassFeature.name: Darkness Adaptation
entries: At 13th level, you gain 60ft of Darkvision the can see through Magical Darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Death Mark
entries: At 13th level, you can mark your targets for death. After dealing damage to a creature with your Sneak Attack, you can Death Mark them. While Death Marked, you know where your target is at all times (even if they are behind full cover) so long as they are within a mile of you. Additionally, attacking a target that is Death Marked can apply Sneak Attack, even without advantage or a nearby ally. Only one creature can be Death Marked at a time.

subclassFeature.name: You Are Already Dead
entries: At 17th level, your strikes can leave a lasting affect on unsuspecting targets. Once per Long rest, as an Action, you can attack a creature that you have Death Marked. That attack is considered a Critical Hit. That creature must make a Constitution Saving Throw (DC = 8 + prof + INT). On a fail, they take the maximum damage from your Sneak Attack dice.
The range of your Death Mark now covers the entire plane of existence you are on.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Gambler Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn’t count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Gambler
entries: A suave mage sits down at a table and opens a coin pouch. The buy in is high today, but the mage knows they have already won today, as magic flicks through their hands.

A Gambler specializes in utilizing their magic to shift things subtly in their favour, from battle to bets. Some choose to let fate take control of their fate, hedging their bets on their lady luck. Others bend these games to their wills, making sure its never fair when they place their bets.

subclassFeature.name: Game of Choice
entries: At 1st level, you become skilled in games. You gain proficiency in either cards, dice or dragon's chess. You can use game pieces from your selected game as an arcane focus. Additionally, based on your game selection, you gain an associated feature.

items: Blackjack (Cards).  Whenever you would roll a d20 for an attack roll, skill check or saving throw and after applying modifiers the result would be 21, you can immediately cast the Catapult Spell as a free action without requiring it known, prepared or without expending a spell slot. The object thrown must be a playing card

Weighted Die (Dice). Once per turn, whenever you would roll a d4, d6, d8, d10 or d12 as a part of a Sorcerer Spell of 1st level or higher, you can maximize the value on one of those die before the die is rolled.

Superior Strategist (Dragon's Chess). After casting a Divination, Enchantment or Illusion spell, you can immediately move a creature up to 10ft in a direction of your choice. If the creature is not willing, they must make a Strength Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC, and on a success are not moved.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Cheat
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency in the Deception or Sleight of Hand, or another skill from the Sorcerer's skill list if you already have these proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: Unfair Advantage
entries: At 6th level, you learn to intertwine your cheating magic with your Sorcerer abilities. Whenever you would cast a Divination, Enchantment or Illusion spell that is bolstered by your Metamagic, you can use one of the below features

items: Read their Eyes. You cast the Detect Thoughts spell as a free action and without expending a spell slot. You cannot probe deeper into the target's mind.
Stack you Hand. You gain advantage on the next skill check you would make in the next minute.

Call it. Before the next time you would roll a d20 in the next minute, you can call its value. If you are correct, you gain a Luck point, as detailed in the Lucky feat. This point goes away after completing a long rest.

Counting Cards (Cards). Within the next minute, you can grant up to a +3 bonus on the next skill check, spell attack roll or saving throw you would make (after the die is rolled, but before its result is known), so long as the next check of that type (attack roll, saving throw, skill check) gains a penalty equal to the value you selected.
Low Roller (Dice). As a reaction to a creature rolling d4s, d6s, d8s, d10s or d12s within the next minute, you can have them reroll those die and take the lower value.
Calculated Gambit (Dragon's Chess). You move yourself 15ft directly closer to a hostile creature, then you have advantage on the next spell attack roll you make against them within this minute.

subclassFeature.name: Rigged Game
entries: At 14th level, you learn to efficiently rig any game in your favour. You gain expertise in your game proficiency selected with Game of Choice. Furthermore, you learn a new ability you can use as a part of Unfair Advantage.

items: Rig the Game. The next time within the minute you or another creature would roll d4s, d6s, d8s, d10s or d12s, before the roll, you can change a number of those die up to your Proficiency Bonus into 1s or their maximum value.

subclassFeature.name: Just That Lucky
entries: At 18th level, your ability to influence luck is at its peak. As an Action, you can pull forth all of your magical power and transform it into pure Luck. For the next minute, you cannot gain disadvantage from any source and each time you would roll with advantage you can select a creature you can see within 120ft of you, they have disadvantage on the next saving throw they would make in the next minute. This effect can stack.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest, unless you spend 5 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
